detailedDescription:
Postmark marks one of the most unique, central London developments where the energetic, eclectic East meets the traditional, prestigious West.

Location

Sitting across two postcodes, WC1 and EC1, and surrounded by Farringdon, Clerkenwell, King's Cross and Chancery Lane, Postmark is at the epicentre of the leading creative, technology and knowledge industries and will be a symbol of connectivity.

Description

Delivering an inspiring new neighbourhood to the heart of London and built on the foundations of a global British icon, Postmark will bring new life to the historic flagship site of the Royal Mail postal service.

Signature Place, the second phase of this iconic development will comprise of 109 one, two and three bed apartments designed by acclaimed interior architects Conran + Partners. Residents will benefit from a gym, wellness centre with 18m swimming pool. 24-hour concierge service, private lounge, rooftop terrace and a beautifully landscaped courtyard situated in the centre of the development.

Square Footage: 914 sq ft

Leasehold with approximately 996 years remaining

title: 2 bed flat for sale

address: West End Lane, West Hampstead NW6
detailedDescription:
Very well presented four bedroom ground floor flat with own entrance and long lease, set within a well maintained portered purpose built block just moments from West Hamstead station and amenities. The property has been beautifully maintained, providing bright and spacious accommodation with modern interiors and high quality finish throughout. Features include a stunning reception room with decorative fireplace, separate well equipped metro-tiled kitchen, elegant family bathroom and separate WC, gas central heating, double glazing, original polished wood floors and access to well maintained communal gardens.

Accommodation comprises entrance hall with inbuilt storage, leading into the bright and spacious reception room with attractive fireplace surround and ample space for relaxing and dining. The separate kitchen, overlooking the communal gardens, comprises a modern range of matching white fronted wall and base units with work surfaces and metro tiling, incorporating inset sink unit, gas hob with overhead extractor and electric oven below, and further space for appliances. There are four well sized bedrooms - three doubles and a further single/study - plus a stylish family bathroom with white two piece bath suite and elegant tiling, and adjacent separate WC.

The property is very conveniently located within easy access of West Hampstead (with Thameslink, Jubilee line and overground services), as well as numerous regular bus routes providing excellent cross-London links. The area is also well served by fashionable shops, bars, cafes and restaurants in nearby West End Lane, with Hampstead Heath and Golders Hill Park also close-by for wonderful open recreational space. West Hampstead is also well served by a choice of excellent local schools.

To book a viewing instantly just visit our website or download our award-winning App.

Lease Information

We understand the lease on the property is 120 years remaining. All prospective purchasers are advised to make their own enquiries and verify this information with a solicitor.

Service Charges

We understand the service charge on the property is £2,400 per annum with ground rent of £250 per annum. All prospective purchasers are advised to make their own enquiries and verify this information with a solicitor.

detailedDescription:
Summary
auction sale 27 July 2021 - This property will be sold at auction to the best bid (subject to reserve). Auctions are an exciting and the most certain way you can buy. We hold sales every month. If you are buying for your occupation, development or investment we have lots for you to see.

Description
Long leasehold six storey extended building arranged as 6 flats
Investment

Location:
Situated on Cosway Street, to the north of Marylebone and Paddington, between Hyde Park and Regents Park. Transport options include road links via the A501, A40 and A5, local bus routes and a choice of Edgware Road London Underground or Marylebone Mainline and London Underground Stations. A range of shops, bars, restaurants and recreational activities can be found within Lisson Grove, St Johns Wood, Paddington, Marylebone and the West End. The property is ideally located with close proximity to
Kensington Palace, Buckingham Palace and The British Museum.

Description:
An extended six storey former house converted to provide six self-contained flats with a rear garden serving ground floor flat 6.

Accommodation (Approx 234m2/2,519 sq ft. Gross external):
Unit: Flat 1 Raised ground floor. Accommodation: One bedroom flat. Size (approx.): 301sqft/28m2. EPC: C
Unit: Flat 2 First floor. Accommodation: One bedroom, flat. Size (approx.): 342sqft/32m2. EPC: C
Unit: Flat 3 Second floor. Accommodation: One bedroom flat. Size (approx.): 341sqft/32m2. EPC: C
Unit: Flat 4 Third floor. Accommodation: One bedroom flat. Size (approx.): 344sqft/32m2 EPC: C
Unit: Flat 5 Fourth floor Accommodation: One bedroom flat. Size (approx.): 351sqft/33m2.. EPC: D
Unit: Flat 6 – Lower ground floor (garden). Accommodation: Two bedroom flat. Size (approx.): 535sqft/50m2 EPC: C

Tenancy:
Let to Crownmere Limited on an original lease for a term of 5 years from 1/7/2020 at an original rent of £140,000pa with a further agreement dated 1/4/2021 in agreement to reduce the rent to £100,000pa from this date to the 31/3/2022. Bidders to refer to the legal pack for copies of leases and agreements including consent from The Royal borough of Kensington and Chelsea for under lease.

Rent Reserved: £100,000 pa (due to revert back to £140,000pa from 1/4/2022)

Lease: Held on a lease for a term of 125 years from 29/06/1990 at a peppercorn ground rent.

Important Notice:
For each Lot, a contract documentation fee of £1,150 (inclusive of VAT) is payable to Barnard Marcus Auctions by the buyer. The seller may charge additional fees payable upon completion. If applicable, such fees are detailed within the Special Conditions of Sale. Buyers are deemed to bid in full knowledge of this.

The Guide Price quoted must not be relied upon by prospective purchasers as a valuation or assessment of value of the property. It is intended to provide purchasers with an indication of the region at which the reserve may be set at the time of going to press. The guide price may be subject to variation and interested parties are advised to make regular checks for variations and should be aware that the reserve price may be either below or above the quoted guide price.

Prospective purchasers should also be aware that the eventual sale price may be above or below the guide level dependent upon competition, and should therefore not presume the guide to be indicative of the final expected sale price or the price the property is available at.

When setting the guide price, the auctioneers have given consideration to the seller’s instructions in respect of their indicated reserve price at the time of instruction. The reserve price, (the level below which the property will not be sold), remains confidential between the seller and the auctioneer. The guide price therefore, is intended to indicate the region at which the reserve price is intended to be set. The seller will confirm their final reserve price close to the auction date and if appropriate the auctioneers may adjust the guide price to reflect this.
Whilst Barnard Marcus make every effort to ensure the safety and security of viewers at properties, we have not carried out a detailed Health & Safety inspection of properties in our auctions and cannot therefore guarantee the safety and security of viewers.
Prospective purchasers and bidders attend properties entirely at their own risk. Particular care should be taken when accessing cellars, attics, exterior grounds and outbuildings and boundaries. All non-conducted inspections of vacant sites should be made in daylight hours only and entry into such sites is entirely at the viewers risk.

A substantial semi-detached family house (3,453 Sq Ft 320.79 Sq M), with an 80’ garden, garage and a roof terrace with breathtaking panoramic views across London.

The property which has been in the same ownership for approximately 40 years affords generous living space optimised by the central staircase and retains many period features.

35’ interconnecting reception rooms * reception room 3 * kitchen * bedroom with ensuite dressing room & shower room * 7 further bedrooms (incl 6 doubles) * study * 2 bathrooms * shower room * guest cloak room * utility room * store  balcony * roof terrace with panoramic views across London * 80’ south east facing garden * garage * EPC - tbc

The South Hill Park Conservation Area is a greatly sought-after family neighbourhood, with no through-traffic, which literally abuts Hampstead Heath.

South End Green is close by, with a good mix of cafes, gastro pubs, neighbourhood restaurants and shops & delicatessens, including Marks & Spencer; while Hampstead Village is approximately 0.5 miles, a 10 minute stroll.

Hampstead Heath (London Overground Station) is a 2 minute walk. The nearest London Underground station is Belsize Park (Northern Line) is 0.7 miles. There are also frequent bus and night bus services from South End Green.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
** guide price £500,000 - £525,000 **

Stunning newly refurbished two bedroom ground floor flat set within a small purpose built block in a highly sought after Islington location with off-street parking space available, just moments from Caledonian Road station. Boasting a delightful wall enclosed west-facing private garden, and additional separate south-facing private patio area, the property provides bright and modern, open plan accommodation with stylish interiors throughout. Features include an impressive triple aspect reception room with skylight window and bi-folding doors onto the garden, well equipped kitchen area, elegant shower room, double glazing, wood effect flooring, and ample inbuilt storage.

Accommodation comprises a wide entrance hallway with inbuilt storage and sliding doors onto the patio area, flowing through into the bright and spacious, open plan triple aspect reception/kitchen, flooded with natural light from the skylight, windows and bi-folding doors which open onto the wall enclosed wrap-around garden. The room provides a superb space for both relaxing and dining, connecting with the kitchen area with the option of closing off with the in-wall pocket door for privacy. The kitchen area comprises a modern range of matching wall and base units with work surfaces incorporating inset sink unit, gas hob with overhead extractor, double wall mounted electric oven, and further space for appliances. There are two well sized interconnecting bedrooms - one with a large inbuilt wardrobe - plus a stylish shower room with modern walk-in shower suite and elegant tiling.

To book a viewing instantly just visit our website or download our award-winning App.

Location

The property is very conveniently located right next to Caledonian Park, within a short walk of Caledonian Road underground station and numerous regular bus routes providing excellent cross-London links. Highbury & Islington and Caledonian Rd & Barnsbury train stations are also within easy reach. Caledonian Road offers an array of amenities, with nearby Upper Street offering further stylish shops, bars and restaurants.

title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
This wonderful four-bedroom house is positioned on Leverton Place, a pretty cobbled street in the Kentish Town Conservation Area. It was the recent subject of an extensive renovation by McLaren Excell; unfolding over three floors, it has been beautifully reconfigured to create a space that is inviting and serene. Contrasting materials including concrete and walnut have been introduced, illuminated by natural light that pours through the skylights at the rear of the plan, one of which can be fully opened. A large roof terrace with running water and electricity, inspired by a Moroccan courtyard, is accessible via the first floor.

The Tour

The entrance opens to a beautifully bright open-plan kitchen, living and dining room, which has been thoughtfully laid out by the architects. The ground floor plan is versatile and capacious; at the front of the plan is the cosy living area, which seamlessly flows into a contemporary kitchen with concrete slab work surfaces and bespoke walnut joinery. Two large skylights allow natural light to stream through into the living spaces. The bespoke joinery and use of smooth poured concrete continues into this room, effectively hinging the spaces together. At the end of the space is a sculptural fireplace, which provides a smart architectural focus.

The upper floors pay homage to the house’s original Georgian features. The main bedroom, painted a soothing duck-egg blue, has a large Jack and Jill en suite bathroom leading through to a second bedroom currently used as a nursery. On the second floor, there are two additional double bedrooms, both with en-suite bathrooms. Bespoke joinery features throughout the bedrooms in the form of sleek built-in cabinetry and walnut shelving. White painted floorboards run underfoot throughout on the first floor, capitalising on the abundance of natural light invited in by the traditional timber-framed sash windows.

Outdoor Space

On the first floor there is a Moroccan-inspired terrace with beautifully planted borders and a wide and open view. A skylight window slides back to reveal the living spaces below; there is running water plus electrical points for additional lighting.

TheArea

Leverton Place is situated minutes from the amenities of the buzzing Kentish Town Road, with its independent butchers, grocers and restaurants. There are also some excellent independent food shops on Fortress Road. Neighbourhood favourites Phoenicia and Anima e Cuore. There are excellent pubs in the area including The Bull & Last, The Pineapple, The Southampton Arms and The Junction Tavern.

The house is only a short walk away from the glorious green expanses of Hampstead Heath with its beautiful swimming ponds and Parliament Hill Lido.

There are excellent state and private primary and secondary options in the area, including the Ofsted outstanding state primaries Torriano Primary and Kentish Town Primary and secondary school Camden School for Girls

Leverton Place is well placed for transport links across the city. Kentish Town Underground station is only minutes away and runs Northern Line and Thameslink services for quick access to the centre of London, Farringdon and the City. Kentish Town West Overground is also in close proximity with direct lines to Highbury & Islington, Hackney Central and Richmond.

title: 4 bed property for sale

detailedDescription:
A beautiful extension of the stunning development of Chappell Lofts is this superb town house, created to an exceptional standard throughout this newly designed house boasts over 2,100 Square Foot of space exquisitely located in the heart of Camden.

The property offers four double bedrooms all with air conditioning, underfloor heating and ensuites. The kitchen is by Scavolini with Bora and Miele appliances extending into the dining area and additional reception space. The whole of the ground floor is dedicated to a reception room with separate cloakroom. In addition the entire top floor is available as either extra reception space or a master suite with ensuite opportunity and two balconies.

The Chappell Loft site that this house is part of was founded in 1811 by Chappell & Co providing pianos for nobility, gentry and musicians with clients including Beethoven, Strauss and Sibelius. For over 100 years Chappell and Co crafted the world’s finest pianos, and during World War 2 produced canopies and propellers for the legendary Supermarine Spitfires, eventually closing in 1970. It then became the Chalk Farm Photographic Studios, for artists, photographers and models before undergoing a major refurbishment over the last three years.

address: Woburn Court, Bernard Street, London WC1N
detailedDescription:
The apartment retains many charming period features, with high ceilings, cornicing and Crittall windows framing views of Russell Square from the main living space and principal bedroom. A contemporary kitchen is separate to the living room, providing ample preparation space and storage.

The interior has been remodelled recently to include a secondary shower room adjacent to a practical utility area. A further bathroom with separate W.C. Makes for an ideal layout for sharers. With three bedrooms, this versatile layout is ideal for young families, professional couples or someone seeking a Pied a Terre in a central location.

The communal entrance leads into the raised ground floor with a lift serving all floors. Secure underground parking can be accessed externally via Herbrand Street and is registered on a separate title which would be included within the sale. In recent times the seller has also acquired a share in the freehold company, as well as extending the lease.

Situation
This elegant residential block is located opposite the Kimpton Fitzroy Hotel, equidistant to Russell Square and Russell Square station, a fabulous setting for anyone looking within close proximity to the Arts, Institutions and Universities.

Woburn Court boasts a prime location within sight of Russell Square tube (Piccadilly Line) and is nearby Kings Cross, St Pancras, Euston & Euston Square (Northern, Metropolitian, Hammersmith, Circle & London Overground Lines).

This central location ensures ease of access to the City, West End, Covent Garden and Soho. Marchmont St with its local shops, pubs and restaurants and the Brunswick Centre with its cinema, gyms and supermarkets are all within reach.

address: Priory Terrace, South Hampstead, London NW6
detailedDescription:
New with Planning Permission! Permission has been granted for a proposed new build house, arranged across three floors in prime NW6 Location. Proposals allow for a house of 1,593 sqft (148 sqm), in addition to an already existing garage, to be retained under the current plans, extending the land by an additional 153 sqft (14.2 sqm). The house is designed as a contemporary, low-level, detached house, in keeping with other local builds and also includes a flat roof design with solar panels and a sedum green roof (Compliant with bre guidelines). Current plans allow for a single storey basement level, also designed in compliance with bre guidelines, including a courtyard and walled garden. Accessed via a secure surrounding gate this house will benefit from a reinstated low level brick wall and hedged boarders. Provisions for bike storage has been provided by the scheme and secure off-street parking via the existing garage.

Notable previous occupiers on this plot include renowned British actor, Sir Dirk Boagrt, who resided in the previous couch-house, style residence that was demolished in the 1950s. Located off the history ‘Abbey Road’, and bordering just between St Johns Wood & West Hampstead, this site benefits from easy access to a vast array of local amenities, bars and boutique shops. Also benefiting from easy access to transport links from West Hampstead (Underground/ Overground/ Thameslink) and excellent bus links along Abbey Road & West End Lane.

title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
A unique detached two storey, five bedroom modernist house, sitting within a site of approximately one third of an acre and surrounded by beautiful mature gardens and trees.

This riba award winning home (originally built in the early 1960's) of some 4,504 sq ft/418 sq m has been remodeled throughout and extended by the noted British architect Alison Brooks. Brooks gleaned a great deal of her exciting design style from her time with the avant-garde Israeli architect Ron Arad, which shows in this remarkable house. Alison also managed to secure planning to create a new master bedroom suite /reception area, on the roof of the house, providing it with panoramic views over the Heath and the surrounding area.

On the first floor the property provides a master suite with en-suite bathroom and dressing room plus four further bedrooms and two further bathrooms. On the ground floor there are three incredibly bright split level interconnecting reception rooms (the dining room has a double volume void above it), kitchen/breakfast room, utility room and a stunning glazed reception hallway with suspended metal clad staircase.

Located adjacent to the house is a self contained glass and stone pavilion which has a multi leisure/recreational use as well as being ideal as a gym as it come with en-suite amenities.

A early viewing of this important contemporary house is highly recommended.

With it's own ground floor entrance, stairs lead up to the first floor where accommodation comprises a wonderfully bright and airy 25' reception room flooded with natural light by two large crittall windows, a generous eat-in kitchen with an aga, access to a south-east facing terrace and a double bedroom which could be used as a dining room if necessary.

The principal bedroom is on the top floor and has double doors opening on to a large en-suite bathroom with free standing claw footed roll-top bath and double french doors leading to a lovely balcony with views across to St Mary's Church. There is also a smaller third bedroom, again opening on to a balcony with an adjacent family bathroom.

Conveniently located just off Eversholt Street, the property is a short distance from Euston Station (0.3 miles - Northern, Victoria Underground lines, Overground & National Rail services). address: Priory Terrace & Abbey Road House, South Hampstead, London NW6
detailedDescription:
The site on the corner of Priory Terrace and Abbey Road is a development opportunity which is fully consented and offered along with the lower ground floor flat of the adjacent building. The property was acquired in 2018 as part of a joint venture development opportunity.
Full planning consent has been granted for the proposed development of a contemporary new build detached house on this prominent corner. In addition, the scheme is offered with an adjacent garage and takes full advantage of off-street parking.

Location

Abbey Road is synonymous worldwide with the Abbey Road Studios and the Beatles. Bordering St Johns Wood and West Hampstead the site is well positioned to access both villages with a plethora of bustling and atmospheric bars, restaurants and shops. Excellent transport links are all in close proximity including West Hampstead Underground and Overground stations and several bus routes along Abbey Road and West End Lane. The area is considered one of historical value, community, creativity and vibrance.

Planning

Planning permission has been granted by Camden Council for a proposed a 1,593 sqft (148 sqm) new build contemporary house arranged over three floors. In addition, this site is offered with the benefit of an adjoining three bedroom and two bathroom apartment with 1050 sq ft which elevates any routes of light issue (Planning Reference No 2020/2839/P). As part of the proposed development, the existing garage on the adjoining site is to be to be retained, providing an additional 153 sqft (14.2 sqm). The house has been sympathetically designed as a contemporary low-level detached dwelling, aligned with the heights of the portico of its' more substantial neighbour at 39 Priory Terrace. The rendered stucco walls and fenestration pay homage to the vernacular terraces of the prca (Priory Road Conservation Area). The proposed development includes a single storey subterranean basement level with lightwells, courtyards and a walled front garden.

title: 4 bed detached house for sale

detailedDescription:
This magnificent four-bedroom house occupies an incredible position at the foot of one of Highgate’s most desirable lanes, overlooking three of Hampstead Heath’s ponds. Located between two private walled gardens, the house capitalises on its location in exquisite style, surrounded by wildlife and the bucolic outlook of Hampstead Heath, with delightful views of the boating and swimming ponds beyond. Originally built in the 1830s, Apex Lodge was the former lodge of Fitzroy Park, an estate owned by Baron Southampton.

The Building

Since its construction, Apex Lodge has had two modern architectural interventions. The first adaptation took place in the 1980s creating a conservatory and kitchen. Latterly, a beautiful spiral staircase, second floor and balcony were added by Oliver Barsoum of Syte Architects. Both adaptations of the plan riff on the home’s characteristic pitched roof of the original lodge building, introducing lower-level allusions to this feature alongside subtle higher-level inversions of the profile.

The Tour

Apex Lodge is wonderfully positioned at the foot of Fitzroy Park, a private road and one of Highgate’s finest lanes, maintained by the residents’ association. Set between two beautiful walled gardens, the house presents a grand three-storey façade, crowned with an elegant pitched roofline that emerges through the treetops. There is space for two cars to park on its drive and a separate garage with ample storage space.

Upon entry, the modern architectural interventions are immediately apparent. The entrance hall is bright and voluminous, linking the two separate wings of the ground floor plan. Along the southern aspect are a cleverly conceived dining room and kitchen, which open out to a secluded walled garden and terrace respectively, overlooking Hampstead Heath. The kitchen lies beneath a glazed pitched roof, set within beautiful Iroko frames. As the roof becomes mono-pitched, the glazing continues, allowing natural light to pour across the room; it resounds off custom stainless steel units, granite worktops and Siemens appliances. The orientation and morning light make this space a perfect breakfast room.

The adjoining dining room, of the original 1830s lodge, feels like a natural extension of the kitchen. A wonderful space for entertaining, this also has a dramatic pitched roof that creates a palpable sense of volume. A Welsh slate fireplace sits to one side, opposite a set of glazed doors which open out to the secluded garden and patio. A guest WC can be accessed from both the dining room and the entrance hall.

The northern wing of the ground floor is occupied by two glorious reception rooms. The smaller of the two rooms has a bay window overlooking the Heath to the west and the garden to the north; it is currently used as a music room. The main reception room is an expansive space, defined by a playful circular conservatory with a beautiful concrete pillar at its centre. It opens via several glazed doors onto the largest section of the garden, breaking down the boundary between inside and out. A living area with garden views takes up the rest of this room.

The first floor comprises a main en suite bedroom with an adjoining dressing room, two further double bedrooms and a family bathroom. The main bedroom looks over Hampstead Heath’s bird sanctuary pond and its dazzling population of native kingfishers, while the peaceful third bedroom has views of the garden’s mature Monterey pine tree.

The upper floors are accessed via a fantastic spiral staircase with open-tread oak steps and a curved steel balustrade. This architectural feature allows natural light to cascade across all floors with a dramatic effect. The top floor of the house is a fantastically flexible set of spaces. A further bedroom and bathroom can be accessed via a bright and airy room, which the current owners have used variously as a home office, playroom and as an additional living room. There is also a storage room in the eaves. A large skylight sits over the staircase and a set of glazed doors open to a balcony with elevated views through the treetops, charmingly framed in a V shape by the meeting point of the roof’s two pitches.

Outdoor Space

Apex Lodge has verdant views in every direction. The ‘front’ garden is actually located along the lodge’s southern aspect; it is formed of a secluded patio dining area that flows naturally from the dining room’s glazed doors, and a small pond with raised beds of mature plants and shrubs. This space is private, peaceful and perfect for alfresco dining in the warmer months.

A flagstone terrace runs around the western aspect of the lodge, elevated from the Heath below by a brick wall. The main garden opens out along the northern aspect and is mostly laid to lawn, with shade provided by a mature Monterey pine tree.

The Area

Apex Lodge occupies a fantastic position on the very edge of Hampstead Heath, overlooking the Heath, the Bird Sanctuary Pond and the Model Boating Pond. The Heath offers freshwater swimming year-round in the nearby men’s and ladies Bathing Ponds, as well as some of London’s most beautiful woodland walks. In addition to elevated views of the city from Parliament Hill, there are tennis courts, cafes and Kenwood House, a wonderful 17th-century country house and gallery.

Swains Lane and its wonderful array of shops is less than 10 minutes walk down the hill; home to Bourne’s Fishmongers, Fam Greengrocers, Primrose Hill Butchers and Gail’s. Highgate Village is nearby and has a wide variety of shops, cafés, pubs and restaurants. The area is also home to some of London’s best independent schools including Highgate School, Channing School and St Michael’s Primary.

The Northern Line at Highgate provides direct access to King’s Cross, the West End and the City, and there are convenient road links to the A1, leading to the M1, A406 and M25.

detailedDescription:
Positioned on a late Georgian terrace, is this generously propertied & wonderfully bright triplex maisonette with circa 1219 Sq.Ft. 113 sqm of internal living space and set across the upper three storeys of the terraced property set on Mortimer Terrace, a quiet residential turning moment from Hampstead Heath.

The accommodation is accessed via a communal hallway leading to the first floor, which houses a large reception room and kitchen breakfast room. To the second floor, there is the principal bedroom the family bathroom with separate WC & ample storage facilities.

The third floor offers two further generously propertied double bedrooms. The building has recently undergone extensive external refurbishment works from the freeholders with the communal areas presented in fine decorative order. Mortimer terrace is located on the borders of Dartmouth Park, Gospel Oak & Kentish Town, running just behind Highgate Road, which in turn runs alongside Hampstead Heath to the Parliament Hill entrance. The Heath's well-trodden leafy paths are a delight itself as well as the swimming ponds and splendid Kenwood House, all on your doorstep.
Public transport links are accessed via Kentish Town's underground and Gospel Oak's overground and numerous bus routes leading to a wide variety of London locations. There are also a number of sought-after educational establishments within walking distance and fine local shops of interest all around.

detailedDescription:
Beautifully presented, modern style, two bedroom split level apartment with private courtyard area, enviably located just a short walk from Kilburn and West Hampstead stations. The property offers bright and spacious accommodation arranged over two floors, superbly maintained and appointed to a high standard throughout, with stylish interiors and high quality finish. Features include a large open plan reception/kitchen/diner, well equipped kitchen, contemporary style shower room, guest WC, electric heating, double glazing, ample inbuilt storage, quality floor coverings, communal indoor bike store and share of the freehold.

Accommodation comprises entrance via the ground floor into a hallway with access to modern guest WC, leading into the bright and spacious, open plan reception/kitchen/diner with wide double glazed window and ample space for both relaxing and dining. The kitchen, with access to a useful inbuilt store area, comprises a sleek range of matching wall and base units with work surfaces incorporating inset sink unit, induction hob with overhead extractor and electric oven below, and further space for appliances. To the lower level, there are two well sized double bedrooms, each enjoying shared access to the delightful secluded courtyard area, plus a stylish shower room with walk-in shower suite and elegant tiling.

The property is very conveniently located within easy access of West Hampstead and Kilburn stations, as well as numerous regular bus routes providing excellent cross-London links. The area is also well served by fashionable shops, bars, cafes and restaurants in nearby West End Lane, with the beautiful open spaces of Primrose Hill and Queen's Park within easy reach.

detailedDescription:
** ready for immediate occupation **

An exceptional two double bedroom, two bathroom fourth floor apartment with large covered balcony overlooking Kilburn Grange Park, forming part of a sensational collection of elegant and contemporary 1,2 and 3 bedroom apartments, located in the heart of trendy Kilburn.

Tucked away within a private gated mews, the serene environment of this striking new development provides a retreat in the middle of the hustle and bustle of North-West London. Spectacular interiors have been skilfully designed with modern life in mind, complete with lift access, day concierge, residents gym, spacious open-plan living areas and luxurious finishes. Each apartment is crafted with carefully selected materials, matched for their composed and luxurious appeal.

Neighbouring Kilburn Grange Park is a local secret, nestled between West Hampstead and Queens Park. This beautiful open grass space is a central hub for the community hosting summer events and local festivals. For the more active there are tennis courts and an outdoor gym, for those more quieter moments one might want to stroll through the Old English rose garden. The sense of green space is at the very core of the design of Parkside, where exclusivity and serenity have been woven into the fabric of the design and architecture.

Parkside may feel like a world away from the chaotic rapidity of Central London, but heading into Zone 1, whether it's for a bite to eat, a shopping spree or visiting the office, is fast and convenient. Direct train links from Kilburn Station (Jubilee Line), the closest tube station and just seven minutes' walk from the development (0.4m away), provides expeditious journey times to Bond Street (10 minutes), London Bridge (20 minutes) and Canary Wharf (27 minutes). Further local transport links include the Thameslink Line and the Overground Line, found nearby at West Hampstead and Brondesbury Station.

address: Oak Hill Park Mews, Hampstead, London NW3
detailedDescription:
Newly refurbished 3 bedroom mews house in a private Hampstead Estate.

Location

Oak Hill Park Mews is a very desirable location by Frognal in central Hampstead. The property is only 0.3 of a mile from the vast array of shops, restaurants and cafes of Hampstead High Street and is in close proximity to the local public attractions like the Hampstead Heath. Tube stations such as Hampstead (0.4m), Finchley Road (0.8m) and West Hampstead (1.0m) are within easy reach. Other excellent transport links to the City & the West End are only 0.4 mile.

Description

This rarely available, beautifully presented 3 bedroom mews house is set within an exclusive mews within the tranquil and extensive grounds of the private Oak Hill Park Estate. Located off Frognal, and in the heart of Hampstead Village, this house is presented in excellent decorative condition having just been the subject of an extensive and comprehensive programme of refurbishment.

The house offers bright, well-planned and modern accommodation with the principal bedroom including an en suite bathroom occupying the entirety of the top floor. There are an additional 2 double bedrooms and a family bathroom on the first floor. The ground floor offers open-plan living comprising a kitchen, lounge and guest cloakroom which opens onto a well-designed patio space. With mirrors to enhance the natural light and planters to accommodate plants and shrubs, the patio is a perfect space for outdoor entertaining.

The fittings are all of an extremely high standard with Lusso stone sanitary ware in all bathrooms, herringbone parquet wooden flooring on the ground floor and Italian Guzzini Fontana wardrobes in all bedrooms. The kitchen is British made Kesseler, with a Silestone quartz worktop, top of the range smeg kitchen appliances and a vanto 4-in-1 instant hot and filtered drinking water tap. The house also benefits from both underfloor heating on the ground floor and in all bathrooms and a Nest temperature control system.

There is also secure, allocated underground parking and storage space. Additional garage / parking spaces are available to purchase separately if required.

Communal outdoor spaces includes both the private mews garden and the Oak Hill Park Estate grounds.

Square Footage: 1204 sq ft

address: Ryland Road, Kentish Town, London NW5
detailedDescription:
An exquisite fourth floor, loft-style apartment with a private terrace and off-street parking set within a boutique gated development converted from a former piano factory in the heart of Kentish Town. The Brinsmead Apartments were designed by Heber-Percy and Parker Architects in 2012 and is recognized as one the area’s most revered warehouse developments. This space offers impressive wide-reaching views of the London skyline and the apartment is on the highest floor that captures all the original industrial features of the building and cleverly fuses character with contemporary living. This wonderful home hosts a remarkable corner aspect open plan kitchen & reception room offering skyline views of the city from immense floor to ceiling crittall windows and has direct access to a south facing balcony.

A principal bedroom, with its own walk in wardrobe and en-suite bathroom that features a standalone bathtub, a double bedroom with fitted wardrobes, a further bedroom currently being used an office and a family shower room. The aspect of this apartment allows for all rooms to have uninterrupted views and is in a class of its own. Other benefits include one private dedicated parking space, security gates and lift access.

Ryland Road is a residential side turning offering a tranquil setting and intimate community vibe in the heart of Kentish Town. The town centre is a short stroll away (0.2miles) where one can enjoy a chilled setting of popular family owned restaurants and cafes, cosy pubs and funky bars. Alternatively Camden Town is an equal distance away, famous for its diverse markets, a warren of fashion & curiosities and a haven of counter culture with an array of independent shops and iconic music venues. Primrose Hill is close by too (0.6miles) where one can enjoy the breath-taking views of the city from Primrose Hill Park and experience the villages quirky boutiques and idyllic restaurants. A short and pleasant stroll down Regents Canal (1mile) will lead you to the ever evolving Kings Cross where one can indulge in the delights of Granary Square which hosts a wide selection of stylish eateries, sleek bars and popular recreational squares & arts centres and Everyman Cinema. Collège Français Bilingue de Londres is a nearby private school.

There are several transport links to choose from including Kentish Town West Station (Overground Line) 0.1miles, Kentish Town Station (Northern Line & Thames Link) and Kings Cross & St Pancras Stations are 1.5 miles away (these stations are served by six underground lines and the Eurostar connecting you to local, national & international destinations). The West End and the City are all accessible in under 20 minutes. There is also a nearby canal towpath that provides a beautiful cycle route west to Little Venice and east via Kings Cross to Hoxton. The Talacre sports centre, park and playground and the Grafton Road swimming pool and gym complex are also minutes away.

Features include an inviting reception room, separate well equipped kitchen, upstairs family bathroom, spacious master bedroom, gas central heating, double glazing, quality floor coverings, ample inbuilt storage, and own private entrance.

Accommodation comprises entrance hall with stairs rising to the first floor, leading into the bright and spacious reception room with wide double glazed window and ample space for both relaxing and dining. The separate kitchen comprises a modern range of matching white fronted wall and base units with ample work surfaces incorporating inset sink unit, induction hob with overhead extractor, electric oven, integrated washer/dryer and dishwasher, and further space for appliances. To the first floor, there are two well proportioned bedrooms, each with inbuilt storage, plus a tiled family bathroom with modern white three piece suite.

The property is enviably situated in a vibrant location close to an array of shops, cafes, bars, restaurants and amenities. Kentish Town West, Kentish Town and Chalk Farm stations are within easy reach, as well as numerous regular bus routes connecting the surrounding area. The centres of Camden, Kentish Town, and Primrose Hill are within a short distance with their own eclectic mix of boutique shops, bars, markets and amenities. Hampstead Heath and Regents Park are also only a short walk away.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
This magnificent two-bedroom apartment occupies the first floor of a handsome, Grade II listed, residential building in the heart of Bloomsbury, which overlooks the monumental Greek Revival portico of The British Museum. The internal spaces have recently undergone an intricate refurbishment in oak and poplar care of ooma design and are characterised by beautiful arched sash windows.

Setting the Scene

Museum Street runs through the heart of Bloomsbury, ultimately arriving at the handsome frontage of The British Museum (from which the street takes its name). The area is perhaps most renowned for its association with the bohemian group of 20th-century writers and artists including Virginia Woolf, Vanessa Bell and E. M. Forster, known as the Bloomsbury Set. It is one of London’s most desirable neighbourhoods, characterised by stately residential squares and its proximity to University College London, rada, the Architectural Association and Senate House Library.

Museum Street itself has its origins in the 14th century; however, it remained largely rural until the late 17th century when London greatly expanded. This included the establishment of the British Museum in 1753. In the early 19th century, the street became a fashionable area, with many prominent writers of the day gathering in its taverns, including Charles Dickens, John Keats and George Orwell, as well as the Bloomsbury Set.

The Grand Tour

The apartment is configured around a large open-plan kitchen, living and dining room lined with solid oak floorboards. Five beautiful arched sash windows frame exceptional views through a row of London Plane trees, towards The British Museum piazza. High ceilings and a curved aspect emphasise the flow of natural light across the plan, which illuminates the solid oak joinery and black Zimbabwean granite worktops. The kitchen is positioned at one end of the plan and has integrated Gaggenau appliances, oak-fronted units and plenty of storage space.

A large main bedroom with an en suite shower room lies off the main hallway. These spaces have been the subject of a sensitive intervention by John Griffiths, who has created bespoke shutters in poplar wood for each of the three arched sash windows in the bedroom, as well as refurbishing the shower room, which is now partially lined and fitted in beautifully aged teak.

Opposite is the second bedroom, used by the current owners as a home studio. It has bespoke polished plywood-fronted storage units and a concealed desk, perfect for working from home. A full bathroom is positioned next to the bedroom and has Fired Earth tiles throughout. A convenient cloakroom with further storage space can be found along the hallway.

The Great Outdoors

Residents of the building have a key for Bedford Square Gardens; a private garden square that is a lovely place to spend lazy, languorous afternoons. Bloomsbury Square Gardens – Bloomsbury’s oldest square, laid out in 1665 – is also nearby, as is the famous Russell Square. Lincoln’s Inn Fields are a 10-minute walk away, and are home to both tennis and netball courts, which can be hired by the public. Gray’s Inn Gardens and Coram’s Fields are also close at hand.

Out and About

Museum Street is in a fantastic position, right in the heart of London. Nearby Lamb’s Conduit Street is home to an interesting community of independent shops spread along a pedestrianised street. The Brunswick Centre, a short walk away, has a cinema and a Waitrose supermarket. The restaurants and bars of Clerkenwell, Exmouth Market, Covent Garden and Soho are all within walking distance, as are the colleges and institutes of the University of London. There are vast numbers of hidden pubs and restaurants in Bloomsbury; of particular note is the newly opened Café Deco on Store Street.

Kings Cross (Northern Line), Russell Square (Piccadilly Line), Holborn (Central and Piccadilly Lines), Chancery Lane (Central Line) and Farringdon Station (Circle Line, Hammersmith & City Line, Metropolitan Line and National Rail services) are all close by. Farringdon Station will also benefit from the imminent opening of Crossrail, which will run a direct route to Heathrow Airport. The Eurostar is available at St Pancras.

address: Loraine Mansions, Widdenham Road, London N7
detailedDescription:
This fantastic three-bedroom apartment is positioned on the third floor of Loraine Mansions, a beautiful Edwardian mansion block in Holloway. The apartment has been the subject of a sensitive modernisation by its current owners, who have carefully introduced a contemporary material palette throughout that makes wonderful use of the flow of natural light.

The Tour

Loraine Mansions sits on a peaceful, tree-lined street of elegant Edwardian mansion blocks, characterised by their beautiful red brick and white stucco façades, slim running balconies and bay windows. Access to the mansions is gained via a communal entrance, through charming front gardens that lead to a red brick porch.

The apartment is on the third floor. A long hallway runs along the spine of the plan, a feature that accentuates the flow of natural light across all rooms. Engineered oak boards run underfoot, leading to the beautiful kitchen, living and dining rooms which are arranged in an open plan at one end of the hallway. These rooms are bright, airy and bathed in natural light care of two sash windows to the northern aspect and a glazed door that leads to an elevated fire escape on the eastern aspect. The kitchen has birch plywood units with concrete worktops and integrated appliances. Bespoke cabinetry cleverly conceals the extraction fan while creating convenient high-level storage; further storage is built-in along one wall. The adjoining dining area and living room are oriented around an original fireplace and enjoy verdant treetop views.

A well-sized bathroom is positioned next to the living room. The hallway leads back along the length of the plan to two large double bedrooms and a third, slightly smaller bedroom. Each of these rooms has engineered oak floorboards, original restored fireplaces and beautiful sash windows.

The Area

Loraine Mansions is in a brilliant location, adjacent to the Hillmarton Conservation Area and within easy reach of central Islington, Upper Street and King’s Cross to the south, as well as Camden and Kentish Town to the west. Local amenities, including a large Waitrose, can be found on Holloway Road. There are many good pubs and restaurants in the area, including Westerns Laundry towards Highbury Fields, Tufnell Park Tavern to the north and numerous pubs such as The Drapers Arms and The Albion. Islington Indoor Tennis Centre and gym can be found at nearby Market Road. Freightliners City Farm by Paradise Park is also close by, while Hampstead Heath is a 15-minute cycle.

Both Caledonian Road and Holloway stations (Picadilly Line) are a short walk away, and there are numerous local bus routes into central London.

Conveniently located within walking distance of Hampstead Village with cafés, boutiques and restaurants and West Hampstead, excellent amenities including O2 centre JW3 Centre, Camden Art Centre University College, schools, gym and pool and numerous transport links such as Hampstead Village (Northern line) Finchley Road (Jubilee line) and Finchley Road and Frognal (Overground).
The apartment extends to 1275 ft.²\118.5 m² featuring a double volume reception room with vaulted ceiling. Comprising first floor entrance the door to hallway with hanging space and staircase to 2nd floor. Stunning reception room with dining area partially open plan to the kitchen which has integrated appliances. The principal bedroom is rear facing with an en-suite shower room and a wall fitted with wardrobes. The second double bedroom also has wardrobes and cupboards plus there a guest cloakroom/WC. There is also a fantastic galleried guest bedroom/office with en-suite bathroom and storage space. Leasehold and share of freehold. A chain free transaction.

Energy Efficiency Rating - D

address: 7 Pearson Square, Fitzroy Place, Fitzrovia W1T
detailedDescription:
*No sdlt Payable - Unique Opportunity* The most significant development in Fitzrovia for over 50 years!

The ground floor consists of a sizable open-plan kitchen/lounge with a stylish floating staircase offering a natural sense of division to the room without compromising the social aspect to the space. Keeping in this theme, a clever sliding pocket door allows a segment of the living room to be separated as a spare guest room, dining room or study if the enlarged entertaining space which leads out onto a substantial terrace isn't to your preference. Ample storage and a downstairs WC is also available on this level whilst upstairs, comprises two palatial bedrooms with large walk-through hallways leading to their respective en-suite bathrooms.

Located in the heart of central London, within the City of Westminster and surrounded by the adjoining neighbourhoods of Mayfair, Soho, Marylebone and Regent’s Park, Fitzrovia presents London life, both work and play, at its very best.

Fitzrovia is founded on its rich cultural history and its list of former residents reads like a roll-call of London’s creativity: Charles Dickens, Virginia Woolf, John Constable. Today the spirit is embodied by a thriving creative community including writers, artists, designers and filmmakers

Fitzroy Place is a unique collection of prestigious new homes, enticing stores, a restaurant and high quality office space, all gathered around a stunning landscaped square

title: 3 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
A handsome Grade II listed Georgian house, c.1805, in magnificent gardens approaching 0.32 acres directly facing the lower slopes of Hampstead Heath.

Set behind a 72ft front garden on the edge of Hampstead Heath in this quiet tranquil cul-de-sac, a rare opportunity to acquire one of the finest period houses in Hampstead Village. This elegant low built, Grade II listed semi-detached regency home circa 1805 with its yellow brick wrapped in wisteria, and linked with an iron balcony (said to pre date the house to 1775). Visited by Prime Minister Gladstone whilst his son was lodging here in 1893 and commissioned by Samuel Pratt, trunk maker, upholsterer, inventor, businessman and developer, the “father of modern upholstery”. Retaining many original features including bow windows, fireplaces, cornices, shutters and boasts a spectacular discreet landscaped garden 184ft (0.32 acres) with courtyard, lawns, large pond and summer house with an historic oak door leading to Gainsborough gardens with access to private parking and use of the communal gardens. (The oak door was built in 1910 and was the entrance to St Augustines church in Epsom Surrey where Bishop Bill Flagg was awarded the cross of St Augustine by the Archbishop of Canterbury). Accommodation comprises magnificent double aspect principle suite with dressing room, bathroom and ornate balcony, four further bedroom suites, four with bathrooms and one shower room. Double aspect drawing room, dining room, study, family room, cinema room, kitchen, spectacular indoor swimming pool, wine cellar, utility room, guest cloakroom, off street parking for several cars, additional parking in Gainsborough gardens, communal gardens, Heath views.
Heathside is discreetly located off the South-West corner of East Heath Road in the center of the Conservation Area and comprises just four properties.

title: 4 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription: A characterful one bedroom apartment with a secluded communal garden set on the raised ground floor of a striking Victorian residence circa 160 meters from Camden Square. This charming apartment with its own private entrance comprises of a grand reception room, a fully fitted kitchen with direct access onto a beautifully presented communal garden, a generous principal bedroom with an en-suite bathroom, a further guest cloakroom and utility cupboard. This apartment has been meticulously renovated with brand new appliances and interiors, also features floor-to-ceiling windows and a Juliette balcony to the rear. This part of Camden Road is set behind the Camden Square Conservation Area which is one of the town’s most revered settings and consists of a small and intimate collection of tree lined residential roads centred around the tranquil green space found on Camden Square offering a peaceful setting with a community vibe. Also allowing easy access into Camden Town which is famous for its diverse markets, a warren of fashion & curiosities and a haven of counter culture offering an array of independent shops and iconic music venues. Camden Road is also well located for education purposes Camden School for Girls, a well-respected French School in Kentish Town and St Martins School of Design and University College London are all in close proximity. Alternatively a short and pleasant stroll down Regents Canal will lead you to the ever evolving Kings Cross where one can indulge in the delights of Granary Square which hosts a wide selection of stylish eateries, sleek bars, popular recreational squares & arts centres, this is also the location of the brand new offices for Google, Facebook, YouTube & The Guardian. For something less urban the green open spaces of Regents Park & breath-taking city scape views from Primrose Hill are just over one mile away. Kings Cross & St Pancras Stations (these stations are served by six underground lines and the Eurostar connecting you to local, national & international destinations) are 1.4 miles away, also there are several bus routes connecting you to London's West-End in under 20 minutes. Other transport links include Camden Road Station (Overground Line) 0.3 miles, Camden Town Station (Northern Line) 0.5 miles, Kentish Town Station (Northern & Overground Lines) 0.6 miles. The West End and the City all accessible in under 20 minutes. There is also a nearby canal towpath that provides a beautiful cycle route west to Little Venice and east to Hoxton.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Located within Seven Dials Court, a secure gated modern complex in the very centre of Covent Garden's Seven Dials village, this light filled duplex apartment is arranged over the second & third floors and boasts a private roof terrace and additional balcony

The lower floor living space comprises a well-proportioned reception room and open plan dining space which has access to a secluded terrace. There is also a good sized separate kitchen with views over roof tops and down onto Shorts Gardens. The floor above offers two generous bedrooms both with vaulted ceilings. The principal bedroom has 2 large double doors that open up onto a balcony. There is a large en-suite bathroom and a further good sized second bedroom which is served by a large shower room.

Seven Dials has an interesting history, originally developed by Thomas Neale in the early 1690's with a view to attracting affluent residents. However, for much of its early history it was full of gin shops and ne'er-do-wells, with a pub on every corner (only The Crown remains today) and a series of interconnecting tunnels between each, perfect for a quick escape. The area became regarded as somewhat of a slum, even referenced by the great Charles Dickens himself.

Nowadays, Seven Dials has more of a village feel much closer to Neale's original vision. The eclectic mix of cobbled streets, historic architecture, independent boutiques, theatres, restaurants, coffee shops, plus the welcome addition of the fantastic Seven Dials Market and of course the iconic sundial, give the area a unique atmosphere within London's buzzing West End.

detailedDescription:
Walking distance from the stunning Primose Hill, this flat offers generous living accommodation of over 500 square feet with pleasant views over the front of the building adjacent to the stunning Provost Road.

Upon entry into Eton Hall you are welcomed with a delightful newly refurbished art deco style entrance hall. The flat itself is well laid out with a large double aspect bedroom on the left with a spacious living room on the right of the corridor. The well designed separate kitchen features integrated appliances including dishwasher and washing machine and clever storage space. There is also a modern family bathroom with shower over bath, WC and sink.

The flat comes with A lease of over 980 years left, making it A virtual freehold flat, unlike many others in surrounding buildings

Overall, the flat is really characterful and charming with a lot of period features, much natural light and original wooden flooring.

Off street parking space is included with the flat and the block is excellently looked after with large gardens, a lift and a porter. There is communal heating & hot water included in the service charge. The communal gardens are excellently looked after and a lovely space to read or relax in.

Eton College Road is a quiet residential street just a short walk from the plethora of boutique bars, shops and restaurants of Belsize Park and Chalk Farm. The location is highly desirable, being in Zone 2, on the doorstep of Zone 1 but still in a quiet enclave away from the noise.

It is just across the road from the famous Primrose Hill which boasts vast green open spaces, breathtaking views and an array of beautiful pavement cafes.

There are excellent transport links close by with Chalk Farm Northern Line underground station and Swiss Cottage being in close proximity.

detailedDescription:
A bright and spacious Three Bedroom House with further loft room and private South-East facing garden, conveniently located within a quiet cul-de-sac within the Hillmarton Conservation Area moments from Caledonian Park, Caledonian Road Underground Station (Piccadilly Line), and within easy reach of Kings Cross/St Pancras International.

Looking out across landscaped gardens, this naturally bright Freehold House boasts a wealth of natural light as well as offering flexible internal living accommodation of approximately 1131 SqFt. The entrance hall takes you past the cloakroom W.C. Into the newly fitted open-plan Kitchen / dining room where there is a range of wall and base units and large preparation area all finished with tile splashback. The adjacent reception room boasts lots of entertaining space and leads directly onto the private garden through double floor to ceiling glass paned doors where there is a combination of mature lawn, planters and hard slab for seating.

The first floor comprises of two large double bedrooms with well-proportioned third bedroom and recently installed three piece family bathroom finished with tile surround and floor. The loft room has been fully insulated and fitted with a velux window making it ideal for a home office or study whilst providing more built in storage in the eaves.

There are diverse local shopping facilities on Holloway Road including Waitrose, cafés and independent fresh food market at the Nags Head. Further shops and entertainment outlets in Upper Street, Camden Town, Highbury Barn and green parks at Hampstead Heath can be reached via a short bus ride or on bike from this prominent location.

The immediate area is serviced extensively by transport links including Caledonian Road Underground Station which is just 7 minutes’ walk, along with other stations including Holloway Road Underground Station and Caledonian Road & Barnsbury Overground Station. Bus routes close by including 17,91 and 259 (some 24hr services) providing quick and direct access to the West End, City and Kings Cross/St Pancras International.<br /><br />

The house provides accommodation over three floors, including an impressive 33' x 25' kitchen/dining/family room (leading directly out onto the rear 46'7 x 45' south-west facing garden), reception room, study, utility room and guest WC on the ground floor. West Heath Gardens is located close to Finchley Road with its excellent transport connections, bus routes and convenience shopping. In addition, the vast and beautiful open spaces of both Golders Hill Park and West Heath are but a five minute walk away.

Belle Vue, Hampstead is a vibrant development of one and two bedroom apartments designed to encourage conversation and relaxation, as well as the chance to explore your creative side. The lower-ground floor features a lounge, gym, stretch studio and lap pool. There is also two treatment rooms, a sauna and a steam room for those seeking an indulgent afternoon.

The ground floor café offers a wide selection of seasonal food available for all those who live at Belle Vue, Hampstead as well as the wider public, so there?s always a bustle of activity and community about the place. The underground parking system is also a convenient addition to development.

Should friends or family wish to visit, a guest suite is available for them to stay in, and there is a separate dining area for hosting larger gatherings. Your General Manager and Concierge will be on hand to help with any queries, helping you to make the most of all Belle Vue, Hampstead has to offer.

Summary
A well-presented two bedroom a Central London block of apartments. The property benefits from a long leasehold as well as being moments from all local amenities. Perfect Pied a Terre or long term rental investment.

Description
Recently coming to prominence as Midtown, the area linking Fitzrovia, Clerkenwell, Bloomsbury, Covent Garden & High Holborn provides an exciting range of residential property from character period houses and conversions to iconic modern blocks.
With your Central London home close to Holborn and with easy access to Theatreland, Kingsway & Lincoln's Inn, you will be ideally placed to get around the area. Whether for work or leisure, this is the perfect location from which to reach an outstanding range of shopping, entertainment and eateries, including World-Renowned shopping areas such as Oxford Street and Bond Street, Cinema, Theatre and Opera around Leicester Square, Drury Lane and Shaftsbury Avenue and the famous eateries of Covent Garden, Soho and Chinatown, whilst Bloomsbury to the North has been a fashionable part of London for over 250 years, and contains some of London's finest parks as well as being well known for numerous Health-Care institutions, including the bma, gosh, ucl and the National Hospital for Neurology and Neurosurgery, this sought-after residential area is also home to the British Museum, British Library and the University of London's central bodies and departments.
Easy access is afforded across London with the superb network of buses.The Piccadilly & Central Line Underground are both available from Holborn Station, whilst Kings Cross, St Pancras and Charing Cross Stations are less than a mile away and provide links to the rest of the UK and Europe

title: 6 bed semi-detached house for sale

detailedDescription:
A wonderful Two Double Bedroom Edwardian Conversion with private rear garden, located within the Hillmarton Conservation Area, near to Highbury, Central Islington, Tufnell Park and moments from Holloway Road & Caledonian Road Underground Stations.

Originally Built circa 1901, a typical style of the Edwardian Period, this red brick conversion occupying the entire ground floor provides wonderful lateral living space extending to nearly 800 SqFt. Entering through a private front door, the hallway opens up to a large reception room complete with oversized bay window, high ceilings with beautiful mouldings and decorative fireplace with tiled hearth. The main bedroom and second bedroom both overlook the garden and bathe in natural light entered from the sash windows, whilst the main bedroom features an original decorative fireplace and bespoke fitted wardrobes.

The bathroom has been finished in contemporary style with full bath tub, wall mounted shower and controls, floating wash basin and low level W.C, finished with tile surround. Following on down the expansive hall way, the spacious open-plan kitchen / dining room with range of wall and base units has been finished in a classical style complete with solid wood worktops. Accessed from the kitchen, the private rear garden provides further entertainment space with stone patio area and wooden decking laid to mature flower beds.

Widdenham Road is a quiet leafy side avenue moments from a number of amenities including a range of independent coffee shops, eateries and gastro pubs. Larger shops close by include Waitrose, James Selby department store and Boots. Popular Granary Square at Kings Cross and Upper Street provide a broader range of boutique shops, restaurants and entertainment facilities.

Holloway Road Underground Station is located just 5 minutes’ walk (Google) giving direct access to the Piccadilly Line. Caledonian Road Underground Station and Drayton Park Station are also within easy walking distance whilst bus routes including 17,91 and 259 (some 24hr services) provide quick and direct access to the West End, City and Kings Cross/St Pancras International.<br /><br />

detailedDescription:
A stunning lateral home available for the first time in over 40 years.
This is a rare and unique opportunity to purchase this unmodernised two storey end of terrace period house located on the corner of Kidderpore Avenue and Kidderpore Gardens.
The spacious ground floor offers spacious living with an immensely grand entrance hall, two stunningly ornate reception rooms plus a modest kitchen/breakfast room.
The first floor provides four double bedrooms, two with en-suites, plus a separate Jack & Jill bathroom. The gardens extend to three sides of the house, which ensures that you are able to enjoy the sun no matter the time of day and in addition, it has the benefit of off-street parking for at least two cars and also a double garage.

address: Bartholomew Road, Kentish Town, London NW5
detailedDescription:
The property is entered at the raised ground floor level via an imposing hallway and onto the main double reception, with floor to ceiling dual aspect windows and working shutters, high ceilings, original decorative cornicing, a fireplace and wooden floors.

The lower ground floor offers spacious kitchen and dining room leading on to the garden, ample storage and a utility room. The garden is mainly decked in the style of a Mediterranean terrace. This grand room is the centrepiece of the property.

The first-floor accommodation features, 3 bedrooms (Two enormous feature windows) and twos family bathrooms.

The second floor boasts stunning principal bedroom with dressing an en-suite taking the entire floor. The ceiling has been vaulted and the effect is striking.

Bartholomew Road is highly regarded as one the finest addresses within Kentish Town, With handsome Victorian houses that were awarded prizes for design on completion in 1846; The council turned the area into a conservation area 30 years ago and huge interest is taken in maintaining the look and feel of the area. Located within walking distance of all the amenities in the immediate area of Kentish Town and Camden, Kentish town station is a 9 minute walk (Northern Line) Which takes you into the city and the west end inside of 15 minutes. Further afield, the transformed King's Cross district centred around Granary Sq. And the Eurostar are also within easy reach. **Offered Chain-Free**

Description
A fashionable part of London for over 250 years, Bloomsbury contains some of London's finest parks, mix of modern properties and grand Georgian and Victorian buildings and mansion blocks, and large garden squares - Russell Square, Bedford Square and Bloomsbury Square to name but a few.
Well known for numerous Health-Care institutions, including the British Medical Association, Great Ormond Street Hospital, ucl and the National Hospital for Neurology and Neurosurgery, this sought-after residential area is also home to the British Museum, British Library and the University of London's central bodies and departments.
Bus and tube links for access across Central and Outer London are excellent with Russell Square and Euston Square Underground Stations nearby, whilst the National and International transport hubs of Euston, Kings Cross and St Pancras International are just a few minutes' walk away. Located just North of Theatre-Land, with easy access to the superb variety of shopping, restaurants, cafés and varied night-life provided within the City and West End, Bloomsbury is perfect for property investment as it combines the best of modern life for those visiting, studying or living in Central London.

Aesthetics have also been improved to include full re-decoration, carpeting and tiled flooring with under-floor heating on the ground floor.

The accommodation is classic townhouse style, arranged over three levels with integral garage that has potential to convert into additional internal living space (subject to the usual consents). Situated at the end of the terrace, this house enjoys a wider-than-average plot size and deeper, south-facing rear garden too and front off-street parking is also provided.

Directions:
The property is located between Highgate Village and Dartmouth Park. It is less than a five minute walk to the open spaces of either Parliament Hill Fields, Hampstead Heath or Waterlow Park whilst the delightful array of shops and cafes on Swains Lane contribute to a Village-type atmosphere and are within a short walk. An excellent selection of Ofsted rated "Good" Primary and Secondary schools as well as the fee-paying schools in Highgate Village are each close-at-hand.

The house is also conveniently located for easy access to varied transport links including local bus routes into London's City and West End as well as Thameslink at Kentish Town for either Gatwick or Luton Airports by train.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
This exceptional semi-detached family house has been lovingly restored and fully modernised, yet keeps the distinctive features of a house built in 1860 – generous proportions, high ceilings and an abundance of natural light throughout. Comprising approx. 2369 sqft / 220 sqm and laid out over 4 floors with a front and rear garden, houses of this calibre rarely come to market. The ground floor, which can be accessed via a side entrance, comprises a separate hallway, large open plan kitchen, walk-through dining room with feature fireplace, utility room and capacious storeroom (ideal wine cellar or pantry). This floor also benefits from a sympathetically designed modern extension with green roof, containing one of the five bedrooms and a walk-in shower suite. This would also make the perfect home office, playroom or provide separate accommodation for an elderly
parent or nanny. The imposing main entrance on the first floor leads into an elegant spacious hallway, joined by an impressive 28 ft double aspect reception area, with a unique carved oak Georgian fireplace. This can revert to two receptions using period doors. The floor also benefits from a guest cloakroom. The second floor features the principal bedroom with fully tiled en-suite shower, a similar size third bedroom and a large family bathroom. The top floor also has two generous double bedrooms, one of which is
currently used as a dressing room with built-in wardrobes. There is abundant eaves storage in both rooms. The walled garden to the rear has been designed to be low maintenance, is on two levels with ornamental ponds, mature borders and provides exceptional privacy and year round greenery. Located in a quiet cul-de-sac in the Camden Square Conservation Area, the house sits in an oasis of green in one of London’s listed squares. Well-placed for numerous local amenities, most notably Camden Town with its markets and music venues and Kings Cross Coal Drops Yard with its up-market shopping and dining, just a short walk along the Regents Canal which in the opposite direction provides access to Regents Park and Primrose Hill. Alternatively nearby Kentish Town offers a more chilled setting with its many restaurants, cafes and cosy local pubs. There are numerous local schools – independent and state, nurseries, primary, secondary and sixth form college, and the house is located in the catchment area for Camden School for Girls and Collège Français (French Lycée). Numerous transport links provide direct access to the West End,
Southbank Centre and all parts of London. Nearby Kings Cross / St Pancras International (1 mile) is served by six underground lines and Eurostar.
Gatwick and Luton via nearby Kentish Town (0.7 miles).

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Captivating 'Vibe and Views' Feature With This Elegant And Tastefully Presented 2 Double Bedroom, 2 Bathroom First Floor Apartment, Located In The Heart Of Trendy Belsize Park.

This lovely apartment is arranged across the entire first floor of a classic Belsize Park period stucco fronted villa and has been a loved and well maintained home by our client. It cleverly combines an eclectic mix of period details from its original Victorian era with some modern features.

The impressive and well proportioned reception dining room has large windows with attractive leafy views, stripped 'old' hardwood floors, high ceilings with coving and a period fireplace ( with a gas supply ) The compact but separate, modern and well equipped kitchen leads off the living room and has a tall window with the lovely leafy views and access onto a pretty front facing balcony, with space for a bistro table and chairs, this gets the afternoon and evening light, perfect for sundowners when the weather allows.

Both of the generously sized bedrooms are quietly set at the rear of the apartment, are neutrally decorated, and have good storage, high ceilings, and large windows, again giving beautiful leafy views of the gardens ( no access ) and surrounding area. Reached via the rear sash windows of bedroom one, is a 'pot balcony' which subject to planning permits could be modified to become a balcony. There is separate shower room and a large bathroom, both have windows. There is a sizeable under stairs utility/storage cupboard.

The flat is also plumbed for high speed fibre-optic internet (500 meg with potential for 1 gig).

Featuring an unique London Village lifestyle, the location of this apartment could not be more perfect, just a short walk from Belsize Village with its plentiful boutique cafes, shops and popular restaurants, creating a thriving 'local' community. In addition, Hampstead Village and Primrose Hill Village, with their fashionable shopping, trendy eateries and picturesque pubs are within strolling distance.

The nearest Underground stations are, Belsize Park, on the Northern Line and only several stops to London Euston mainline station and Kings Cross and St. Pancras Eurostar, and Swiss Cottage and the Finchley Road ( Jubilee and Metropolitan lines) The multiple main shopping and transport hubs and overground stations along the Finchley Road are also within an easy 10 minute walk.
Additionally there are a variety of bus links close by and of course places to relax on Hampstead Heath and Primrose Hill, havens of green space and fresh air.

Tenure: 999 years from 29/9/2007 plus a Share Of Freehold

Service Charge: 20% of the Annual outgoings. Currently Paying circa £1400.00 per annum

Council Tax Band F: £2483.68 2021/2022 ( a 25% discount can be applied for single occupancy )

EPC: C

address: Charlton Kings Road, Kentish Town NW5
detailedDescription:
** Chain Free** Within one of Kentish Town's renowned and celebrated Mid-nineteenth century former piano factories, is this exceptional one bedroom open planned loft apartment, offering superb views towards West London and Hampstead Heath. The perfect blend of bespoke architectural and industrial heritage is the platform for a mesmerising minimalist décor, punctuated by the holistic use of wood to cultivate a visually rich, modern aesthetic.
The development was originally conceived by Julian Wickham architects during the late 1980s with the apartment undergoing a redevelopment in the mid 2000s.
Upon entry and following the sightlines from the front to the furthest corner, the property is beautifully lit from the original industrial styled double glazed crystal windows, allowing an abundance of balanced natural light that pours through the extensive 700 Sq. Ft. Of internal accommodation. Subdivided into three distinctive zones, the primary living space offers reception and kitchen dining to the forefront, with sleeping area to the rare, and bathroom and utilities hidden away. A distinctive study area is also encaptured in the entrance hall. The apartment offers high ceilings, built-in storage throughout, down lights and secondary double glazing, giving a feeling of tranquility in the heart of the city. Private and secure off street parking, is available on a first come first served basis.
Apollo Studios is a bespoke development of two modern houses, commercial and residential properties and a private penthouse. All set on Charlton King's Road in a gated development, a quiet & restful residential turning within walking distance of Kentish Town's High Street. A short walk to a fantastic selection of daily amenities, the green open spaces at Hampstead Heath, outstanding transport facilities for local & national journeys with access to the international hub at St. Pancras for Paris and the wider Continent.
