address: Belsize Park Firehouse, 36 Lancaster Grove, Belsize Park NW3
detailedDescription:
Flat 11 - A sensational one bedroom apartment (540 sqft/ 50 sqm) forming part of the newly launched Belsize Park Firehouse. Belsize Park Firehouse is a distinctive collection of exclusive new homes crafted from an outstanding Grade II* Listed former fire station at the heart of sought-after Belsize Park. This unique range of just 20 one, two and four bedroom luxury apartments extends the rich heritage of this fine building with its Arts and Crafts period architecture, preserved with meticulous attention to detail throughout to create thoughtful and luxuriously contemporary designed homes.

Each of the apartments at Belsize Park Firehouse has been designed to the highest specification to deliver the ultimate in contemporary living, safe, secure and highly energy efficient. Attention to detail, using lasting materials throughout has preserved the essence of the building’s remarkable heritage. For buyers looking for a unique home with a significant history and excellent location, they need look no further than Belsize Park Firehouse.

Belsize Park Firehouse is within a short walk of two of the capital’s most outstanding green spaces, Hampstead Heath to the north and Primrose Hill to the south. Set in a prominent location on the corner of arguably two of Belsize Park’s most sought after roads, the development is situated between Belsize Park (Northern Line) and Swiss Cottage (Jubilee Line) underground stations, together with an outstanding range of schools.

* subject to terms and conditions
History


Belsize Fire Station was officially opened in 1915. Designed by Charles Canning Windmill an architect of the London County Council Architects Department, it was awarded its Grade II* listing by English Heritage over 40 years ago, being described as “one of the most distinctive and original of a remarkable series of fire stations built”. Seen as a clever interpretation of an Arts and Craft-style house, Belsize Park Fire Station is set on a generous plot and was sensitively designed to blend in to its residential location, noted for the many spacious Victorian and Edwardian homes lining the surrounding leafy avenues. The elevation to Eton Avenue resembles a row of terraced cottages with its tiled roof and tall chimneys while the view from Lancaster Grove is of the stone clad appliance bay frontage with its huge glazed doors, steeply pitched roof and tall hipped dormer windows. Belsize Fire Station completed almost 100 years of service before being decommissioned in 2014. Fire crews from the station worked tirelessly during the two world wars, keeping the service running throughout the London Blitz from 1940 to 1941. Crews from the fire station also attended the 1987 King’s Cross fire and the 7/7 bombings in 2005.

The apartment has been the owners longtime home and they have now sadly outgrown it and need to upsize. The property has been well loved and maintained over the years but is now at the stage where it does ideally require upgrading and subject to the incoming buyers needs a possible reconfiguration of the layout. With it very generous living spaces, there is a ton of scope for modification of the layout ( subject to any consents ) should the incoming buyer need to create an additional bedroom or just a re jig of the current bedroom layout to add a guest cloakroom and utility area.

With the apartments key features, of its own entrance, direct access to plentiful outdoor living - its a wider than average south east facing garden plot, and the existing Garden studio, there is so much potential for a creative new owner to transform and customise the space and add value.

Set on the lower ground floor of this classic white stucco house, the flat features an independent side entrance which opens into a hallway with built in coats cupboards and then onto a spacious and attractive living room with lovely views and direct access onto a well landscaped garden with a southerly aspect. Off the reception room is a well fitted kitchen which also has a window with lovely garden views.

The flat further benefits from a large internal study area which is at the centre of the flat and leading off are the 2 bedrooms. The master has a front aspect and a large en-suite bathroom and the second smaller bedroom has a shower room en-suite.

The real attraction of this apartment is its wonderful private garden which has ample space for outdoor entertaining and children's play areas. The current owners have built a separate garden room of 9'10 x 5'11 ( 59 sq ft ) which is ideal as a work studio, study or small playroom.

The property is very well situated in the heart of trendy Belsize Park very close to an array of vibrant shopping hubs and transport links offering very easy access in an out of town. There also a huge choice of schools within a very short walk.

House D offers 2,917 sq ft (271sq m) of generous accommodation over four floors and benefits from cutting edge design, materials and finishes. The garden level provides open plan family/dining room with a bespoke German made kitchen and Miele appliances with direct access on to a private landscaped garden. This floor also offers a large utility room, cloaks area and guest cloakroom.

The ground floor boasts a 22ft reception room and study as well as a second guest cloakroom. Stunning 2 bedroom 2nd floor apartment in a highly sought after purpose built block in NW2, Kilburn. Located near Kilburn Underground Station for the Jubilee Line and Brondesbury for the London Overground.

The property is located on the 2nd floor and comprises of 2 spacious bedrooms with built in mirrored wardrobes, a stunning bright lounge, a fully fitted eat in kitchen with appliances including washing machine, dishwasher, gas hob and oven, plenty of worktop and storage space and 2 fully tiled bathrooms with showers.

The apartment benefits from an entryphone for additional security and is available for sale now.

Jubilee Heights has 24 hour CCTV, an on-site porter, a communal roof terrace with stunning views of the City and secure underground parking (1 parking space is included with the property). Jubilee Heights offers an array of services such as a residents gym with heated swimming pool, exercise rooms, segregated changing rooms/bathrooms, sauna (wet sauna steam room and dry sauna).

The popular shopping amenities of Central London's Oxford Street/Bond Street, Finchley Road's The O2 Centre, Shepherd's Bush Westfield Shopping Centre and Brent Cross Shopping Centre are all within easy reach via excellent bus links and the Jubilee Line via Kilburn Underground station and the London Overground via Brondesbury station.

Do not miss this opportunity to own this spacious flat in a highly sought after block, located conveniently near local amenities and transport links. Call to book a viewing now.

detailedDescription:
A stunning four bedroom Victorian family house on one of West Hampstead's most sought-after and premier roads. This exceptional residence, extending to approximately 2366 sq ft, is perfect for family living.

Having gone through an extensive refurbishment to exacting standards, stand-out features include: Double reception room with fireplace and Chesneys wood-burning stove, original features and high ceilings. Leading seamlessly from the reception, you are invited into a bright and airy kitchen/diner, complimented by a bespoke Roundhouse kitchen with generous storage and larder, Miele & Bosch appliances and a stunning waterfall quartzite island. A paved patio garden is accessed via wall-to-wall bi-folding doors, perfect for summer entertaining. The upper floors boast four large bedrooms, with the primary bedroom encompassing a four-piece en-suite and walk-in wardrobe for pure luxury. Two further bedrooms benefit from their own en-suite bathrooms, complimented by a family bathroom. Additionally, a guest cloakroom is located on the ground floor, a versatile utility/storage and mudroom in the lower ground, and underfloor heating tailored to designated areas of the house.

Nestled in the very heart of West Hampstead, Narcissus Road is ideally positioned within walking distance of the boutique and independent shops, restaurants and cafes on West End Lane. Transport links are second to none with the Jubilee Line, London Overground and Thameslink stations a stone's throw away. Excellent primary schools such as Emmanuel Church of England and Beckford Primary are nearby, together with many of the area's top Private and International schools.
A truly wonderful family home!

agency_name: Savills - St. John's Wood & Regents Park
address: Chester Terrace, Regent's Park, St. John's Wood NW1
detailedDescription:
A classical regent’s park home which has been beautifully refurbished to retain classical elements, with a modern twist.

Location

Chester Terrace is a quiet private road, set back from the Outer Circle. The terrace is fronted by a 300 metre communal garden and is served by private residents’ security. Regent’s Park itself is closed to traffic from midnight to the early hours of the morning.

The property is within easy reach of Regent’s Park (Bakerloo Line), Great Portland Street (Hammersmith and City, Circle and Metropolitan Line) Underground Stations.

Description

This classical residence has been re designed and refurbished in recent years and has exceptional uninterrupted views over Regent’s Park. Savills St. John’s Wood are proud to bring to the market this exceptional residence in Regent’s Park. The house offers family accommodation within a classical town house, with the added benefit of a passenger lift which accesses all floors. From the grand entrance hall on the ground floor is a beautifully designed dining room and a fully fitted kitchen. On the first floor, the elegant reception room features exceptionally high ceilings and elegant volumes with picturesque west-facing views over Regent’s Park.

The master bedroom suite occupies the entire second floor, with a dressing room and luxurious en suite bathroom. On the third floor there are 3 bedrooms and 2 bathrooms. The lower ground floor has a media/ family room, a utility room and access to the vaults leading off from the lower ground courtyard. There is also an internal garage which can be accessed via the rear of the property.

Leasehold with approximately 129 years remaining

address: Birkenhead Street, Kings Cross, London WC1H
detailedDescription:
An absolutely exceptional 6 double bedroom mid-terraced Grade II listed family home which has been refurbished by the current owners to what can only be described as an exacting standard with painstaking attention to detail and eye for quality. The house affords a wonderful blend of the old and the new creating a slick modern home whilst retaining much of the charm and character expected for a property of this period. Much of the design and many of the finishes are bespoke, with the property benefitting from the highest quality fittings. Accommodation comprises a wonderful open plan kitchen/dining room on the raised ground floor with a bespoke kitchen, central island and ample room to sit and eat. To the rear there is a cosy family room with an adjoining shower room and WC (this room could also be used as a further bedroom). Bi-folding doors open to a charming private terrace beneath which sits an integrated hot tub. The terrace floor can be removed leaving one to enjoy the hot tub. The 1st floor floor is home to a wonderful bright, airy formal reception room with tall ceilings, full height sash windows and a working fireplace. To the rear is a charming study ideal for these working from home. The study can also be accessed via a door from the reception room. On the second floor can be found 2 good size double bedrooms along with a family bathroom and ample built-in storage on the landing. Located on the top (3rd) floor is the lavish master bedroom suite complete with air conditioning, vaulted ceiling, dressing room and en-suite shower room with a double glass encased shower. The bedroom also comes with its own private roof terrace affording attractive westerly views towards St Pancras and the Post Office tower. The lower ground floor can be accessed both internally and externally and can be self-contained. Thoughtfully designed, accommodation comprises a living room with semi-open plan kitchen cleverly built in to one of the under pavement vaults, together with an en-suite double bedroom, guest cloakroom and a pretty courtyard garden. To the rear and accessed via an internal pull-down staircase is a large west facing iroko decked terrace ideal for summer entertaining.
Birkenhead Street is a residential street running between Euston Road and St Chad's Street, a stone's throw from the newly regenerated transport hub & destination location that is King's Cross/ St Pancras International. Bloomsbury and the West End are within easy reach. King's Cross offers a wealth of transport connections to get around London (Metropolitan, Piccadilly, Victoria, Northern, Hammersmith and City, Circle lines and National Rail), with St Pancras affording trains to mainland Europe. World class shopping, dining and hotel facilities can be found at King's Cross including Granary Square & Coaldrops Yard amongst many others.

The awe-inspiring accommodation has new double glazing with plantation shutters on all windows and French doors. The top floor can be used as occasional guest bedroom/bedroom 3 or a second reception.

The bright new dine-in kitchen boasts quartz worktops, shaker units with high wall cupboards, beautiful tiling and all new integrated Bosch appliances including dishwasher and washer/dryer. Completed with new lighting throughout, the property also benefits from beautiful new kahrs oak flooring, brand new bathrooms and new German made, grey lacquer finished fitted wardrobes.

Leasehold with approximately 125 years remaining

address: St. Pancras Chambers, Euston Road, London NW1
detailedDescription:
A stunning apartment within a magnificent landmark building. Set on the second floor, this grand two bedroom, three bathroom apartment has 1,623 sq ft of lateral living space and is one of the largest and most unique in the building. You enter first into a vestibule, then into the beautiful open plan semi-circular shaped kitchen/living/dining room, with balcony. There is a bathroom off the corridor. One of the bedrooms has stairs to a mezzanine level, and the other has an ensuite bathroom both with balconies, you will also find a rare extra guest powder room. Whilst St Pancras Chambers has been completely refurbished, it is the second and third floors that have retained much of the period detail in the form of cornices, mouldings, panelling, doors and fireplaces. All such details have been retained and refurbished.

Situation
St. Pancras Chambers is moments from all the shops, bars and numerous transport amenities of Kings Cross St. Pancras. (Eurostar, Piccadilly, Victoria, Circle, Hammersmith & City lines and overland services out of the capital). Also nearby are the enormously popular Granary Square and Coal Drops Yard which offer fine dining and boutique shopping options. Islington and Camden are both within easy reach and there are numerous bus links in to The City and West End. Regents Canal is an excellent option for walkers/runners.

title: 3 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
A beautifully presented two bedroom apartment set in the iconic St. Pancras Chambers development in Kings Cross. The development benefits from a 24 hour concierge, lift, and room service. Chain Free.

Arranged over the fourth floor the apartment features a spacious open plan reception room with wooden floors and a modern kitchen with integrated appliances, double height ceilings, two double bedrooms with built in storage (one with an en-suite) and a further bathroom.

Located above Kings Cross St. Pancras station, one of London's major transport hubs allowing for National Rail services, Underground services (Circle, Hammersmith & City, Metropolitan, Northern, Piccadilly, & Victoria lines), bus links and the Eurostar with direct links to Paris in 2h 15m.

A vast array of café's, bars, restaurants are just a stone's throw away as are the shopping delights of Granary Square and the highly anticipated 'Coal Drops Yard' shopping centre. Chain free.

History of the development....
St. Pancras Chambers is a Victorian Neo-Gothic building originally designed by George Gilbert Scott as the Midland Grand Hotel, the building finished construction in 1873. After narrowly escaping demolition to make way for more railway tracks, the building was given Grade I status in 1967.

In 2004 The Manhattan Loft Company took up the mantle of meticulously converting the space into flats and restoring the hotel. The renovation works were completed in 2009 and 2011 respectively. This apartment is one of only 67.

detailedDescription:
A sensational two bedroom apartment (747 sqft) situated on the third and fourth floors of No 11 Fitzjohn's Avenue, an exclusive new development of 1,2 and 3 bedroom apartments within an elegantly restored period residence.

No. 11 is a beautiful Victorian villa nestled amongst the lush tree-lined boulevard of Hampstead's Fitzjohn's Avenue, noted in 1883 by Harpers magazine as 'one of the noblest streets in the world'. The villa contains just twelve luxurious apartments, restored to the highest standards and with absolute focus on conserving the original heritage. Elegant period features have been reintroduced and blend seamlessly with clean contemporary finishes. This imposing building encompasses all that grand Victorian living had to offer, re-imagined for the 21st century.

Features:
" Kitchens by Poggenpohl
" Underfloor heating
" Comfort cooling to living spaces and master bedroom
" Oak chevron flooring to living spaces
" Bespoke fitted wardrobes to all bedrooms
" Sonos sounds systems with speakers to living spaces and master bedroom

location:
Of all the beautiful areas within Hampstead, Fitzjohn's Avenue is one of the most sought after. The avenue, built in the late 1800's, was the centre piece of the Hampstead master plan created by Sir Spencer Maryon-Wilson. This exclusive road, lined with alternate red and white chestnut trees and styled as a Parisian boulevard, became the focal point for the intellectual elite of London. Just a short stroll offers so much to explore; Belsize Village is just around the corner offering local and specialist produce from great independents. At the end of the road are the delights of cultural Hampstead with a theatre, cinema, historic houses, a wealth of culinary treats and plenty of retail therapy.

For the quieter moments, Primrose Hill to the south is within a short distance offering beautiful open space and astonishing views over London. To the north 800 acres of Hampstead Heath offers open green pastures, woodlands, ponds and meadows. Sharing the space with Henry Moore's and Barbara Hepworth's sculptures only enhances the sense of peace and serenity.

Important Note:

1. The development consists of both refurbished and new build properties.

They are subject to change from time to time without notice and their accuracy or completeness is not guaranteed. Nor are they intended to form part of any contract or a warranty unless specifically incorporated into the contract.

detailedDescription:
A superb split level two bedroom apartment offering over 1,150 sq ft of accommodation arranged over the fourth and fifth floors of this historic Grade I listed building. The property features a wonderful beamed reception room with a smart, modern open plan kitchen above which sits a mezzanine, ideal as a study or else a further occasional bedroom.

There are two generous double bedrooms on the lower level, the principal with an en-suite bathroom and both with fitted storage. There is also a further family bathroom on this floor together with a utility room.

Residents of St Pancras Chambers benefit from the services of a 24 hour concierge, gym (by subscription) and access to room service courtesy of the 5 star Marriott Renaissance hotel which adjoins the development.

*Please note that car parking is available by separate negotiation*

Owing to our commitment to keep both our colleagues and clients safe during this period of recommended isolation, we have many self-serve viewing options available to you. These include video walkthroughs, 360 virtual reality viewings and enhanced comprehensive photography.

The property is ideally located for both King's Cross and St. Pancras International stations with six London Underground lines together with national and international rail services within a stone's throw.

King's Cross offers world class shopping, dining and hotel facilities including the recently opened 'Coal Drops Yard'. The site, which was originally established in 1850 has been transformed to become an incredible space housing a mix of fifty concept stores, bars, restaurants and public spaces.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Prime London location, private terrace, gardens, a swimming pool, a gym, parking, a concierge service… and a six-figure price tag? Yes, you read that right: 11 Albert Court offers a luxury lifestyle in the capital for a good deal less money than you’d expect.

The two-bedroom, two-bathroom flat is on the ground floor of a gated modern development in Marylebone, one of the most desirable neighbourhoods in London, with dozens of excellent restaurants, bars, cafes and shops on the doorstep.

Yet it feels secluded, thanks to the communal gardens, and residents have access to an underground car park, a pool, a gym and a 24-hour concierge service.

The flat has a small terrace garden and is ready to move into, but there's scope for a refurb to make it your dream London pad. It would also suit an investor, with similar flats in the area bringing in up to £2,800 a month in rent.

Key Features

* Central London location
* Two bedrooms
* Private terrace and communal gardens
* Pool and gym
* Concierge service
* Underground car park

Location and Transport Links

Albert Court is part of the Palgrave Gardens development, a short walk from Regent's Park, one of the capital's most popular green spaces. There are great shops and restaurants on nearby Marylebone High Street and Baker Street. Marylebone station, a five-minute walk away, has Tube and mainline train services, and is two stops from Paddington, for trains to Heathrow airport and the west of England. Baker Street Tube station is the best option for the City. Both stations are in London Underground Zone 1. By car, it's a short drive to the A40 and the A5.

Nearby Amenities

Albert Court is close to several schools rated good or outstanding by Ofsted, including Christ Church Bentinck CofE and Gateway Academy (both primary), and Ark King Solomon Academy and the St Marylebone School (both secondary).

A Tesco Express and a branch of Boots are within easy walking distance, as is Alfies Antique Market, a great spot for vintage finds. The Marylebone Healthcare Centre is 0.6 miles away and it's 0.4 miles to the Marylebone House Dental Practice

There's an Everyman cinema on Baker Street and the Sherlock Holmes Museum is 0.3 miles from the property. You can go boating in Regent's Park and cricket fans can walk to Lord's for Test matches.

Central heating
Gas, with radiators throughout the flat. The property is double glazed.

Room by room

The flat has two double bedrooms, one of which could be fitted out with twin beds for guests or children. It's currently used as an office and guest room. The main bedroom has integrated storage and an ensuite with a bath and shower, a sink, a toilet and a tiled floor. The second bathroom has a bath and shower, a sink and a toilet.

There's a feature fireplace in the living room, which had french doors leading to the terrace. The neutral decor is ideal for hanging artworks or could be jazzed up with a bold feature wall.
The kitchen has built-in cupboards, a sink with a drainer, a mixer tap, a gas hob and an integrated electric oven and appliances.

Bedroom 1 3.3m x 5.3m, double bedroom, integrated storage
Bedroom 2 4.17m x 2.48m, double bedroom
Bathroom 1 1.71m x 2.21m, bath and shower, toilet, sink, floor looks like carpet?
Ensuite 2.57m x 2.13m, ensuite to bedroom 1, bath and shower, toilet, tiled floor

Kitchen 3.58m x 1.92m, built-in cupboards, sink including drainer, mixer tap, gas hob, integrated electric oven and appliances
Hallway 7.33m x 1.9m
Private terrace with decking and borders

Making an offer through us
We already have the title plan, searches and a homebuyer survey report on the property. Request details to see the information. Having these documents upfront will save time and stress when you have had an offer accepted.

address: Nottingham Terrace, Regent's Park, London NW1
detailedDescription:
A stunningly refurbished split level apartment set within an exclusive, gated Crown Estate terrace on the southern side of Regent’s Park.

Location

Nottingham Terrace is a private gated road on the Southern side of Regent's Park, located within York Terrace West, just to the north of Marylebone Road and to the east of Baker Street allowing easy access to Baker Street underground station and Marylebone High Street with its various shops, bars and restaurants.

The park itself is only a short walk away and offers a wide range of recreational facilities, including the Zoological Gardens, the open air theatre, Queen Mary's Gardens, the boating lake and tennis courts.

Description

This split level apartment set on the southern side of Regent's Park offers comfortable well planned living accommodation and comprises two bedrooms, two bathrooms, and a large open plan reception, dining room and kitchen. The refurbishment was carried out to a high standard and the configuration was carefully thought through to ensure the space was maximized.

Nottingham Terrace occupies a quiet position within a private gated road, situated in a modern purpose built apartment building within the Crown Estate.

The property benefits from a 24 hour concierge service, 24 hour security, off-street parking for visitors and secure underground parking as well as the benefit of a secure basement store room.

Square Footage: 1140 sq ft

Leasehold with approximately 134 years remaining

detailedDescription:
A newly decorated, modern and spacious (84.5 sq m/909 sq ft) two double bedroom apartment situated on the 8th floor of a prestigious 16-storey glass development.

The property is immaculately presented and consists of a large entrance hall, reception room with dining area, separate fully equipped eat in kitchen, modern family bathroom/wc, master bedroom with fitted wardrobes and en-suite shower/WC. A further double bedroom with fitted wardrobes.

The apartment benefits from wood flooring and underfloor heating throughout and two private balconies boasting great views across London (with access from the reception room and the two bedrooms).

Visage Apartments also features an intercom entry system, lift access, 24hr concierge service with CCTV and the apartment has a secure allocated underground parking space.

Located on the corner of Winchester and Adelaide Road and just a short walk away from Swiss Cottage Underground Station (Jubilee Line) close by to other good local amenities such as bars, pubs and restaurants.

A substantial Edwardian house set over five floors in the heart of Belsize Park.

Location

Glenloch Road is a leafy residential street situated in the heart of Belsize Village. Positioned between Belsize Park Gardens and Haverstock Hill, it is convenient for both the underground, shops and the charm of England's Lane. The beautiful open spaces of Hampstead Heath and Primrose Hill are within 1 mile.

For transport Belsize Park Underground Station (Northern Line) is approximately 0.2 miles away and Hampstead Heath Overground Station is approximately 0.6 miles away.

Description

Boasting a plethora of stunning period detailing, this characterful house has fabulous proportions throughout. The ground floor offers two magnificent reception rooms with a large Mark Wilkinson custom-made kitchen. There are two beautiful, gas operated, vintage fireplaces in the principal bedroom and the dining room. The principal suite occupies the majority of the first floor and there are 6/7 further bedrooms throughout the property. The studio flat on the lower ground floor can be used as a self-contained apartment as it has its own entrance. The garden is paved with shrub borders and there is a terrific roof terrace.

Please note: The property further benefits from planning permission. (Application number: 2018/4200/P).

detailedDescription:
Two bedroom garden apartment set in the Hillmarton conservation area

Location

Ideally located on a tree lined residential street within the Hillmarton Conservation Area, is this beautifully presented, and newly refurbished two double bedroom apartment with large recently landscaped private garden. Hillmarton Road is located within a short distance to a range of amenities on Caledonian Road and Holloway Road including Waitrose & Morrisons, independent coffee shops, eateries and fresh food market. The ever popular Upper Street and green parks at Hampstead Heath can be reached via a short bus ride.

Description

Occupying the entire ground floor of an imposing semi-detached Victorian conversion, the owners have designed and modernised the apartment throughout using a clever blend of both period and contemporary decoration whilst providing modern living and functionality. Entering through a private front door, the hallway gives way to the very large open-plan reception / dining room with an abundance of natural light from floor to ceiling double French doors. The adjacent kitchen offering a picture window with views over the garden has a selection of wall and base units, four ring gas and hood extractor fan. To the front aspect, the main bedroom benefits from a wonderful bay window and bespoke fitted wardrobes cleverly using the space in the alcoves, whilst the adjoining room offers a further well-proportioned second double bedroom. The fully tiled family bathroom comprises of full size bath tub with shower attachment, wash basin with single lever mixer tap and low level W.C. Entered from the reception room, the private garden offers further entertaining space which has been tastefully landscaped and finished with wood decking laid to mature lawn and featheredge fencing.

Square Footage: 851 sq ft

Leasehold with approximately 121 years remaining

address: St. Pancras Chamber, Euston Road, London NW1
detailedDescription:
An opportunity to acquire a magical and unique apartment in an iconic piece of London architecture.

Retaining much of its original features, including the only painted ceiling in the Chambers, this two bedrooms apartment is one of a kind.

Situated on the second floor it features iconic windows and high ceilings along with the stunning gothic architecture of Sir Gilbert Scott, gifting this home with an ambience of space & light.

Spanning approximately 1600 square feet across the clocktower, the current owner has meticulously refurbished the property to very high standards. It comprises two bedrooms, two bathrooms and a large reception room flooded with natural light.

The building has the added benefit of a 24 hour porter, lift access and allocated parking.

address: Hampstead Manor, Kidderpore Avenue, Hampstead, London NW3
detailedDescription:
An outstanding three-bedroom apartment (1614 sqft / 150 sqm) with a terrace, forming part of a sensational new development, Hampstead Manor.

Located on Kidderpore Avenue, just minutes from Hampstead village, Hampstead Manor is a beautifully crafted collection of new homes in the coveted NW3 postcode. The distinguished 156 residences range from studio apartments to four-bedroom homes, crisp contemporary apartments to immaculately converted Grade II listed heritage properties. Offering a calm oasis from the bustle of the City and excellent connections to the rest of London, Hampstead Manor affords the best of both worlds.

The development is a truly remarkable proposition - an intriguing mix of eras and architectural styles that begs to be explored, a triumph of the art of restoration and an exquisite collection of considered, crafted homes.

Key Features

Modern conversion retaining the excellence of its original Edwardian and mid twentieth century architectural character.

Duplex apartment

Private terraces

Separate study and media room

Three bathrooms

Siemens integrated appliances

Comfort Cooling to main reception room and principal bedroom.

Underfloor heating

Video entry system

Beautifully landscaped gardens and open green spaces.

Residents benefit from exclusive access to a five-star hotel lifestyle with 24-hour concierge, gym, swimming pool with jacuzzi, sauna and steam room and private town car service.

detailedDescription:
A superb two bedroom apartment situated on the first floor of a recently built development in the heart of Camden Town with a huge, eye-catching south-facing private terrace.

The property has been newly decorated and benefits from wood flooring throughout, a spacious open-plan fully equipped kitchen/reception area with double doors, leading directly to the private terrace, (23ft x 20'8 ft).

There are two spacious bedrooms, a luxurious family bathroom/wc and a modern en-suite shower/wc.

Other features include a lift, air conditioning, utility room, a dedicated refuse area and bike storage.

There are also secure and affordable car parking spaces nearby.

Located on Camden High Street, this development is just moments from Camden Town and Mornington Crescent underground stations and therefore benefits from excellent transport facilities. Camden Town has become an extremely popular and trendy destination in recent years offering a mix of cafes, restaurants and the bustling atmosphere of Camden Market and the attractive Regent's Canal.

It is also in close proximity to the fashionable Primrose Hill which is not only great for picnics and playing sport but also offers some of the most spectacular views across London.

The Vendor has advised;

Tenure: Leasehold with 146 years remaining
Service charges: Approx. £3500.00 per annum
Ground rent: £295.00 per annum

detailedDescription:
A simply stunning home with some serious wow factor. Presented in immaculate condition is this fantastic and wonderfully bright three bedroom garden maisonette, oozing style and sophistication. Measuring in excess of 1200 square feet and boasting 12ft high ceilings and incredible entertaining space in the form of a sumptuous reception area that seamlessly combines the sleek kitchen and dining area. The outdoor space (accessed through bi-fold doors) is fantastic; offering a terrace directly off the the kitchen and dining area before heading down to the southerly-facing, manicured rear private garden, landscaped by an award-winning gardener. The second, larger terrace, perfect for alfresco dining, is also accessed via both bedrooms. There is also side access leading to the garden.
The ground floor offers the master bedroom (en-suite) and two further double bedrooms and the family bathroom.
Furthermore, there is a separate WC, a Chesney's log burner and ample storage throughout.

The property is very well located to take advantage of the excellent amenities of Camden, Kentish Town and Kings Cross. The green open space of Camden Square is a three minute walk and the local parade of shops in Brecknock Road are also very close-by. Transport links are excellent with plenty of bus routes and Camden Town offers both underground and over-ground stations. City Thames Link in Kentish Town goes directly to Gatwick and The City.
In the catchment area for the highly rated Camden School for Girls.

detailedDescription:
A bright 2 bedroom 1 bathroom apartment with a roof terrace arranged over the upper floors of a period house in the heart of Primrose Hill.

This fantastic apartment has been refurbished to a good standard with sash windows, spotlights throughout and a couple of feature fireplaces. It's entrance is on the first floor with stairs to the second floor where there are 2 double bedrooms both carpeted with good storage, a family bathroom, guest W/C and utility cupboard. On the floor above there is an impressive reception room with solid wood flooring, built in storage and glass sliding doors to a South facing roof terrace with garden views. The Bulthaup kitchen includes a Miele Oven, Siemens appliances, Built-In Nespresso Coffee maker, Fischer and Paykel dishwasher and this area has tiled flooring with underfloor heating.

Gloucester Avenue is located within walking distance to the local amenities and park in Primrose Hill. Chalk Farm Underground Station (Northern Line) is 0.4 miles away.

detailedDescription:
Summary
Set within a quiet street close to both Tottenham Court Road and Holborn underground stations giving easy access to both the City, & West End. The split level apartment benefits from ample storage and is in excellent condition and is within close proximity to all local amenities.

Description
Recently coming to prominence as Midtown, the area linking Fitzrovia, Clerkenwell, Bloomsbury, Covent Garden & High Holborn provides an exciting range of residential property from character period houses and conversions to iconic modern blocks.
With your Central London home close to Holborn and with easy access to Theatreland, Kingsway & Lincoln's Inn, you will be ideally placed to get around the area. Whether for work or leisure, this is the perfect location from which to reach an outstanding range of shopping, entertainment and eateries, including World-Renowned shopping areas such as Oxford Street and Bond Street, Cinema, Theatre and Opera around Leicester Square, Drury Lane and Shaftsbury Avenue and the famous eateries of Covent Garden, Soho and Chinatown, whilst Bloomsbury to the North has been a fashionable part of London for over 250 years, and contains some of London's finest parks as well as being well known for numerous Health-Care institutions, including the bma, gosh, ucl and the National Hospital for Neurology and Neurosurgery, this sought-after residential area is also home to the British Museum, British Library and the University of London's central bodies and departments.
Easy access is afforded across London with the superb network of buses.The Piccadilly & Central Line Underground are both available from Holborn Station, whilst Kings Cross, St Pancras and Charing Cross Stations are less than a mile away and provide links to the rest of the UK and Europe.

address: Mccrone Mews, Belsize Village, Belsize Park NW3
detailedDescription:
Live The London Village Lifestyle With This Stylish 2 Bedroom Mews Apartment Situated In One Of The Area's Prettiest Private Mews Just Moments From The Heart Of Belsize Village.

This delightful property provides a comfortable and characterful home with numerous appealing features including its own front door, 2 double bedrooms, a luxury en-suite shower room, additional bathroom and a lovely open plan living room/kitchen with large sash windows and a southerly aspect.

The entire flat is part of an additional floor set atop the original 2 storey Victorian mews buildings and was completed with a stylish interior in 2016/2017. It features a smart fully equipped open plan kitchen with gloss finish handleless cabinets, quartz worktops and mainly Bosch appliances Both bedrooms are doubles, again with tall windows, neutrally decorated and carpeted plus there is a luxury 'Porcelanosa' bathroom with a skylight window and en-suite shower room to the main bedroom.

The property has a quality finish throughout, with engineered oak flooring in the living room and kitchen areas and velvet grey carpets in the bedrooms, all with underfloor heating. The fitted wardrobes and doors throughout the flat are in an oak finish. The windows are double glazed in timber frames and there is LED lighting throughout plus Data and AV wiring.

McCrone Mews is set just off Belsize Lane and provides a unique village lifestyle combining the mix of vibrant boutique cafes and restaurants and independent shops in Belsize Village, literally a few moments away, and historic Hampstead Village with its array of chic fashion stores, trendy eateries and picturesque pubs. The wide open spaces and havens of fresh air of Hampstead Heath and Primrose Hill are within a short stroll.

There are a wide range of transport hubs within a short walk giving very easy access in and out of town. The Northern, Jubilee and Metropolitan lines are all within a 10/15 minute walk plus a variety of bus links close by. For food shopping, there is a Waitrose, Sainsbury's and a Private Budgens Supermarket, all within a short walk plus a range of smaller independent and organic stores including a popular greengrocers, baker/deli and fishmongers close by in Belsize Village.

Nb: This Property has no rights for Parking. This property is located within a car free development zone where there is not sufficient capacity for any additional vehicles to be parked on the highway.

Therefore when granting planning permission for this home Camden Council have placed a condition removing the ability to apply for or obtain a cab parking permit.

description
This beautiful presented apartment is located a short distance from the world famous Covent Garden in the heart of London's West End and is a world renowned and unique destination for visitors and Londoners who enjoy shopping, theatre, restaurants, bars, history and culture as well as a broad range of businesses.

Geographically, Covent Garden is located in Central London, bordered by the City of London and Leicester Square. It is within walking distance of Soho, the river Thames, a wide range of parks and garden squares and Trafalgar Square. There are several smaller areas within Covent Garden that are worth exploring such as the traffic-free Covent Garden market piazza, The Opera Quarter, St Martin's Courtyard, Seven Dials, Neal's Yard, and Floral Street.

Behind the wonderfully vibrant streets, Covent Garden is a unique residential area with a huge array of property styles from character and historic period buildings, through a wide variety of affordable, ex-local authority home, to top of the market, state-of-the-art modern luxury apartment blocks.

Transport links are exceptional being served by nearby Circle, Piccadilly and Northern Underground Lines at Holborn, Covent Garden, Leicester Square and Tottenham Court Road Underground Stations as well as a tremendous range of buses.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Positioned on one of Hampstead’s finest residential streets is this beautiful four-bedroom house, extended and refurbished in recent years to a design by architect Jason Devaney. The expansive, bright interiors open out to a peaceful garden – also home to a studio – via large glazed doors that let in brilliant amounts of natural light. Lisburne Road is minutes from the green spaces and swimming ponds of Hampstead Heath, as well as the amenities of Hampstead Village and Belsize Park.

The Tour

The house presents a typically Victorian façade to the street, with an elegant redbrick bay on the ground floor and full-height glazing on the second floor. Set partially back from Lisburne Road, behind a small front garden, the house forms part of a charming terrace running south from Hampstead Heath towards Belsize Park. Upon entry, a truly modern approach to space, light and flow is apparent. The finest contemporary materials have been used and the overall configuration of the house has been thoughtfully enacted with modernist principles firmly in mind.

The kitchen can be found at the front of the house, nestled within the grand bay window; this has a window seat and an unbroken sightline that extends to the foot of the garden. This arrangement allows natural light to spill across the plan, resounding off the beautiful marble floors and sleek Corian worktops. The linear nature of the striated marble further accentuates this sense of seamless flow. Adjoining the kitchen is a cosy breakfast room with a marble fireplace and a pocket door leading to the hallway and cloakroom area.

Arguably the most impressive space is the large open-plan living and dining room, which is positioned three steps down from the kitchen and breakfast room. This area is fantastically bright, illuminated by light that streams in through a long row of skylights over the dining area. It extends out towards the back garden via an area that the current owners refer to as “the conservatory”; a living space with large-scale skylights above and glazed doors that open directly to the garden patio.

The first floor comprises three double bedrooms, each with built-in wardrobes. The largest of the three occupies a wonderful position at the front of the house, with two large sash windows that draw in natural light from the west-facing aspect. There is also a large family bathroom on this floor.

The main bedroom and en suite occupy the entire top floor. High ceilings and a mono-pitched roof with two skylights ensure these spaces are exceptionally bright and airy, and there are built-in wardrobes which provide ample storage space. The en suite has marble tiles arranged in a herringbone pattern underfoot, as well as marble micro-tiles on the walls, twin sinks and a freestanding bath.

Outdoor Space

The east-facing garden is mostly paved, surrounded by raised beds with mature plants and shrubss. The current owners have set up two seating areas, one just beyond the conservatory’s glazed doors and another just outside the beautiful garden studio. This versatile space is perfect for a home gym, study, or even an artist’s studio. It has glazed doors oriented towards the house, as well as running water and electricity.

The Area

Lisburne Road is situated just three minutes walk from the open spaces of Hampstead Heath, and is a short walk to the shops and restaurants of Hampstead Village and Belsize Park. The fantastic Parliament Hill Lido is within five minutes walk. Nearby are the independent retailers of Fortress Road and the weekly farmers’ market at Parliament Hill. The boutiques and restaurants of Hampstead are within easy reach, while just across the Heath is Swains Lane and its wonderful array of shops, including Bourne’s Fishmongers, Fam Greengrocers, Primrose Hill Butchers and Gail’s. The area is also home to some of London’s best independent schools.

Gospel Oak station (London Overground) is around three minutes’ walk and Belsize Park Underground station (Northern Line) can be reached in around 12 minutes.

Leighton Road is renowned for its classical Georgian and Victorian architecture from the 1790s through to the mid-1860s and runs east from Kentish Town Road up to Brecknock Road.

Description
Recently coming to prominence as Midtown, the area linking Fitzrovia, Clerkenwell, Bloomsbury, Covent Garden & High Holborn provides an exciting range of residential property from character period houses and conversions to iconic modern blocks.
With your Central London home close to Holborn and with easy access to Theatreland, Kingsway & Lincoln's Inn, you will be ideally placed to get around the area. Whether for work or leisure, this is the perfect location from which to reach an outstanding range of shopping, entertainment and eateries, including World-Renowned shopping areas such as Oxford Street and Bond Street, Cinema, Theatre and Opera around Leicester Square, Drury Lane and Shaftsbury Avenue and the famous eateries of Covent Garden, Soho and Chinatown, whilst Bloomsbury to the North has been a fashionable part of London for over 250 years, and contains some of London's finest parks as well as being well known for numerous Health-Care institutions, including the bma, gosh, ucl and the National Hospital for Neurology and Neurosurgery, this sought-after residential area is also home to the British Museum, British Library and the University of London's central bodies and departments.
Easy access is afforded across London with the superb network of buses.The Piccadilly & Central Line Underground are both available from Holborn Station, whilst Kings Cross, St Pancras and Charing Cross Stations are less than a mile away and provide links to the rest of the UK and Europe.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
This incredibly bright two-bedroom duplex apartment can be found on Netherhall Gardens, a quiet street in the Fitzjohns/Netherhall Conservation Area of Hampstead. The apartment occupies the upper levels of a handsome redbrick block built on the site of a former late-Victorian house to a design by pks Architects. Internally, the apartment extends to almost 1,500 sq ft, much of it arranged across an open-plan living space; it also has a private terrace, access to an immaculate communal garden and secure underground parking.

The Tour

The apartment is entered on the second floor, accessed via a lift from the communal ground floor entrance or basement parking area. The expansive open-plan reception exceeds 40 ft in length and is arranged as kitchen, dining and living space. Bespoke oak-fronted storage is set on both sides and engineered-oak flooring extends throughout. Windows along the southern aspect and glazed doors that open onto a west-facing terrace flood the space with light.

A staircase rises to a landing on the upper level, where there is space for a study area. A large roof light illuminates the ascent and contributes to the feeling of volume. There are two bedrooms on this level, both with built-in wardrobes; one bedroom has an en suite shower room, while the other has wonderful south-facing views across London. Also on this level is a separate utility room and a family bathroom with a freestanding bath.

There is underfloor heating throughout the apartment. All windows are double-glazed and a fresh air cooling system is employed for circulation. Air-source heat pumps are the main energy source, complemented by solar thermal and photovoltaic roof panels. The property is controlled with Crestron home automation, including Lutron lighting and an integrated music system in the principal rooms.

Outdoor Space

At the rear of the property is a communal lawned garden for the sole use of residents. There is demised parking for one car in the secure underground car park, and each apartment has an individually gated storeroom.

The Area

Netherhall Gardens is well situated for access to the shops, restaurants and cafes of Hampstead Village, as well as the open spaces of Hampstead Heath and Parliament Hill. Gail’s, Ginger & White and the Hampstead Creperie are close at hand, as are the cafes of Belsize Village. Many of London’s best independent schools are within easy walking distance.

Hampstead Underground station (Northern Line) is a short walk away; also within five minutes’ walk are Finchley Road Underground station (Northern, Jubilee & Metropolitan Lines) and Finchley Road & Frognal London Overground station.

Tenure: Share of Freehold
Service Charge: Approx. £6,000 per annum

detailedDescription: An elegant four bedroom home (approx. 1959sqft including restricted height) occupying a majority of a mid-Victorian Italianate styled house. North Villas dates back to the 1840’s and residents can enjoy Victorian architecture at its best. Entered on the raised ground floor, this stunning home benefits from an open plan kitchen & dining room that is host to an array of period features and a Juliette balcony to the rear. This floor is also enhanced modern fitted shower room and access to a mid-level terrace. The first floor hosts a grand reception room and a double bedroom, the second floor comprises of two further bedrooms and a family bathroom. A bedroom currently being used as a study is at the top of the house. It is an excellent example of a period maisonette and also benefits from owning the freehold of the building. North Villas is one of the area's most desirable residential roads, offering a tranquil setting with a community vibe. It is situated in The Camden Square Conservation Area which is one of the town’s most revered settings and consists of a small and intimate collection of tree lined residential roads centred around the tranquil green space found on Camden Square. Also allowing easy access into Camden Town which is famous for its diverse markets, a warren of fashion & curiosities and a haven of counter culture offering an array of independent shops and iconic music venues. North Villas is also well located for education purposes Camden School for Girls, The Lycee (Kentish Town), St Martins School of Design and University College London are all in close proximity. Alternatively a short and pleasant stroll down Regents Canal will lead you to the ever evolving Kings Cross where one can indulge in the delights of Granary Square which hosts a wide selection of stylish eateries, sleek bars, popular recreational squares & arts centres, this is also the location of the brand new offices for Google, Facebook, YouTube & The Guardian. For something less urban the green open spaces of Regents Park & breath-taking city scape views from Primrose Hill are just over one mile away. Kings Cross & St Pancras Stations (these stations are served by six underground lines and the Eurostar connecting you to local, national & international destinations) are 1.4 miles away, also there are several bus routes connecting you to London's West-End in under 20 minutes. Other transport links include Camden Road Station (Overground Line) 0.6 miles, Camden Town Station (Northern Line) 0.8 miles, Kentish Town Station (Northern & Overground Lines) 0.7 miles.

detailedDescription:
We are delighted to offer for sale a spacious 3 bedroom, 2 bathroom apartment ideally located on the first floor of Bedford Court Mansions, Bloomsbury’s finest portered mansion block.

The apartment has high ceilings and many period features including an attractive bay window in the principle living room with full height shutters, an ornamental balcony and views onto tree lined Bedford Avenue and decorative ceiling cornices.

Bedford Court Mansions is a sought after mansion block located just south of Bedford Square built circa 1890 as high quality accommodation. The block is owned by the residents management company and has day porters on duty Monday to Saturday.

Residents are able to apply for on street parking permits and apply for access to the private gardens on Bedford Square subject to annual fees.

The transport facilities are superb with Tottenham Court Road (Northern and Central Lines) with the soon to open new Elizabeth Line providing easy access to Heathrow and Canary Wharf. Bloomsbury is home to The British Museum, The University of London and The Royal Academy of Dramatic Arts to name just a few well known landmarks. The West End restaurants, theatres and extensive shops of Oxford Street, Soho, Fitzrovia and Covent Garden are all close by.

detailedDescription:
A delightful one double bedroom flat set on the second (top) floor of a period conversion in the heart of Primrose Hill village, offered for sale in good condition throughout and with the benefit of no onward chain. Princess Road is one of the premier streets in Primrose Hill village, walking distance to Regents Park Road boutiques, pubs (such as the newly opened Albert Pub) and restaurants, as well as Primrose Hill itself, Regents Park and London Zoo.

Measuring approximately 474 sq ft, the property comprises of an entrance hallway with storage cupboards, a double bedroom with fitted wardrobes, a good sized lounge, a separate modern fitted kitchen and a three-piece bathroom suite. It also has access into the roof space as well as use of a vault at basement level.

Features include original sash windows, central heating, a 170 year lease and no onward chain.

Viewings are highly recommended as this property will make an ideal purchase for first time buyers, couples and investors alike.

Location

Princess Road is located between Gloucester Avenue and St Mark's Square in Primrose Hill, moments from the open green spaces of Primrose Hill and Regent's Park.

Plenty of local amenities can be found nearby including coffee shops, cafes, restaurants, bars and pubs - including the iconic and newly reopened Albert Pub, The Engineer and The Princess Of Wales pubs which is located only a few minutes walk away. Regents Canal behind the flat offers pretty strolls watching canal boats in the direction of Camden and Islington or towards London Zoo and St John's Wood.

Camden Town can also be found 0.5 mile away, providing a wider choice of amenities. Camden Town Underground (Northern Line) and Chalk Farm stations provides quick and easy access into Central London and surrounding.

Disclaimer For Virtual Viewings

Some or all information pertaining to this property may have been provided solely by the vendor, and although we always make every effort to verify the information provided to us, we strongly advise you to make further enquiries before continuing.

If you book a viewing or make an offer on a property that has had its valuation conducted virtually, you are doing so under the knowledge that this information may have been provided solely by the vendor, and that we may not have been able to access the premises to confirm the information or test any equipment. We therefore strongly advise you to make further enquiries before completing your purchase of the property to ensure you are happy with all the information provided.

The property underwent a back to brick renovation a few years ago and has been rarely lived in since. This special residence extends to 4,138 sq ft (348.8 sq. M). It is rare to find such an impressive and high standard of finish to find one like this in 'The Crofts' is rare indeed. There is a large secure front garden (approx.33' deep) with off street parking for two cars as well as a single garage. The rear garden includes a large decked area, a patio and a lawn. There is also a sauna/summer house at the end of the rear garden. The house is within 375m of Hampstead Heath and 950m of the shops and transport facilities of Hampstead Village.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
A beautiful bespoke Two-Double Bedroom duplex apartment with share-of-freehold and generous private rear garden, situated in one of the area’s most desirable locations on a quiet tree lined street within the Hillmarton Conservation Area and moments from amenities and transport links.

Arranged over the second floor of this charming Victorian building originally built circa 1890, the property has been meticulously refurbished throughout to retain the authenticity whilst creating more functional living space. Entered on the first floor, the main bedroom on the half landing opens up into a wonderful sized room with vaulted ceilings and fitted wardrobes on the back wall, soaked in natural light from the south-facing refurbished sash window.

The solid oak flooring continues upwards where there is a bright and spacious landing which offers potential to create a work space or reading area, in addition there is access to a large insulated loft area ideal for further storage or potential to extend (STPP, costs and approval). Leading off the landing, the open-plan reception / dining room provides wonderful entertaining space and views over the immediate area from two oversized refurbished sash windows whilst the adjacent second double bedroom offers lots of space for freestanding furniture.

The contemporary hand crafted kitchen is located at the rear of the property and offers integrated appliances and built in cupboard space, finished with a full height and width splashback wall. A bespoke bathroom suite comprises of bathtub and wall mounted shower with wall-mounted controls, floating W.C encased in a solid wood vanity unit with top mounted wash basin and single lever mixer tap. The property further benefits from a private garden, where the owners have created a beautiful space for entertaining complete with stone slabs laid to mature flower beds and pebbled seating area.

This popular area in one of Islington's fastest changing areas benefits from being within close proximity of a range of amenities along Holloway Road including organic supermarkets, coffee shops, eateries and leisure centres. Further amenities on Upper Street and a range of parks including Highbury Fields, Caledonian Park and Paradise Park are all within walking distance of Freegrove Road.

Caledonian Road and Holloway Road are the closest underground stations with direct access to the Piccadilly Line with Drayton Park Mainline Station also near-by. There are several bus routes nearby providing easy access to The West End, The City, King's Cross/St Pancras International and Hampstead Heath recreational ground.<br /><br />

detailedDescription:
An outstanding four bedroom freehold Georgian town house full of character and charm retaining its delightful period features.

Location

Nearby transport links include Great Portland Street (Circle, Hammersmith & C. The house is located on Conway Street, just off the corner of the prestigious Fitzroy Square and is ideally located for access into both the City and the West End.

The property is also well placed to enjoy the boutique shops and restaurants the areas has to offer including the gastronomic delights of Charlotte Street to the south and the eclectic Marylebone Village to the West as well as the wealth of museums, galleries and beautiful garden squares that this pocket of the West End is famed for.

Description

An outstanding four bedroom freehold Georgian town house full of character and charm retaining its delightful period features. The house retains many original features including the floor to ceiling sash windows, Juliette balconies and ornate cornicing. On entering the house, the entrance hallway leads on to a bedroom which is currently being used as a reception room with a feature fire place, there is also another bedroom and large bathroom/utility room at the rear. The staircase leads up to the first floor reception room with its wonderful 3m ceiling height, floor to ceiling sash windows to the front with Juliet balconies and French doors leading on to the terrace from the rear. The principal bedroom occupies the entire second floor with an impressive en-suite shower and ample storage. The third floor is a wonderfully bright and open further reception area with dinning and kitchen leading up to the fourth floor with a fabulous roof terrace with west end views and overlooking Fitzroy Square to the North. The property further benefits from a self contained one bedroom guest flat on the lower ground floor which with a patio garden and two large storage vaults.

Square Footage: 2277 sq ft

detailedDescription:
Guide price £700,000 - £720,000

A beautifully presented and well proportioned, 3 double bedroom apartment in Clerkenwell that is adjacent to the picturesque Wilmington Square and a stone’s throw from the buzzy cafes, bars, and restaurants of Exmouth Market.

The flat comprises 3 double bedrooms, a family bathroom suite, a generous and bright reception room which provides access to the separate kitchen, in turn leading to the private courtyard. Situated on the ground floor, its south-west-facing position and double-aspect windows create a bright and airy atmosphere.

Charles Rowan House is fantastically situated on Margery Street, in a quiet and leafy residential area that is just around the corner from the stylish shops and cafes of Amwell Street and within 10-15mins walking distance of Angel, Farringdon, Kings Cross, and Russell Square underground stations. It is also within 30 mins walk from the City, Old Street, and Oxford Street, and bus stops for the 38,19,341,73,241,30,205, and 63 routes are all within less than 5 minutes walk. The location is a true haven of tranquillity nestled within very easy reach of some of the most popular and thriving areas of London.

Charles Rowan House itself, which is made up of a 50/50 split of council-owned and privately-owned properties, is a Grade ii-listed building of historical importance. This striking red brick accommodation was built in 1920 to house the families of the Metropolitan Police and is a regular stop for architectural walking tours. The block has a warm, friendly community spirit and neighbours enjoy greeting each other as they pass through the palm-filled courtyard at its centre.

For those with young families, the flat is in the catchment area of two primary schools rated outstanding (Hugh Myddleton and Christopher Hatton) and has four nurseries and no less than eight playgrounds and parks within 10 minutes walk. Other benefits of the area include three large supermarkets within 15 minutes walk (at Angel, the Brunswick Centre, and on St Johns Street) as well as the bustling Chapel Market.

agency_name: Savills - St. John's Wood & Regents Park
address: Park Village West, Regent's Park, London NW1
detailedDescription:
A striking Grade II* Listed home which has been extensively modernised internally.

Location

Park Village West can be found on the eastern side of Regent's Park. Regent's Park itself offers a wide range of recreational facilities, including the Zoological Gardens, the open air theatre, Queen Mary's Gardens, the boating lake and tennis courts.

The nearest Underground stations are Great Portland Street (Circle, District, and Metropolitan Lines), and Camden Town (Northern Line), both of which are 0.8 miles and 0.5 miles away, respectively.

Description

This Grade II* Listed property located in Regent's Park offers a striking regency style façade but has been modernized throughout to provide effortless living. As with most of Regent's Park, the houses on Park Village West were designed by the famous British architect, John Nash. The property has retained much of its period character including stone fireplaces and detailed cornicing but has been enhanced to seamlessly incorporate modern and advanced features.

Upon entering on the ground floor, the vast ceiling heights and expansive volumes become apparent. The generous living accommodation is arranged over this level and the lower ground floor. There is a formal reception room adjoined to a formal dining room at ground level which is served by a Dumbwaiter (food lift) connected to the level below where food is prepared. A large bay window brings light into the reception room and there are glass double doors leading from the dining room out onto the picturesque garden. A guest cloak room is located on this level which is replicated on the level below.
The lower ground floor is home to a substantial and modern kitchen space with room for breakfast dining. Light is brought into this space through the lightwell for the patio which is accessed via glass doors and offers further outdoor space on top of the garden. Adjoined to the kitchen is the media/cinema room which provides a comfortable space to sit with the option of a large retractable projector system. On the other side of the hallway, a full shower room has been installed which serves a really well-proportioned and beautifully finished steam room. A large utility room/plant room which houses multiple washing machine and dryers, also is the base for the mega flow hot water cylinders and boiler.

The master suite expands over the majority of the first floor and offers a large bedroom, dressing room and ensuite bathroom with two basins, a shower and bath. There is also a study on this level as well as further storage. The 2 further double bedrooms are located on the second floor, both being served by a communal shower room. There is ample storage on this level in the bedrooms as well along the hallway.

The house has been fully automated to provide the home owner with a simple to use mobile phone application (Rako) that can control everything from the electric blinds to the cameras to the heating/cooling systems. There are combined heating and air conditioning units located throughout the property as well as radiators. The bathrooms have thermostatically controlled underfloor heating.

Square Footage: 2781 sq ft

Leasehold with approximately 117 years remaining

address: St. Pancras Chambers, Euston Road, London NW1
detailedDescription:
A truly stunning example of a two bedroom apartment offering over 1,200 sq ft of accommodation on the second floor of this historic Grade I listed building. Built in 1866, the building has been meticulously restored to its former glory to showcase the architecture of Sir George Gilbert Scott.

The property features a superb 25'x22' reception room with tall ceilings, three large gothic style windows flooding the room with natural light and a smart, modern open plan kitchen.

There are two double bedrooms, the principal with an en-suite bathroom and the second with a useful mezzanine, ideal for home working together together with a further shower room.

Residents of St Pancras Chambers benefit from the services of a 24 hour concierge, gym (by subscription) and access to room service courtesy of the 5 star Marriott Renaissance hotel which adjoins the development.

Owing to our commitment to keep both our colleagues and clients safe during this period of recommended isolation, we have many self-serve viewing options available to you. These include video walkthroughs, 360 virtual reality viewings and enhanced comprehensive photography.

The property is ideally located for both King's Cross and St. Pancras International stations with six London Underground lines together with national and international rail services within a stone's throw.

King's Cross offers world class shopping, dining and hotel facilities including the recently opened 'Coal Drops Yard'. The site, which was originally established in 1850 has been transformed to become an incredible space housing a mix of fifty concept stores, bars, restaurants and public spaces.

detailedDescription: A stunning three/four bedroom corner mews house with a remarkably large and secluded rear garden, and secure off street parking for one car. Forming part of an exclusive gated development within a prime West Hampstead location, this outstanding family home extends to provide approximately 1547 sq ft / 144 sq M of well-proportioned internal living space and a 97 sq M + private rear garden that has been beautifully landscaped by the current owners. The ground floor accommodation comprises an exceptionally light and airy open plan kitchen/dining/reception room leading onto the garden via bifolding doors, a study/fourth bedroom which looks out onto the garden, a fully converted garage (into a spacious cloak room and utility room which could also function as a gym or play room) and a guest toilet. Upon the upper floors there is a principal bedroom with fitted wardrobes and en-suite shower room, two further double bedrooms both with fitted wardrobes and a family bathroom. The property further boasts excellent storage within its substantial loft. Berridge Mews is a highly sought after gated development, perfectly placed for the many fine schools of West Hampstead and Hampstead, conveniently situated within easy reach of the extensive local shopping, cafes and restaurants of West End Lane, Mill Lane and Fortune Green Road. Greater London Properties are excited to present this recently refurbished one bedroom apartment situated in a highly sought-after Edwardian redbrick block. Set on the second floor (with lift), this beautiful, bright residence is located at Flaxman Terrace in Bloomsbury.

Extending over 540 sq.ft., the property benefits from high ceilings, large original sash-windows and an abundance of natural light. There is a well-proportioned reception room, a luxury eat-in kitchen, a spacious bedroom with ample storage and a modern bathroom with walk-in shower, sink and toilet.

Location

detailedDescription:
This handsome mid. 19th Century 4 bedroom house has been subject to a complete renovation project and has been architecturally restored and reconfigured with sympathetic modernity and exceptional detail. The Grade II listed Home occupies a superb position, set back from the road behind a gated front entrance, in the heart of Hampstead Village. This well configured family home offers nearly 3,000sqft of living space with impressive views to the rear across a private 52ft walled garden.

The property comprises four double bedrooms, a separate walk-in dressing room, an office, three bathrooms, two further W.c's, a double reception room, a large open plan kitchen/dining room, a separate utility room, and a modern glass conservatory leading to a landscaped garden. Off street parking is available by separate negotiation.

Situated on Heath Street the house is ideally located for the various amenities of Hampstead High Street, Hampstead Underground Station (Northern Line) and the green open spaces of Hampstead Heath.
title: 4 bed terraced house for sale

detailedDescription:
This exceptionally light two-bedroom maisonette, occupies two floors of a beautiful Grade ii-Listed townhouse, positioned on a handsome, tree-lined Georgian terrace, in the sought-after area of Lisson Grove, Marylebone. Pairing generous period proportions with modern detailing, the apartment spans circa 860 sq ft across two levels. Marylebone station is approximately four minutes’ walk from the property, with Regent’s Park also reachable under 10 minutes by foot.

The apartment has its own private entrance and large hallway, ideal for storage of bikes and prams. The entrance hall leads, via a split-level stairway, up to the primary living space, a beautifully light open-plan living and dining room, replete with period features and high ceilings. Two full-length sash window with original shuttering provide excellent natural light and timber flooring runs underfoot. An exquisite cast-iron fireplace is flanked by built-in bookshelves. A well-proportioned and beautifully finished family bathroom with marble floors and Villeroy & Boch appliances is positioned between the ground and first floors.

A split-level stairway leads up to two quiet and well-proportioned bedrooms on the second floor. The master bedroom has been cleverly planned to include a walk-in wardrobe and en-suite bathroom and shower (again with marble floors and Villeroy & Boch appliances).

Positioned at the opposite side of the plan is a beautifully designed and recently fitted modern kitchen, designed with ease of use in mind, with long work surfaces, ample storage and integrated Siemens appliances.

Location

Lisson Grove is a ten-minute walk from Marylebone Road and located within a short walk of the shops, cafés and restaurants of St John’s Wood and Maida Vale. The Lisson Gallery is very nearby, as is Church Street market for fruit and vegetables and vintage furniture. Regent’s Park is very nearby and Primrose Hill is also within walking distance along the canal.

Rail connections are excellent, with Marylebone tube station less than five minutes’ walk away and with Baker Street and St John’s Wood stations, which both provide quick access to the West End and Canary Wharf (Jubilee line), also within easy reach.

detailedDescription:
Hunters are delighted to offer this beautifully presented family 3 bedroom Maisonette property for sale, this property is situated off the road from Kiln Place just off Grafton Road and a short walk from the Heart of Kentish Town with a plethora of Shops, Bars, and Restaurants with Transport links starting from just a 4 minute walk to Gospel Oak Station. This is a Purpose built low rise block arranged over the second and third floors with a stairs leading to the front gallery balcony and own front door.

This property comprises a separate living room to the kitchen, three bedrooms, family bathroom with a separate W.C. The flooring throughout the property has recently been renewed with a wood effect floor covering, the living room also has a Juliet balcony for those waiting for their Romeo to arrive, fitted with double glazed windows and allow the natural light to bellow through the room. The kitchen has a tiled effect vinyl floor covering and tiled splash backs, floor and wall units, space for an under counter washing machine, free standing cooker and tall Fridge Freezer and dining/breakfast table. The property further benefits from having a Gas Central Heating System (gchs) and Double Glazing throughout. This is a Must See for anyone relocating to or within the area.

Entrance
Stairs leading to the upper floors and front gallery balcony, with a double glazed front door to the property.

Hallway
Neutral décor, Wood effect floor covering, storage beneath stair, access to Living room and Kitchen, stairs leading to the upper floor with Bedrooms, Bathroom and W.C.

detailedDescription:
Handsome Highgate home with presence and heritage.

Location

Merton Lane is situated roughly equidistant between the fashionable Swains Lane and Highgate High Street and is adjacent to Hampstead Heath with walks to Parliament Hill, Kenwood House and Hampstead High Street.

Description

Savills are proud to offer for sale, Merton House on Merton Lane. The property has been in the same family ownership since 1996 and was fully renovated and extended in 2015. It sits proud at the top of the hill enjoying sweeping views down Merton Lane, towards Parliament Hill and the surrounding area with Hampstead Heath and The Highgate Ponds 0.1 mile walk away. It provides a home where the work/life balance is achieved through easy and fast accessibility for work in the City and West End (approx. 4 miles) and the setting of the wooded slopes of Highgate. The top-class schools of Highgate and Hampstead are within easy reach.

On entering the property, one will quickly notice how much natural light floods in, due to clever use of roof lights, as well as the south-facing position of the property and the fact that most rooms within the house have windows on at least two sides.

The property further benefits from large front and rear gardens, which all encompass the house, all behind security gates and a driveway which offers off-street parking for 4/5 cars. Our clients completed in 2015 an extensive renovation programme which included various extensions of the existing property as well as a comprehensive refurbishment of the entire property. The result is a fantastic family home with both elegant and flexible reception space and large family kitchen, home office and 6 bedrooms, all surrounded by the green spaces which the gardens offer. A south-facing garden room provides sunlight space for an office, studio or a gym or simply for relaxation. The second floor could be used for staff accommodation.

Square Footage: 4506 sq ft
