title: 3 bed detached house for sale

detailedDescription:
Striking new build detached home.

Description

We are proud to offer for sale one of north west London's finest new build properties, ideal for those seeking serenity, space, quality and bespoke finishes, as well as facilities many desire during the current climate. All of the above, whilst being close to Hampstead village, Belsize village, Hampstead Heath, some of the best schools in the UK, as well as fantastic transport links.

Set back from the road, behind security gates, you will find this striking new build detached home in Lyndhurst Gardens, NW3. Measuring approximately 6,344 sq ft, and offering fantastic facilities, such as full home automation, a cinema / games room, a gym and off-street parking for two/three cars. The property is finished to an exceptionally high standard and full details of the specification is available on request from our offices. The property is also laden with technology and is a 'smart home'. There is a building management system in place - a 'knx' system. This controls most of the home automation including lighting, heating, curtains and blinds, the air conditioning (which is present in some rooms) and under-floor heating throughout, all of which are controlled via iPads. There is also a CCTV system which is linked to the alarm system at the property.

The architects who designed the property, really have produced a home which has an excellent flow of accommodation, space distribution, with sunken light wells which also provide outside space. Some modern homes lack warmth and have little or no soul, although we would testify that this property has it in abundance, and this can really only be fully appreciated from an internal inspection.

Features include:

- Detached fully automated smart home
- Gated and set back from the road
- Off-street parking for two/three cars
- First floor reception room / study with attic storage
- 5 bedrooms (3 en suite), further family bathroom
- Upper patio / terrace, lower terrace with access from the main reception room and kitchen
- Large kitchen / dining room
- Gym
- Cinema / entertainment / games room
- Large utility room and plant room, as well as two storage rooms
- Air conditioning in some rooms
- Underfloor heating throughout
- Fully automated curtains and blinds
- Integrated CCTV and alarm system
- knx building management system which controls most of the above via iPads

Square Footage: 6344 sq ft

address: Lyndhurst Gardens, Belsize Park, London NW3
detailedDescription:
Set behind a gated driveway a new build five-bedroom detached house with a contemporary facade is discreet but distinct. Its visible volume contradicts the scale of the living volume beyond. Its exterior styling juxtaposes the area’s notable houses yet pays homage to the evolution of an area known for its culture, creativity, affluent and diverse residents. Designed in a modern vernacular to include a plethora of glass and heritage red brick, synonymous with the area. To the rear is an unexpectedly two-tier garden, secluded with a sense of calmness, with its dining and lounging zones opening on to a protected courtyard, providing an extension to the heart of the living spaces. As you enter a light flooded reception area, with full height glazing to reveal the inner secret and volume of the residence, and the gardens beyond. Descending via the generous cantilevered staircase with natural oak finish, a bespoke specialist glass hand-crafted sculptural chandelier connects the four floors. The falling leaf feature captures the essence of the house’s relationship with nature, and its connection with the internal courtyard space. The secluded courtyard accessed via floor to ceiling sliding glass walls, provide an abundance of natural light to the heart of the house, whilst allowing free flowing movement. Lyndhurst Gardens is enviably positioned in a tree lined location only moments from both Belsize and Hampstead Villages with their array of many boutiques, pavement cafes and restaurants together with easy access to the green spaces of
Hampstead Heath.

Specification:
Water borne under floor heating with multizone control through the building
Electric underfloor heating to bathrooms with heated towel rails
Control 4 AV / speaker system controlled via iPad
Air conditioning in the gym, family room, lounge, kitchen & study
Deco flame ethanol-fuelled remote-controlled fireplace to living area
knx installed throughout allowing complete internal and external lighting control, security programming and climate control
knx controlled curtains to principle living areas and principal bedroom
Bespoke custom made kitchen with Gaggenau and Miele appliances, Quooker hot tap
EuroCave climate controlled wine gallery (max 180 bottles)
Oak joinery
Polished concrete and oak floors
Hand crafted bohemian crystal glass feature pendants by Gladee
CCTV and comprehensive security system
Art works to be sold separately prices on request
Furniture may be available under separate negotiation

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Property video available


Inspired by Pierre Chareau’s iconic Maison de Verre in Paris, Eglon House is one of the most extraordinary new houses to be built in London in living memory. It is tucked away at the end of a gated cobbled mews in the middle of Primrose Hill, combining privacy and security with the convenience of a village location.

Eglon House provides more than 13,000 sq ft of beautifully crafted live/work accommodation, composed of two interlinked buildings, set around a private courtyard and joined at basement level.

The house has been designed with flexibility in mind, and many of the spaces would suit a variety of uses. It could be used as a dwelling, as a commercial building, or as a combination of the two. It would work equally well for a family requiring guest/staff accommodation as it would for an art foundation requiring premises with significant spatial drama.

The larger, eastern, side of the building has an industrial character, with exposed concrete ceilings and surface-mounted services. At its centre is a magnificent double-height grand salon, with a galleried level containing a professional kitchen and dining room. The first floor offers more than 2,000 sq ft of space, currently configured as a breathtaking master bedroom suite, and the second floor contains an extensively glazed ‘orangery’ that would work particularly well as an office.

The western side of the house has a more intimate, domestic scale and an Art Deco atmosphere. The ground floor opens out onto the courtyard, with a double-height living room and a kitchen. The first and second floors contain three bedrooms, three bathrooms and a study. There is a further bedroom and bathroom in the basement, alongside a remarkable swimming pool that doubles as a cinema room, with a mechanical floor and waterproof screen. A lift services all of the floors.

The original Maison de Verre (1928-32) has been described as an elaborate piece of furniture, reflecting Pierre Chareau’s expertise as a product designer, and this craftsman’s sensibility has carried through to Eglon House. This is a project six years in the making. British materials are much in evidence, including a staircase made from pitch-pine and grout mixed with Portland stone. Elsewhere, Lebanese cedar is combined with elegantly patinated Italian marble. There is museum-grade bronze track lighting, the walls have been reinforced to take heavy artworks, and even the fire extinguishers have been custom-made.

Eglon Mews has a location that is simultaneously discreet and convenient. The shops and restaurants of Primrose Hill Village are around the corner, and the open spaces of Primrose Hill and Regent’s Park are a short walk away. Chalk Farm Underground station (Northern Line) is just across the bridge. Many of London’s best schools are within close proximity.

The site has always had a commercial use. A mid-19th-century census map shows a series of stables and barns, where shell casings were manufactured during the First World War. Express Dairies then used it to service their floats, at a time when cattle were still grazed on nearby Primrose Hill. In the 1970s, it was converted into Mayfair Recording Studios, where hits by everyone from Tina Turner and Pink Floyd to The Smiths and The Clash were made.

Although Eglon House settles into the outline of the original structure, it is an entirely new building. Inspired as a homage to Pierre Chareau’s Maison de Verre, this backland site, which has the character of a Parisian mews, was appropriate for a forward-thinking contemporary house imbued with the same Modernist spirit.

Pierre Chareau’s ‘House of Glass’, completed in 1932, was a milestone in early modern architectural design. It was a pioneer of the modern-day live/work phenomenon, with commercial space on the ground floor and living accommodation above. It was commissioned by Doctor Dalsace, who hosted Surrealist soirees in his salle de sejour, which were attended by Jean Cocteau, Joan Miro and Yves Tanguy. The close proximity of other buildings dictated a transparent façade. The iconic glass blocks, which shatter the light like lenses, have been recast for the western façade at Eglon House.

Eglon House takes its cues from Chareau’s original in a number of other ways as well. The design emphasises an honesty of materials, variable transparency of forms, and juxtaposition of ‘industrial’ fixtures with a more traditional style of home décor. Some of Chareau’s furniture and light fittings have been sourced and applied in appropriate areas. Thirties construction methods were used for the exposed shuttered concrete ceilings in part of the building, and there are visible structural elements, just as in the original, such as exposed steel beams with expressed mechanical bolts. The blue carpet in one of the bedrooms is exactly the same colour as that used in the Maison’s master bedroom, alongside other carpets and rugs inspired by artists of the era, such as Ben Nicholson and Alexander Calder.

Despite these similarities, however, Eglon House has been largely created by English craftsmen and adopts an entirely contemporary approach. On the top floor, for example, solar pv matting is set into the triple-glazed roof lights, so that it simultaneously reduces the glare and generates energy. In the basement, the ingenious mechanical rising floor allows the room to act as both a swimming pool and a cinema. The 3m-wide LED waterproof movie screen was specially commissioned and, at the time of fabrication, was the highest-resolution example of that size ever made.

<br/><br/><b>Amenities:</b><br/>Freehold, Swimming Pool, Double Height Feature Living Room, Flexible Accommodation, Resident Parking

detailedDescription:
Set within grounds of 0.7 of an acre, Templewood Avenue presents an elegant Grade II listed Edwardian mansion with grand proportions and planning consent. This ambassadorial abode offers the opportunity for a purchaser to create a magnificent residence of circa 17,000 sq. Ft (1,579 sq. M), behind the original and charming Edwardian façade. The property is currently arranged as 6 apartments and a coach house, and is an income producing asset.

Constructed between 1910 and 1911, by Irish developer George Washington Hart and designed by architect Charles Quennell (1872-1935), this building of significant importance was the final part of the West Hampstead development and in years gone by, has been a hub for tennis tournaments and garden parties on its ample lawns.

A property of generous proportions, this outstanding rich red brick home was constructed to command an impressive position on Templewood Avenue -- and over one hundred years later, it appears no less monumental.

Templewood Avenue is renowned for boasting some of North West London's finest homes, whilst being located a short distance from Hampstead's historical high street and village. Hampstead Heath is located within a few hundred yards, and offers a wide range of recreational facilities, cafés, children's playgrounds, manicured gardens, ponds, and vast unspoilt woodland. Hampstead Underground Station (Northern Line) is within a short walk away.

title: 3 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
This wonderful mid-century townhouse is located on Gayton Road, which lies in the heart of Hampstead Village and is just a few minutes walk from Hampstead Heath. It forms part of a group of 1960s houses designed by architect Ted Levy and retains a number of its original features. Five bedrooms are spread over approximately 2,400 sq ft of internal space; the house also has a large roof terrace, a substantial balcony and a private south-west facing patio with steps down to a communal garden.

The Tour

The houses on Gayton Road form a striking staggered terrace with their white-painted brick façades, substantial sections of glazing and projecting upper levels. Entry to this house is at ground level via a gated front courtyard, though there is also access from Gayton Crescent through the gated communal garden at the rear.

Levy’s design employs a clever split-level arrangement over three central floors. There is a palpable sense of volume and openness, and an excellent distribution of light throughout. The ground floor is an open expanse containing a galleried dining area with double-height ceilings and a sunken living space with floor-to-ceiling glazing, which opens onto the private rear terrace. The kitchen is positioned at the front of the house and is separated from the dining room by glazed sliding panels in the partition wall.

An original open tread staircase clad with original timber panelling ascends to the split level above. This is a fantastic second reception room, currently used as a study, with full-height glazed sliding doors that open onto a covered balcony overlooking the gardens below. A slight elevation at the front accommodates a bedroom and guest WC.

There are three further bedrooms on the upper levels. The largest of these has built-in wardrobes and an en suite bathroom. A shower room on the second floor serves the other two bedrooms. Also on the third floor is a large, south-west facing roof terrace of almost 250 sq ft with excellent views of the Heath and the surrounding area.

On the lower ground level is an additional bedroom with independent access from the front lightwell. This has original wood-block flooring, a shower room and kitchenette, and a substantial storage room at the rear.

Outside Space

As well as the roof terrace and balcony, the house has a private south-west facing patio which leads down to the communal garden. At its centre is a lawn surrounded by beautifully planted and lovingly maintained borders. Benches are dotted around, providing secluded spots from which to enjoy the tranquillity of the space. The garden unites the private terraces and provides a secure environment for children or pets to play in.

The Area

Gayton Road is brilliantly positioned for all the delights that make Hampstead one of the most sought-after locations in London. At the end of the road is Hampstead High Street with its plethora of boutiques, cafes and eateries, including Oddono’s gelateria, Ginger & White, Gail’s and the famous Hampstead Crêperie. There are several charming pubs nearby including The Horseshoe, The Flask and The Hollybush, and the open expanse of Hampstead Heath is just minutes away. Some of London’s best independent schools can be reached on foot.

Hampstead station (Northern Line) is a three-minute walk from the house, while Hampstead Heath and Finchley Road & Frognal Overground stations are a slightly further walk away.

detailedDescription:
This beautiful lateral apartment occupies the first floor of a handsome Grade II listed Georgian building in
buzzing Seven Dials, on one of the West End's most recognisable and desirable streets. Boasting a beautifully proportioned main living space with three windows across, a separate dining area and kitchen, two double bedrooms, two bathrooms, superb ceiling heights throughout as well as a private terrace to the rear*, this gem is a rare find in London's West End and ideal for those seeking an urban village lifestyle in the heart of the capital.

Seven Dials has an interesting history, originally developed by Thomas Neale in the early 1690's with a view to attracting affluent residents, however for much of its early history it was full of gin shops and ne'er-do-wells, with a pub on every corner (only The Crown remains today) and a series of interconnecting tunnels between each, perfect for a quick escape. The area became regarded as somewhat of a slum, even referenced by the great Charles Dickens himself.

Nowadays, Seven Dials has more of a village feel much closer to Neale's original vision. The eclectic mix of cobbled streets, historic architecture, independent boutiques, theatres, restaurants, coffee shops and of course the iconic sundial give the area a unique atmosphere within London's buzzing West End.

Home to many of our favourite boutique retailers and independent eateries as well as the fantastic Seven Dials Market, Seven Dials is a true village within a city, with easy access to the cultural delights of nearby Covent Garden, the eternal buzz of neighbouring Soho, as well as Fitzrovia to the North and, Midtown & The City a short stroll East.

*the private terrace is currently available for exclusive use by the lessee under licence from the Freeholder, however under the terms of the newly negotiated lease, this will become part of the property's demise and formal consent for use as a terrace is being applied for with the local authority.

**the vendor has negotiated/agreed a premium for a lease extension with the Freeholder. The apartment will be sold with the benefit of the extended lease and the figure referred to above reflects the extended term.

Freehold bloomsbury mews house

A superb freehold Mews house quietly located on The Colonnades, tucked behind Russell Square.

address: Chris Pullen Way, Islington, London N7
detailedDescription:
Situated on a quiet residential turning adjacent to Caledonian Park and within walking distance to the Piccadilly Line at Caledonian Road Underground Station, is this modern two-double bedroom, two-bathroom apartment with private balcony.

Located on the second of this secure well maintained purpose built block, this naturally bright and spacious apartment offering approximately 836 SqFt has been designed for space and functionality. The property comprises of fitted semi-open plan kitchen complete with some integrated appliances, large reception room and dining area with access to a private balcony, two double bedrooms with the main room benefitting from an en-suite bathroom, built in storage cupboard off the hall and tiled family bathroom.

Chris Pullen Way links directly onto the open gardens of Caledonian Park whilst the Clock Tower is a dominant landmark for the area. The apartment is perfectly positioned for easy access to a range of amenities and leisure facilities including Islington Tennis Centre on the far side of the park which has a gym, tennis courts, sauna and steam rooms. Further amenities within walking distance include supermarkets, eateries, fresh food markets and independent coffee shops.

Granary Square at Kings Cross is also accessible from this desirable location and offers a further range of well-supported restaurants, boutiques and entertainment facilities.

Caledonian Road Underground Station is just 10 minutes’ walk (Google) and provides access onto the Piccadilly Line with Caledonian & Barnsbury Overground Station also within walking distance.<br /><br />

The charm of Novel House starts with its superlative location in the heart of Hampstead. It has the nature of a quintessential English Village with the cultured style and social scene of the city. address: Goldhurst Terrace, South Hampstead, London NW6
detailedDescription:
An exceptional two double bedroom, two bathroom lower ground floor apartment with two private patios forming part of a sensational collection of eleven elegant and contemporary 1,2 and 3 bedroom apartments, located in the heart of sought-after South Hampstead. Drawing inspiration from the timeless elegance and style of the Victorian-era, this collection of new apartments exists in perfect harmony with the period buildings and leafy tree-lined surrounds of this quintessential North-London street.

The breath-taking interiors have been expertly designed with modern life in mind, complete with lift access, spacious open-plan living areas, luxurious finishes and large glass French doors leading to the private patios. Each property is finished with carefully selected materials, matched for their calm and luxurious appeal. Specially stained oak parquet flooring and natural timber veneer doors, instantly draw you in, soft neutral materials continue throughout, all enhanced with the warmth of brass and bronze ironmongery and fittings. All bathrooms and kitchens are finished with elegant contemporary styling, using materials selected for their visual and tactile appeal. The overall effect is of balance, warmth and refined comfort - a timeless and inviting combination. For peace of mind, these newly constructed apartments all come with a 10-year build/structural warranty.

Some of London's best-loved green spaces, including Primrose Hill, Hampstead Heath and Regent's Park are close by, whilst Goldhurst Terrace is perfectly placed to enjoy the boutiques, cafés, bakeries, bars and restaurants of St. John's Wood, Hampstead Village and West Hampstead.

South Hampstead may feel like a world away from the frenetic pace of Central London, but heading into Zone 1, whether it's for a spot of shopping, dinner, or to the office, is fast and convenient. Direct tube services from Finchley Road (Jubilee & Metropolitan Lines), the closest tube station and just five minutes' walk from the development (0.3m away), provides expeditious journey times to Bond Street (8 minutes), King's Cross St. Pancras (12 minutes), Liverpool Street (21 minutes) and Canary Wharf (23 minutes). Further local transport links include the Thameslink Line and the Overground Line, found nearby at West Hampstead and South Hampstead.

** practical completion scheduled for June 2021 **

3D Virtual Viewing Available | 1 Double Bedroom | Ensuite | Separate Bathroom | Historical Location | 999 Year Lease | 682 Sq Ft | Highly Secure Block | Newly Refurbished | Chain Free | Balcony | Fifth Floor

This highly secure and well maintained 682 sq ft fifth floor apartment in the heart of the famous Hatton Garden, comprises of a quality 1 double bedroom with ensuite, a separate bathroom and open plan living and kitchen space.

Having recently been refurbished, the flat is fitted with luxury, modern appliances and decor throughout. Owners also have access to a generously sized, private balcony.

Hatton Garden is a historical and significant London location. The street is famous as London's jewellery quarter and the centre of the Diamond trade in the UK. This specialisation began in the early 19th Century and is now officially the largest cluster of jewellery retailers in the UK. Here is your chance to live within a piece of history.

The property is available chain free and is ready to view now. Residents can enjoy extensive transport links with both Farringdon and Chancery Lane stations being less than 350m away, thus providing easy access to The City and the premium shopping that Oxford Street has to offer.

Local amenities include numerous coffee hotspots, bars and restaurants along with St Bartholomew's Hospital being situated 700m from the apartment.

Tenure: Leasehold 977 years remaining
Service Charge: £2,187 pa
Ground Rent: £200 pa

For further information, or to book a viewing, please call Mark Race on <br /><br />

address: Novel House, 29 New End, Hampstead, London NW3
detailedDescription:
On a quiet, elevated street, this boutique development will be the first of its kind in this prime central London location. Set in the heart of Hampstead village, these generous apartments enjoy an enviable proximity to the heath and the charm of the village.

The charm of Novel House starts with its superlative location in the heart of Hampstead. It has the nature of a quintessential English Village with the cultured style and social scene of the city. It is so close to the centre of London yet worlds away from its inimitable rhythm. Hampstead's greenery and scenery have inspired the architecture, materiality, landscaping and layouts. What follows is space and light.

The apartments incorporate high ceilings, picture windows with panoramic views and large lateral configurations as well as beautifully designed duplex apartments. Each shares the highest level of internal private specification, private landscaped gardens and luxurious gym, secure underground parking and concierge services.

Estimated completion Q1 2019

CGIs are for indicative purposes only

Less than 20 minutes from Oxford Street, Hampstead Village has formed in the way that the best neighbourhoods do - with care, creativity and style. Hampstead Village is a magical microcosm; a small locale with a big heart.

address: Primrose Gardens, Belsize Park, London NW3
detailedDescription:
A beautifully refurbished 5 bedroom 4 bathroom 3,041 sq ft family house located in the heart of Belsize Park.

Location

Primrose Gardens is a charming turning off Belsize Grove and England's Lane with access to a communal green. It is ideally located for easy access to the local shopping and transport amenities of both Haverstock Hill and England's Lane (both circa 300 metres). The green space of Primrose Hill is c.800 metres whilst Belsize Park Underground Station (Northern line) is c.400 metres.

Description

A rare opportunity to acquire this remarkable residence set over five floors and refurbished to the highest specification throughout. The house has been the subject of a total internal rebuild and external refurbishment and now offers an exceptional living space whilst retaining the original facade of the building. Offering in excess of 3,000 sq ft, this generous and beautifully structured accommodation provides wonderful and elegant entertaining spaces with exceptional ceiling heights and volumes.

The property also provides an excellent range of five immaculate and spacious double bedrooms, a cinema room, a utility room, a large eat-in German kitchen which is fully equipped and boasts black granite worktops, centre island with riser mains sockets, Mint glass splashbacks, stainless steel and lighting fixtures. The hardwood concertina doors can be fully opened to make the dining area seamlessly integrate with a stylish, lit rear garden with an intriguing suspended globe and water feature. Other outside spaces are provided over three floors including two rear terraces, one off the main reception room and the other off the top floor. There is an abundance of specialised lighting installed creating unlimited choice of ambience at night all fully intergraded with automation.

Ideally located between Belsize Park and Primrose Hill, this exceptional home is lavished with walnut, glass and steel throughout. It benefits from larger than average hallways and generous living spaces which combine the elegance of the original house alongside subtle, state of the art fixtures and fittings including knx and Control Four home automation, specialist lighting and integrated music and home entertainment. External doors and windows are hardwood, double-glazed and toughened for security and plantation shutters are fitted to all sash windows.

Other impressive features include kal® fire gas fireplaces with black polished granite surround; remote ignition; cool-down delay on drop of projector screen designed for safety reasons; AV Rack. Pioneer subwoofer for superior bass reproduction, bose® surround sound speakers, PureTheater® automated projection screen, PureTheatre® automated projector lift, Infocus HD projector which can connected to all sources; galaxy ceiling ®' stunning lighting effect designed to replicate solar system concealed in Master Bedroom.

Homes of this quality are seldom seen in this highly sought after location.

Square Footage: 3015 sq ft

detailedDescription:
Summary
A beautifully presented one bedroom apartment set within a well-appointed residential building in the heart of Covent Garden. The property benefits from plenty of natural light, solid maple floors throughout and a private basement storage room. This apartment would make an excellent Pied-à-terre

description
Covent Garden in the heart of London's West End is a world renowned and unique destination for visitors and Londoners who enjoy shopping, theatre, restaurants, bars, history and culture as well as a broad range of businesses.

Covent Garden is located in Central London, bordered by the City of London and Leicester Square. The property is within walking distance of Soho, Trafalgar Square and a wide range of attractive garden squares. The traffic-free Covent Garden piazza, the Opera Quarter, St Martin's Courtyard, Fleet Street, Seven Dials, Neal's Yard and Floral Street are all within approximately a 10 minute walk.

It is about a 15 minute walk to the River Thames which offers iconic London views, restaurants, and galleries.

Behind the wonderfully vibrant streets, Covent Garden is a unique residential area with an array of property styles from historic period buildings to state-of-the-art modern luxury apartment blocks.

Transport links are exceptional being served by Central, Piccadilly and Northern Underground Lines at Covent Garden, Leicester Square, Tottenham Court Road and Holborn Underground Stations as well as a tremendous range of buses, whilst the new Elizabeth Line, will give fast access out to Reading, Heathrow, Docklands and Essex.

detailedDescription:
A fully-let income generating freehold townhouse with three luxurious flats situated on the upper three floors of this Grade II Listed building in the heart of Bloomsbury. The property is held in an spv (no stamp duty). Rental yield is circa 5%.

Refurbished to high standards, the property features stylish interiors including modern fitted kitchens, spacious bedrooms and contemporary bathrooms. Arranged as three separate units the property offers flexibility for an owner occupier or investor to purchase a turnkey development in the heart of Bloomsbury.

The Basement Flat has been sold off as a long leasehold generating an annual ground rent income of £350. Commercial on the ground floor has got a head lease with 999 yrs with peppercorn rent.

Marchmont Street lies within the distinctly affluent and historical area of Bloomsbury. The property offers tranquillity in an exquisite central London location amidst the local shopping facilities and with easy access to the areas' extensive range of academic and medical institutions. The most prestigious shopping streets, world renowned restaurants, hotels and cultural landmarks are within a short stroll. There is easy access to the amenities of the Brunswick Centre (including a large Waitrose), ucl and to many other universities. The property is very well connected in terms of buses and tubes. The nearest Underground stations is Russell Square station (Piccadilly Line) 0.2 miles. London's International Airports are easily accessible through the Underground and Mainline Station network at King's Cross and the Eurostar link at St Pancras further enhances the area's connectivity, reinforcing its stature as a vibrant and bustling slice of London life.

address: Gloucester Crescent, Primrose Hill, London NW1
detailedDescription:
An exceptional Grade II listed family home with a stunning landscaped westerly facing garden located on one of the area’s most desirable positions, within the Primrose Hill Conservation area. This elegant period house offers flexible accommodation which is currently arranged to provide five bedrooms, dual aspect double reception rooms and a sensational open plan kitchen / family room with a stunning glass extension designed by award winning architect Barnaby Gunning. Arranged over five floors, this special property offers approximately 2740sqft of fabulous internal accommodation that provides a seamless blend of period and contemporary design. Boasting a selection of large rooms with enchanting views from both sides of the house and a stunning landscaped tiered garden which is the work of the highly regarded Rosemary Coldstream, this truly is a fantastic property that is rarely available.
Both Regent's Canal and Regent's Park are walking distance from the Crescent as are two popular preparatory schools, the energy of Camden Town and the village atmosphere and pretty terraced streets of Primrose Hill. There are several transport links to choose from including Camden Town Station (Northern Line) 0.2 miles and Chalk Farm Station (Northern Line) 0.5miles with the Eurostar, The West End and the City all accessible in under 20 minutes. There is also a nearby canal towpath that provides a beautiful cycle route west to Little Venice and east to Hoxton.

detailedDescription:
Summary
A rare opportunity to acquire a well-appointed 6th floor apartment (with lift) and benefits from private spacious terrace as well as a beautiful communal terrace with roof top views. The property is light and spacious and is a short walk to central Covent Garden.

Description
Covent Garden in the heart of London's West End is a world renowned and unique destination for visitors and Londoners who enjoy shopping, theatre, restaurants, bars, history and culture as well as a broad range of businesses.

Geographically, Covent Garden is located in Central London, bordered by the City of London and Leicester Square. It is within walking distance of Soho, the river Thames, a wide range of parks and garden squares and Trafalgar Square. There are several smaller areas within Covent Garden that are worth exploring such as the traffic-free Covent Garden market piazza, The Opera Quarter, St Martin's Courtyard, Seven Dials, Neal's Yard, and Floral Street.

Behind the wonderfully vibrant streets, Covent Garden is a unique residential area with a huge array of property styles from character and historic period buildings, through a wide variety of affordable, ex-local authority home, to top of the market, state-of-the-art modern luxury apartment blocks.

Transport links are exceptional being served by Piccadilly and Northern Underground Lines at Covent Garden, Leicester Square and Tottenham Court Road Underground Stations as well as a tremendous range of buses, whilst the new Elizabeth Line, due to open in 2019, will give fast access out to Reading, Heathrow, Docklands and Essex.

address: Cambridge Terrace Mews, Regents Park, London NW1
detailedDescription: A rare to the market five bedroom house situated in a quiet cobbled mews just off the outer circle of Regents Park and only a few moments from Chester Gate. This impressive house benefits from circa 1907 sqft of living space and has the benefit of a private garage. The ground floor comprises a 22ft modern kitchen that leads into large reception room with glass atrium. To the rear is a spacious patio garden that has direct access to communal gardens. This floor also benefits from a guest cloakroom. The first floor consists of three bedrooms, a family bathroom and a generous utility room. The top floor hosts a generous principal bedroom suite with vaulted ceilings and a fifth bedroom. Cambridge Terrace Mews is located on the east side of Regent's Park and offers a tranquil setting allowing convenient access to Marylebone & Fitzrovia (0.5miles), with London’s West End a short stroll away (less than one mile). Alternatively Primrose Hill is close by (less than one mile) where one can enjoy the breath-taking views of the city from Primrose Hill Park and experience the villages quirky boutiques and idyllic restaurants & bars. The ever evolving Kings Cross (less than one mile away) where one can soak in the delights of Granary Square which hosts a wide selection of stylish eateries, sleek bars and popular recreational squares & arts centres. Kings Cross & St. Pancras Stations are served by six underground lines, connecting you to other popular central London destinations within minutes, with the Eurostar from St. Pancras Station trips to Europe are easier than ever before. There are several other transport links to choose from Great Portland Street & Warren Street Stations (less than 500 meters) both these stations are served by a combination of five underground lines and Euston Station (National Rail) 0.4 miles.

Chic eateries, sophisticated boutiques, clusters of gastropubs and tea rooms can be explored in the surrounding area. Regent’s Canal towpath leads to nearby Camden Town and its market which boasts tasty street food, nightlife and indie shopping.

The area is widely popular amongst both professionals and families, with easy access into Central London. Swiss Cottage Underground Station and St. John’s Wood Underground Station (both Jubilee Line) are an approximate 10-15-minute walk from Elsworthy Rise.

Primrose Hill is famous for its high quality and well-established schools including the Trevor-Roberts School and Sarum Hall School.

title: 17 bed property for sale

detailedDescription:
Cannon Lane, in a quiet conservation area in the heart of Hampstead Village, London NW3, is a contemporary minimalist home designed by world-famous architect Claudio Silvestrin. Extending to approximately 7,940 sq ft (737 sq m), this 21st century house fuses stunning interior design with sustainable materials. The project is conscious of its impact on the environment. The inclined site on which it stands maximises privacy from the street while allowing for and abundance of natural light to pass through the rear elevation to illuminate the sublime interior.

The mature gardens at ground floor level were designed by rhs Chelsea Flower Show gold prize winning garden designer, Chris Beardshaw. The terrace at lower ground floor level is a cultured space for entertaining in privacy.

Each principal room has a glass balustrade balcony, and the property comprises of a hallway, a formal reception room, an informal reception room with a dining area, a kitchen/breakfast room, a cinema room, a master bedroom with an ensuite bathroom and dressing room, four further bedrooms, three further bathrooms (two ensuite), a staff bedroom with self contained access, leisure facilities including a swimming pool, a sauna, a steam room, changing rooms, a gymnasium and a treatment area. There are also three plant rooms and a sub-basement storeroom, and a two car garage with a car-lift.

The garden accommodates four levels, including the roof garden, which is accessed from the second floor. Additionally, it provides a feature to lookout upon and a number of outdoor spaces for relaxation and entertaining.

Cannon Lane is a picturesque and exceptionally private road, just minutes from Hampstead Village and Hampstead Heath. The charm of the ‘village in the city’ has made this enclave of London a highly desirable location that attracts many high profile and discerning individuals.

Nearby independent schools include Heathside Preparatory School, The Academy School, Northbridge House Senior School and Hampstead High School.
Key features

Central Spiral Staircase
Home Cinema
Indoor Pool, Sauna & Steam Room, Treatment Area
Gym
Multiple Terraces, including a Roof Terrace
Multi-level, Landscaped Garden
2 Car Garage with Car Lift
Lift Access to all Floors

address: Villas On The Heath, Vale Of Health, London NW3
detailedDescription:
Located in a secluded and quiet enclave totally surrounded by Hampstead Heath is this beautiful Grade II listed Victorian Villa with blue plaque citing the residence of Rabindranath Tagore, a famouse Poet and Writer, who lived here in 1912 and was one of the most influential figures in Indian literature and culture.

Offering a rare triple aspect, this beautifully refurbished home comprises of stunning interiors.

The ground floor consists of a bespoke designed kitchen with marble counter tops, island and Aga that opens onto the dining room with wooden flooring throughout. There is a separate study which leads on to the private rear patio garden.

There is a half landing which leads to the family bathroom that has both free standing bath and separate shower along with a large utility cupboard which houses the washing machine and dryer.

Located on the first floor is the charming double reception room which is filled with natural light, with wooden flooring, two fire places and views of the Vale of Health

A further half landing leads to the second bedroom and on the second floor there is a dual aspect principle bedroom and en suite shower room. The third bedroom has a stair case leading up to a spacious roof terrace which has views of the Heath.

In addition there is a roof space which is currently accessed from the terrace which has two windows and far reaching views.

Pre-application advice has been sought to create internal access to the attic alongside extending into the back patio to create a dining room/conservatory. Further information can be provided upon request.

The Vale of Health was originally a hamlet popularised in the 18th century as a tranquil refuge from the heart of London. The Vale of Health is set in Hampstead Heath adjacent to Hampstead Village and within half a mile of Hampstead Underground station (Northern Line) and the array of fantastic amenities Hampstead has to offer.

detailedDescription:
A truly stunning three bedroom, two bathroom apartment in this incredibly well sought after Grade II Listed purpose built residential block. On the fringes of Bloomsbury and Clerkenwell this spacious flat has recently been refurbished to exacting standards throughout.

The property provides a generous living area with plenty of natural light from two attractive sash windows. There is a separate fully fitted modern kitchen with dark granite work surfaces. The master bedroom is a generous size with custom built shelving and wraps around to an impressive large family size en-suite bathroom. There are two further double bedrooms with built in storage that shares a very tastefully finished tiled shower-room/WC.

The Bourne Estate is perfectly located to access the theatres of the West End, the vibrant food market on Leather Lane and the internationally renowned restaurants of Exmouth Market. Once an area nicknamed 'little Italy' there is an abundance of fine cafes and boutique delicatessens on its doorstep.

The closest stations are Chancery Lane and Farringdon Stations. Farringdon station and the surrounding area will undoubtedly benefit from the forthcoming Crossrail and retail development. With already existing fantastic transport links, Farringdon station will be the only station in London with direct lines to all London based airports making it arguably London's most sought-after transport hub.

Service Charge - £1200 per annum

detailedDescription: Located in the quiet enclave, surrounded by Hampstead Heath this stylish Grade II listed Victorian Villa built circa 1863 with blue plaque recording the residence of Rabindranath Tagore in 1912 one of the most influential figures in Indian literature and culture. A poet, essayist and campaigner and Nobel Prize winner for Literature. The house has been beautifully refurbished with stunning interiors and offering a wonderful rare triple aspect. On the ground floor there is a bespoke designed kitchen with Aga opening onto a charming dining room with feature fireplace and wood flooring throughout. In addition there is an study /family room with access to a patio garden. The half landing leads to the family bathroom with roll top bath, WC and large walk-in shower and a utility cupboard housing the washing machine and dryer. On the first floor is a triple aspect drawing room with two fire places, wood flooring and wonderful views of the Vale of Health. Another half landing leads to bedroom three and the top second floor has the double aspect principal suite with en-suite shower room and a second bedroom with valued ceilings and shutters. A staircase leads to a wonderful roof terrace with Heath and roof top views. A large roof space with two windows and exceptional views is currently accessed from the terrace. Pre app advice has been sought to extend into the back patio to create a conservatory/dining room, along with the creation of internal access to the attic .Plans and further information are available on request. The centre of Hampstead Village with an array of shops, cafes, restaurants and underground station (Northern Line) is approximately a half a mile walk from The Vale of Health and Hampstead Heath Overground station is 0.9 miles away. Past residents in the Vale include dh Lawrence, Stella Gibbons, Compton Mackenzie and Edgar Wallace.

address: Prince Of Wales Road, London NW5
detailedDescription:
Description

This is a delightful duplex apartment in a former Victorian bath house in the heart of Kentish Town.

As most working-class Victorians didn't have indoor plumbing at home, this would have been an important local building, as it offered both bathing and laundry facilities.

Once though your own private entrance, you're in a hallway with plenty of space for coats and shoes.

Going straight into the reception room, you encounter a large, open space with high ceilings, gloriously large windows and lots of natural light.

The size of the room is the key to its versatility. Want to have separate lounge and dining areas? Easily done.

The fully fitted kitchen is neatly tucked away and provides ample storage space with a larder hidden away at the far end.

Downstairs, immediately to your left is the second bedroom with a perfect spot for a walk-in wardrobe.

Further down the hall, the huge family bathroom - with a deep tub & overhead shower - is next to the principal bedroom; a sweeping space with plenty of room for a work area, built-in wardrobes and a super-king bed, with its own en-suite with a luxurious walk-in shower.

Situated in the heart of Kentish Town, Prince of Wales Road is a direct route to Camden Town. An bustling thoroughfare, it boasts a string of excellent pubs.

Directly next door is Kentish Town Baths, the local leisure centre recently renovated with gym, classes and pool.

Kentish Town Road, the local high street, is less than five minutes walk away and has supermarkets, pubs, restaurants and essential local services.

The Grafton is your local fun boozer, known for its barbecue food and roof terrace. Just up the road, The Abbey Tavern is perfect for live football and good ale.

The Phoenicia Mediterranean Food Hall is a local favourite; they do fantastic lunchtime wraps, as well as superb breads and sweets.

As to transport links, Kentish Town Underground and Mainline Rail station is only a seven minute walk and connects with the Northern Line. Mainline rail services link to Kings Cross, Farringdon and wider South East London and up as far as Bedford.

detailedDescription:
A delightful Georgian townhouse

Location

Wharton Street is ideally located for all the amenities of Upper Street and Clerkenwell whilst also in close proximity are the trendy restaurants and bars in Exmouth Market. Sadlers Wells theatre is also close by.

The City is within walking distance and there is a wealth of transport links to choose from including King's Cross (Eurostar), Farringdon (impending Crossrail) and Angel (Northern Line) stations as well as many bus routes leading to many notable central London destinations including the West End.

Description

A delightful Grade II Listed Georgian townhouse situated on one of Finsbury's most sought after streets. This family home has been refurbished to exacting standards and to a sophisticated style that is reflective of the buildings period.

Set over four floors and totaling approximately 1,810 sqft the accommodation includes a spacious open plan kitchen and dining room leading onto an extended family reception room on the lower ground floor. The reception room opens directly out onto a well maintained and secluded South facing garden. There is also the added benefit of separate utility room and WC on this floor.

The raised ground floor comprises of two versatile rooms that are currently used as a large study at the front, and guest bedroom at the rear. The master bedroom suite occupies the whole of the first floor and is made up of a rear facing bedroom, walk in wardrobe/dressing area at the front that leads onto a glorious marble finished en-suite bathroom. The upper floor comprises of a large bedroom and a separate family bathroom.

Square Footage: 1810 sq ft

detailedDescription:
This luxurious three double bedroom apartment is located on the sixth floor of this converted period building. There is an abundance of natural light with south facing views from the reception room over covent garden.

Princes House exquisitely blends a perfect balance of old and new, with some of the most modern, state of the art apartments the city has to offer hidden behind its timeless, period façade.

The apartment is situated within an original constructed 1920s building; it features an impressive Neo-classical stone façade with large, generous paned windows with elegant, sleek modern interior featuring engineered timber flooring, carpeted bedrooms, fully-fitted bathrooms and kitchens equipped with the latest appliances.

This apartment also benefits from lift access, concierge service and electronic coded entrances, meaning your apartment is constantly secure.

Princes House is located a short walk from the energetic heart of Covent Garden. The iconic Royal Opera House, countless theatres, exciting restaurants and lively shopping hubs are located only moments away. However, if you wish to entertain your guests in the comfort of your own home, then each apartment provides ample space for you and your company to enjoy.

Covent Garden (Piccadilly line - 6 minutes), Holborn (Central and Piccadilly line - 5 minutes), Leicester Square (Piccadilly and Northern lines - 7 minutes) and Tottenham Court Road (Central and Northern - 8 minutes) Underground stations are all within close proximity to Princes House which means you have the freedom to quickly travel to anywhere in the city within minutes and discovery all of what it has to offer

detailedDescription:
Property Description

Boasting a large South West facing private terrace, this three bedroom flat is set over three floors and is located in a prime road in West Hampstead.

Property Details

Located in a sought after position of West Hampstead, this 1,265 sq ft three double bedroom, two bathroom triplex flat has the added benefit of a 35ft private roof garden and a secure private entrance. The flat has been well presented by the current vendors and offers plenty of open plan entertaining space in the 25ft kitchen/reception areas, a principal bedroom with ensuite, two further double bedrooms, a family bathroom and contemporary fixtures and fittings throughout.

Sumatra Road is well situated for the shopping and transport facilities of West Hampstead, West End Lane and Mill Lane. Located close to excellent transport links including the West Hampstead Thameslink, Overground and Jubilee Line, as well as bus routes into central London.

address: West Central One, The Postmark, Mount Pleasant, Clerkenwell WC1X
detailedDescription:
Well positioned 6th floor apartment boasting (604 Sq.Ft) and Westerly skyline views through the courtyard. Offered with a secure storage unit located in the lower ground level.

Postmark will create a bustling new neighbourhood in the heart of Central London, offering an exciting mix of stylish designed apartments. Leading the last major regeneration project.

Sitting across two postcodes, WC1 and EC1, and surrounded by Farringdon, Clerkenwell, King's Cross and Chancery Lane, Postmark is at the epicentre of the leading creative, technology and knowledge industries and will be a symbol of connectivity.

In honour of Postmark’s double postcode heritage, the collection of apartments at West Central 1 offer the opportunity to embrace either the west or east characteristics of this unique location. Conran and Partners has created two distinctive choices of interior palette, drawing on the celebrated features of each area.

Only Postmark residents can honestly say they live in the true centre of London. In all directions, the best of this great city waits to delight you on your doorstep.

Residents of the development benefit from a host of exceptional amenities at Postmark London including:

Residents' gym. Wellness centre and spa. Cinema. Lounge. Courtyard. 24-hour concierge.

detailedDescription:
An exceptional and substantial six-bedroom semi-detached family residence, offering 5,669 sq ft (527 Sq m) within this attractive red brick Victorian property.

This desirable home offers a wealth of Period features to include high ceilings, cornicing and fireplaces to name a few. The well-balanced accommodation is arranged over four floors with emphasis on natural light and well-proportioned rooms which comprise a 38' kitchen/breakfast/family room, an elegant 24'5 formal reception room, 21' dining room, plus a 44' media/family room and 25' playroom.

The house boasts six bedroom suites with the master bedroom extending to approximately 800 sq ft including a well-appointed dressing room & comfortable en-suite bathroom.

Additional benefits include an integral garage, driveway for two further cars, a custom-built wine cellar and a delightful 95' south-east facing rear garden.

The extensive facilities of both Hampstead Village (Northern Line) and Finchley Road (Jubilee & Metropolitan Lines) are within close proximity.

detailedDescription:
This ground and first floor flat in the heart of Camden Town is currently let as a 3 bed HMO with an additional HMO licence for 4 persons. You can continue to use as an HMO or it will make a great buy to let investment or a family home.
Three double bedrooms including the lounge that is used as a bedroom with one shared bathroom and one kitchen. Licence issued 22/06/2016 expiring 21/06/2021. Chain Free.
HMO tenant income;
Room rents £850, £800, £750 per month. Currently, there is one tenant as the vendor didn't want to restrict to HMO buyers.

Freehold included.

Parking - Resident permits are Camden council, and you'll need to supply model, make, engine, year and emissions etc
And permit prices are decided on the size of the engine, emissions.
Once all are filled in, the council will send you a credit card size to put in the windscreen. We believe you can have more than 1 car per space subject to fees.

All furniture is included.

New Velux window 15/01/2021

The flat is in good condition throughout with plenty of character.

You can convert the ground floor storage room to a bathroom for the ground floor bedroom and increase the rent accordingly.

detailedDescription:
We are delighted to offer one of the finest one bedroom apartments in Bloomsbury. Set on the third floor (top floor) of an imposing Georgian house this beautiful, bright residence is set on the very sought-after Burton Street.

This superb apartment features gorgeous wooden flooring throughout and large sash-windows which bathe the entire apartment in natural light. There is a well-proportioned reception room with contemporary open-plan kitchen with a washing machine, a fridge and fitted wall units. The very quiet bedroom is located to the rear of the property and is East--facing. This lovely home further benefits from a contemporary shower room and an abundance of cupboard space and attic storage.

Burton Street lies within the distinctly affluent and historical area of Bloomsbury. The most prestigious shopping streets, world renowned restaurants, hotels and cultural landmarks are within a short stroll. There is easy access to the amenities of the Brunswick Centre (including a large Waitrose), ucl and to many other universities. London's International Airports are easily accessible through the Underground and Mainline Station network and the Eurostar link at St Pancras further enhances the area's connectivity, reinforcing its stature as a vibrant and bustling slice of London life. This fantastic apartment will appeal to owner occupiers and investors alike.

Call today to arrange a viewing!

Notice
Please note we have not tested any apparatus, fixtures, fittings, or services. Interested parties must undertake their own investigation into the working order of these items. All measurements are approximate and photographs provided for guidance only.

detailedDescription:
A beautifully renovated four bedroom apartment flooded with natural light and with access to a large communal garden.

Location

Located in one of the premier roads in West Hampstead, the apartment is ideally located for the amenities and shops of Hampstead, Finchley Road and West End Lane. Its location also benefits close proximity from many local schools, the O2 Center, and the green spaces of Primrose Hill and Hampstead Heath. The property is located approximately 0.1 miles from Finchley Road Station, 0.4 miles from South Hampstead Overground Station, 0.8 miles from West Hampstead and Overground Station, and 1.1 miles from Belsize Park Station.

Description

A beautiful and bright 3 (or 4) bedrooms apartment set on the second floor of a mansion block offering in excess of 1,900 sq ft of living space. The architect designed renovation include Dinesen wood floor, Dornbracht faucets, built in sound and image wiring, fitted wardrobes, and restoration of original period features. The accommodation further benefits from a large eat-in kitchen and utility room, sun room and direct access to the immaculate Greencroft communal gardens.

detailedDescription:
Features:

• Fantastic one-bedroom apartment

• Private south-facing rear garden

• Bright open plan living room

• Own front door on Pratt Street

• Prime location in the heart of Camden Town

• 111 Year lease

A quiet and attractive garden flat, ideally located in sought-after Camden Town, with excellent transport connections and amenities.

The well-presented property has its own front door and a private rear garden. A bright living room with large, full-height glazing overlooks the beautiful green south-facing garden.

The property has a modern open plan kitchen with integrated appliances, a storage room and light wooden flooring throughout. The neutral bathroom has a full-sized bath and shower.

The well-proportioned double bedroom has a built-in wardrobe and additional shelving. The accommodation benefits from communal heating, double glazing and superfast broadband. A forest feature wall completes the natural and homely atmosphere of this central oasis.

Location, location, location:

• Located on the pleasant, leafy and relatively quiet Pratt Street, opposite various listed buildings and local park St. Martin’s Gardens.

• A prime location, moments from all amenities of vibrant Camden Town, including a full range of supermarkets, restaurants, cafes, pubs and leisure shopping.

• Minutes from both Northern Lines and the Overground and a wide range of bus routes.

• Just a short walk to the fabulous Regents Park, Regents Canal and King’s Cross.

detailedDescription:
Located in Zone 1 Central London this is an off-plan 2 bedrooms 2 bathrooms new built apartment with modern finishes. In the heart of Clerkenwell surrounded by world renowned universities and financial head quarters. Ready to move in Summer 2021

Across the road from Royal Mail central London sorting hub and delivery office. The immediate area is very peaceful despite being in such a central location.

0.8 miles North of the apartment is Kings Cross St Pancras which is one of four major connecting train stations in London. From here you can connect onto 6 x London Underground lines as well as the Euro Star, to Paris direct is only 2 hours and 28 minutes. It is also home to European head quarters such as; Google, Youtube and lvmh.

0.8 miles North West from the apartment is Angel, an eclectic cultural hub along Upper street offers an abundance of boutique style shops, coffee shops, pubs and restaurants. You also have Saddlers Wells the famous performing arts theatre, only 11 minutes walk from the apartment.

Farringdon is the closest tube station 0.5 miles South East and is home to Amazon London, Goldman Sachs and Smithfield Market which is Londons' largest meat and poultry market.

0.5 - 1.2 miles South West is Chancery Lane, Holborn and Euston all of which has an exceptionally high concentration of world renowned universities such as; University of London, ucl, lse, and Kings College as well as famous Culinary and Arts School Le Cordon Bleu London.

Tottenham Court Road is only 1.2 miles West of the development, a short walk from there will take you to China Town, Soho, Covent Garden as well as Oxford Street.

Building facilities include;
- Wellness centre with gym
- Cinema for residents private use
- 2 x Residents lounges with kitchenette facilities
- Internal courtyard with maintained green spaces and seating areas
- Roof terrace overlooking the city with out door lounge style seating for residents only
- 24 Hours concierge
Future phase will have;
-Spa and swimming pool
- State-of-the-art wellness centre and spa
- Commercial units within the development

The apartment is off plan finished specifications will include;
- Wooden floor throughout
- Brand new kitchen appliances including washing machine
- Underfloor heating and air conditioning
- Open network internet hub pre installed
- Modern bathroom with 1 bath tub, ensuite shower room

Other property information;
- Leasehold of 999 years
- Estimated service charge £5.50 - £6.50 per sqft *
- Ground rent £750 per annum **

* Estimates based on all units completing within the master plan** And increasing every ten years throughout the term in line with rpi or equivalent index

Please note:
The photos are not the actual apartment, as the apartment is yet to complete at the end of June. Photos are from an already completed 2 bedrooms in the development with a different kitchen finish (The actual kitchen will have a blue finish) and layout, some photos of the existing concierge and residents lounge has been uploaded.
Furniture are not included

address: 101 On Cleveland, Cleveland Street, Fitzrovia W1T
detailedDescription:
Located on the second floor, this 1103 sqft south west facing apartment comprises open plan kitchen/living/dining room, main bedroom with dressing area and ensuite bathroom, second double bedroom with built in wardrobes, third bedroom/study, utility room, contemporary bathroom and a private south facing balcony.

The luxury apartments at 101 on Cleveland include fully fitted B&B Italia kitchens with Miele appliances, oak engineer timber chevron flooring throughout, underfloor heating and comfort cooling. Residents will benefit from an array of amenities including 24 hour concierge, beautiful landscaped gardens on podium level, residents business lounge, private dining room, spa and gymnasium.

Located in Fitzrovia, 101 on Cleveland is perfectly situated with a range of restaurants, world-class amenities and shopping all within a stones throw. The development is also within close reach of various underground stations including:
- Great Portland Street - 0.2 miles
- Warren Street - 0.3 miles
- Goodge Street - 0.4 miles
- Tottenham Court Road - 0.7 miles

London is home to some of the best universities in the world. Many of these are on Fitzrovia's doorstep including:

- University College London - 0.4 miles
- University of London - 0.5 miles
- soas - 0.6 miles

- Wesminster University - 0.1 miles
- London School of Economics - 1.4 miles
- Central Saint Martins College - 1.5 miles
- King's College London - 1.5 miles

address: Bronze House, Sterling Way, London Square, Islington N7
detailedDescription:
A wonderful and elegant Two Double Bedroom, Two Bathroom Apartment with private terrace, located within the brand new London Square, Caledonian Road Development. Residents benefit from a 24 hour concierge service, access to a private gym and being just ‘3 minutes’ walk’ to Caledonian Road Underground Station.

Rarely available to the open market, this brand new luxury home situated on the ‘4th Floor’ of the Bronze House, has been designed by a world class team to provide residents with fabulous, modern open-plan living. Upon entering the apartment, occupants are met with an open-plan living /dining room with private terraced accessed via full width glass doors, ideal for entertaining guests.

The fitted kitchen is discreet and has been finished with Siemens integrated appliances, composite silestone worktop and backpainted glass splashback. Both double bedrooms come complete with soft furnishings and built in wardrobes whilst the primary bedroom benefits from an en-suite shower room, finished with hexagonal tile design, mirrored finish cabinet, glass shelves with halo lighting and bespoke composite vanity unit with integrated sink and mixer tap. The adjacent main bathroom suite also comprises of large floor and wall tile design, mirrored cabinet, halo lighting, composite basin with single lever mixer tap and renaissance double ended bath with hand held shower and frameless screen.

This stylish apartment further benefits from underfloor heating throughout, hardwood herringbone florring, LED downlights, built in storage space and wall mounted air conditioning units.

• The area Unparalleled transport links, from Caledonian Road Underground Staion:
• 3 minutes’ to Kings Cross St Pancras International
• 7 minutes’ to Holborn
• 10 minutes’ to Leicester Square
(tfl)

• Superb range of amenities and leisure opportunities
• A short walk from a fantastic offering of places to eat and drink, fresh food markets, supermarkets, art centres and leisure centres
• Attractive walking routes with plenty of green spaces, including Caledonian Park, Market Road Gardens, Paradise Park and Highbury Fields<br /><br />

detailedDescription:
Hunters Estate Agents are delighted to market this self contained terrace house. This property is currently offered under a Leasehold Tenure but the Freehold is also available, please contact us for further information. The property comprises 2 Bedrooms, a Spacious Living Room, Separate Kitchen, Family Bathroom, Private Garden and Parking. The property benefits from having a Gas Central Heating System, new Engineered Wood Floor covering laid in the living room, Bedrooms and Landing and new Carpet on the staircase. The property is situated in Elm Village which is a quiet residential area and sort after location of Camden just a short walk from the Canal. This property is ideal for a new family or private individuals looking to relocate in the area.

Entrance
Small hallway with Storage cupboards leading to the living room.

Living Room - 4.37m x 3.97m (47.15ft x 13.03ft)
Newly fitted engineered wood floor covering, 1 light point, gchs radiator, French doors leading to the private rear garden, entrance to kitchen and stairs leading to the upper floor.

Kitchen - 2.42m x 2.28m (7.94ft x 7.48ft)
Tiled floor covering, floor and wall cabinets, space for integrated fridge freezer, under counter dishwasher, washing machine, single sink strainer with mixture taps.

Bedroom 1 - 3.43m x 2.97m (11.25ft x 9.7ft)
Spacious room with Newly fitted engineered wood floor covering, built in storage cupboards, windows to rear.

Bedroom 2 - 3.37m x 1.97m (11.07ft x 6.46ft)
Double bedroom with Newly fitted floor covering, neutral decor, windows to front.

Bathroom
Tiled floor and wall covering, fitted wash basin with mono mixture tap and cabinet beneath, Low level cistern W.C. And pan, bathtub with thermostatic mixture taps and shower attachment with glass shower screen, mirrored wall mounted pill cabinet, wall mounted gchs towel airer/radiator, storage cupboard.

Exterior
Rear garden with paved floor covering, space for flower bed.

Parking space for 1 vehicle to front.

detailedDescription:
Forming part of a Victorian pub conversion, this wonderful contemporary three-bedroom apartment has been architecturally interpreted, adapted & extended to over 1,000 Sq.Ft. Internally and has its own private urban garden.
The property is accessed via its own private entrance, to an extensive paved front courtyard garden, in turn opening to a swing pivoted front door on to a seamless hallway, naturally lit throughout the day by a striking skylight set high within the roof of the dining room.
The apartment is subdivided into two distinctive zones, with the front comprising the entertaining and living spaces with a beautiful lit through-flowing dining room on to the bespoke kitchen and in turn to the reception room. Occupying the rear are the three bedrooms and two bathrooms, one of which is en-suite to the principal bedroom.
The private walled patio garden is westerly in direction and comes complete with York paved stones, a seating area with storage, flower beds with a tree, a living roof over the dining room and additional shed.
The property is fantastically positioned to take advantage of the green open spaces of Hampstead Heath offering a plethora of recreational facilities and leisurely walks. Gospel Oak Overground is also on your doorstep. Grafton Road to the south takes you on to Prince of Wales Road, with nearby Kentish Town & Chalk Farm underground stations giving access to the Northern Line, while Kentish Town West and Gospel Oak are served by Overground. The shops and restaurants of Kentish Town Road and Fortess Road together with Primrose Hill & Belsize Park are a short walk away. The area is surrounded by some of London's best state & independent schools.

detailedDescription:
A rare newly build spectacularly designed contemporary home finished to exacting standards.

Location

The property is ideally located in the heart of Hampstead village in between Hampstead High Street and its many boutiques and eateries and the green open spaces of Hampstead Heath. The transport links include Hampstead Underground Station (Northern Line; 0.2m), Hampstead Heath Station (Overground train; 0.6m) and the various bus links.

Description

An immaculate and beautifully designed residence set over three floors in this remarkable modern house. It is discreetly positioned behind a brick and steel facade within an oasis of calm, named after ''modern' architect Philip Bosinney, a character in Hampstead Village's 19th C. Author John Galsworthy's novel, 'The Forsyte Saga.'

Bosinney is vastly complimented by its unique architecture, breathtaking volumes and really impressive spaces that one rarely sees in houses in the heart of Hampstead Village. The meticulous attention to detail employed and the ingenious development of the property have resulted in a stunning home that flows effortlessly, has large airy and contemporary spaces where one wants them. The accommodation comprises a principal bedroom, two further bedrooms, two bathrooms, guest cloakroom, electric sheers and black-out blinds throughout. The home also includes a utility room, hub room, storage, two terraces and CCTV.

There is a stunning Balinese water garden feature designed by a specialist who builds special effects for feature films, with custom-designed waterfalls, rotating lanterns and sound effects and irrigation system designed for a living wall.

Other impressive features include: Integrated Control 4 Smart Home System for motorised Shades and Blinds and Electric Curtains, Lighting, Security, Audio/Visual entertainment and Climate, monitored and adjusted from home or remotely. Category 6 network cabling. Marantz integrated 7-1 Surround Sound in Cinema Room and 5-1 Marantz Surround Sound in the family room. The house has integrated stereo speakers in every room switchable remotely for all sources including Internet Radio and Airplay streaming. Principal TV's on Video Matrix System allowing Virgin Media/Sky/Apple/Blu-Ray/Security Cameras/Terrestrial TV to be distributed to different zones.

This unique accommodation also has a built in safeguard of two separate hot water systems (gas boiler and electric) as well as two separate heating systems (underfloor wet heating and hot air heating). No expense has been spared in creating this extraordinarily designed home from the specially silver/black handmade tiles in the entrance to every aspect of the design and equipment incorporated in this remarkable home.

Square Footage: 1768 sq ft

detailedDescription:
An elegant family home that has been finished to a contemporary yet classical standard. This gorgeous Grade II listed Georgian townhouse comprises a bright reception room, impressive library/home office and an eat-in kitchen with all modern appliances. There is also a principal bedroom suite with excellent wardrobe space, situated on the top two floors of the house, three further bedrooms (one with an en-suite shower), a family bathroom and a lovely conservatory/second office. The property further benefits from two large vaults situated off the kitchen.

Balcombe Street is a quiet residential street located just north of Dorset Square. It is within easy reach of the green open spaces of Regent's Park and the cosmopolitan shops and eateries of Marylebone High Street.

detailedDescription:
The flat offers well proportioned accommodation and comprises a reception room with a bay, a separate modern kitchen, two bedrooms and a windowed bathroom.

An internal viewing is recommended.

A word from the owner….."We moved here 2 years ago and enjoyed it very much. Neighbours are lovely and the outdoor communal space has been a plus during the lockdown. We planned to stay much longer and therefore we spent quite a lot of money in cosmetic renovations, electrics and plumbing updates. What we love the most is to be at walking distance from Kings Cross, Camden town, and the local parks around here".

The property is located along Camden Park Road which is located off Camden Road, nearest tube stations being Kentish Town (Northern Line) and Caledonian Road (Piccadilly line) and close to Kentish Town Thameslink, shops, cafes, restaurants and bus services from Camden Road in central Camden Town for its attractions including Camden Lock and Camden Market alongside The Regents Canal. detailedDescription:
A very attractive one bedroom second floor flat in a superb Grade II listed purpose-built residential block. This quiet apartment has been very well looked after by the current owner and comprises of a separate eat-in kitchen, a large fully fitted bathroom, a good size double bedroom and a separate reception with smart engineered oak wood flooring. There is also the opportunity to apply for off-street parking whilst there is also access to sports facilities and events space reserved for residents.

The Bourne Estate is perfectly located to access the theatres of the West End, the vibrant food market on Leather Lane and the internationally renowned restaurants of Exmouth Market. Once an area nicknamed ‘Little Italy’ there is an abundance of fine cafes and boutique delicatessens on its doorstep.

Situated in a highly sought-after location, offering an outstanding selection of amenities with shops, bars and restaurants of Clerkenwell and Holborn all within close distance.
