title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
This wonderful Victorian apartment on the peaceful Ospringe Road is just a stone’s throw from Tufnell Park and Kentish Town. Recently restored by its current owner, an antiques dealer, the space retains many of its original features and is particularly notable for its voluminous interiors and its share of a south-facing private garden. The whole terrace is defined by beautiful arched windows on the piano nobile, or main floor, of each building. Ospringe Road itself is wonderfully quiet and rarely used by cars; it is minutes away from Fortess Road with its array of independent shops, cafes, butchers and bakers, and not much further away from Hampstead Heath.

Setting the Scene

Built in the late 1800s, the apartment has fantastic proportions. It is filled with light and has a real sense of volume, thanks to its high ceilings and large expanses of glazing. The current owner has gradually renovated the apartment, revealing details such as the wooden floorboards, whilst simultaneously introducing a more refined palette of colours and materials and updating major spaces such as the kitchen. The open-plan living and dining room is illuminated by an incredible floor-to-ceiling south-facing sash window, flanked by its original wooden shutters.

The Grand Tour

Entry is on the raised ground floor into a wide communal hallway, which leads into the apartment’s corridor and through to the rear of the house. Here, the more intimate private hallway gives way to a voluminous light-filled living and dining room. The original decorative cornicing remains intact, crowning the high ceilings, and the original marble fireplace surround sits atop dark wooden floorboards running underfoot. Shelving has been built into the alcoves, as well as a discreet desk. The current owner has a dining table set up in the bay of the sash window, where it seems beautifully settled.

To the right is a new entryway leading to the kitchen. This space has also been renovated by the current owner, who has introduced new wooden cabinetry, painted in Farrow & Ball’s “Black Blue”, alongside a reclaimed Iroko worktop from Retrouvius, salvaged from a school science laboratory. Handmade Zellige tiles in a mottled cream colour have been used for the splashback, while the new terracotta floor is made from tiles constructed in Saltillo, Northern Mexico, sourced through Milagros on Columbia Road. To the other side of the kitchen is a row of open shelving. A glazed door opens onto a small balcony, with a metal staircase winding down into the garden below. The second half of the garden is demised to this flat, surrounded by walls and planted borders, with a lawn in the centre.

Upstairs, another doorway leads back into the hallway, which in turn gives way to the front of the flat and the bedroom. This room has been painted a tranquil light blue and has jute bouclé carpeting from Alternative Flooring, plus more inbuilt cabinets and open shelving. The room is bathed in sunlight streaming into the beautiful curved windows, framed by original panelling and painted a bright white in contrast to the walls. New white column radiators are found throughout the flat, whilst a bathroom sits in the centre, with a terracotta-brick tiled floor.

The Great Outdoors

The apartment comes with its own section of garden, surrounded by other private gardens and looking onto the handsome backs of the neighbouring houses. This part of Tufnell Park is noticeably quiet and peaceful, despite being so close to so many popular amenities. Ospringe Road is a short walk from the sprawling Hampstead Heath, one of London’s most-loved green spaces and home to Kenwood House as well as extensive sports facilities, a lido, walking trails, cafes and far-reaching views of the city’s skyline. Both Highbury Fields and Regent’s Park are a short cycle from Ospringe Road.

Out and About

Ospringe Road is exceedingly well-located, equidistant from Kentish Town and Tufnell Park Underground stations (Northern Line & City Thameslink). There is a diverse range of local shopping facilities, including the aforementioned shops on Fortess Road, as well as fishmonger Jonathan Norris, butchers Meat NW5 and bakery The Spence Bakery. There is a fantastic wine shop, Theatre of Wine, on Junction Road, opposite The Tiffin Tin which is often cited as the best Indian takeaway in north London. Kentish Town is home to numerous other independent shops, delis and pubs, such as The Southampton Arms and The Pineapple.

Islington, Highbury Fields and Highbury Barn are easily accessible to the south, while Highgate and the open spaces of Hampstead Heath are to the north.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
This remarkable double-fronted detached house is brilliantly situated on Lancaster Grove, between Belsize Park and Primrose Hill. Set behind a large front garden, it has off-street parking for several cars and a wonderful private garden to the rear. The house blends expanses of open-plan living with a series of capacious living spaces across 5,500 sq ft, including six bedrooms and a further two bedrooms within a self-contained apartment on the lower-ground level.

The Tour

The front entrance sits between large double bay windows and opens to a wide lobby and hallway, leading left to a library and office, and ahead to the open ground floor. This spectacular space comprises a kitchen, living and dining room, with oak flooring throughout, interrupted only by series of steel supporting pillars and a dramatic steel staircase at the rear.

Following the sightline from the front entrance, a soaring double-height section of glazing punctuates the rear façade with a pair of glazed sliding doors beneath. These allow light to pour into the space, as does the floor-to-ceiling bay window beyond the kitchen and the south-facing bay window of the dining room. Stainless steel has been used in the kitchen, most notably for its island, which contains a gas-fired Aga.

A hatch in the floor opens to an open-tread timber staircase, offering a route down to the lower-ground level. Much of this floor is occupied by the two-bedroom apartment, which can be split into two separate studios, each with its own access and kitchen. At the rear is a large living space, currently used as a study and meeting room, with access through the glazed bay to a lightwell and the garden beyond.

The first floor also manages to exist as its own suite, arranged around the principal bedroom, dressing room and en suite bathroom, with a sweeping double reception that benefits from the light of two aspects. There are five further bedrooms on the second floor, one with an en suite bathroom, and a shower room between the remainder.

Outdoor Space

The garden at the rear is beautifully arranged in defined sections, obscured from one another by mature beds of fatsia Japonica, Mediterranean fan palms and a plethora of evergreen and seasonal varieties.

Steps lead from the first floor to the enormous flat roof. Planning permission was previously permitted to build a substantial glass living space above the top floor, with roof garden, which would make a wonderful music room. The views from this elevated position are fantastic in all directions.

The Area

Lancaster Grove is located close to the shops and cafes on England’s Lane. Primrose Hill and the beautiful Regent’s Park are a short walk away to the south, and so too are Hampstead and Belsize Park village are to the north.

It is within walking distance of several independent day schools including the Hall, St Antony’s, South Hampstead, St Christopher’s, Trevor Roberts and Sarum Hall.

The Underground stations of Belsize Park (Northern Line) and Swiss Cottage (Jubilee Line) are within easy reach.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
An imposing Late Victorian detached home with a wealth of original features.

Location

Frognal Lane is a leafy residential road that runs between Frognal and Finchley Road. It offers access to the many shops, cafes and boutiques of Hampstead along with the transport links and amenities of Finchley Road and West Hampstead.

Transport links include: Northern Line (Hampstead) approx: 0.5 miles. Jubilee & Metropolitan lines (Finchley Road) approx: 0.6 miles. London Overground Line (Finchley Road & Frognal) approx: 0.4 miles. West Hampstead City Thameslink 0.5 miles.

Description

A rarely available imposing detached house, for sale for the first time in 15 years, and one of only 3 of its type still modelled as a single dwelling. This substantial period residence, which has accommodation over four floors, measures in excess of 4,500 sq.ft., with fantastic volumes throughout. The large and plentiful windows allow natural light to flood in, and the property also offers flexible living accommodation. There are a wealth of stunning original features throughout, a south facing garden, which in turn leads onto a c.3 acre private garden, the use of which is available on payment of an annual subscription – a wonderful private oasis for families to enjoy and for children to play in a secure place. There is off street parking for 3-4 cars to the front of the house, and also potential to redevelop the lower ground floor, subject to relevant planning consents of course. We have commissioned a local architectural firm to draw a suggested sketch of what may be possible, and this is available on request from our offices.

An internal inspection to fully appreciate the potential and sheer enormity of this fine home, is in our opinion, imperative.

Note: Some fixtures and fittings are not included.

Square Footage: 4526 sq ft

detailedDescription:
This unique low rise villa, offering accommodation over two floors only, is for sale with Savills.

Description

Steeped in history, this charming period home was formerly the residence of the Mayor of Hampstead. This unique property was originally converted from two stables into a Spanish style villa. Dating from the early 19th Century the house was, enlarged and embellished with Art Nouveau in the 1880's, and now comprises two bedroom suites with dressing room and two bathrooms, as well as a pretty rear garden and a substantial amount of off-street parking behind security gates. The property also benefits from a garage and occupies a superb position, being approx. 0.2 miles to Hampstead Village, Hampstead Heath and Hampstead Underground station.

Square Footage: 1784 sq ft

detailedDescription:
A spectacular 3 bedroom manhattan style loft of 2,894 square feet situated in Camden. Set on the upper floors, this loft features large industrial windows, 12 ft high ceilings and a private balcony.

Entering the home, you are greeted with a double reception room, a large family kitchen and luxurious bedroom suites. The high specification includes custom designed Italian Scavolini kitchen with Bora and Miele integrated appliances, Duravit Philippe Starck bathroom suites with walk-in showers, Waterworks Taps, Devon & Devon freestanding bathtubs and underfloor heating.

The property further benefits from a spectacular Club Lounge providing residents with a private VIP entertainment venue for relaxation and entertaining. Belmont Street, in the heart of Chalk Farm and Camden.

Chappell Lofts is located at the centre of North West London's most vibrant districts, with Primrose Hill Village and the serenity of Regent's Park on your doorstep. Built-in 1866-67, the Chappell Piano Factory is a magnificent Victorian industrial building, benefitting from retained period features, voluminous interiors, high ceilings and large sash windows. Founded in 1811 Chappell & Co provided pianos for nobility, gentry and musicians with clients including Beethoven, Strauss and Sibelius.

Interior Features

Exposed Brickwork

Wood-panelled walls

Oak parquet flooring

Air-conditioned bedrooms

Exposed beams

Bespoke doors and wardrobes

detailedDescription:
A superb Grade II listed late Georgian end of terrace townhouse offering over 2,200 sq ft of well presented accommodation on this historic cobbled street in the heart of Bloomsbury.

Arranged over five floors, the property retains many fine original features and due its position at the end of the terrace enjoys a dual aspect from both the first and the second floors.

Of particular note is the bright and airy through reception room on the first floor with tall ceilings and two large floor-to-ceiling picture windows which flood the room with natural light.

There is a bespoke, hardwood kitchen on the ground floor with adjacent dining room, two spacious double bedrooms on the upper two floors, including a principal suite on the second floor with a separate dressing room and shower room on the half landing.

The third bedroom is self contained on the lower ground floor with a its own kitchen, shower room and direct access to the garden to the rear.

To the rear of the house is a secluded, York stone paved walled courtyard garden with an attractive aspect over St Pancras New Church.

Duke's Road is a traffic restricted street just off Woburn Walk and runs between Burton Street and Euston Road. The house abuts and looks over the churchyard of the historic neoclassical masterpiece of St Pancras Parish Church.

Conveniently located for transport, Euston station is a stone's throw from the property and provides both Underground and National rail connections. Both King's Cross (Metropolitan, Piccadilly, Victoria, Northern, Hammersmith and City, Circle lines and National Rail) and St Pancras International stations are also a short distance away (0.5 miles). World class shopping, dining and hotel facilities can be found at King's Cross including the newly open Coaldrops Yard amongst many others.

The main campus of University College London is also easily accessible.

Please note that all distances are approximate.

detailedDescription:
A luxurious and contemporary top floor apartment, offering fantastic panoramic views overlooking London's skyline.

Location

This apartment is ideally situated for access to the amenities and excellent transport links of Finchley Road, West Hampstead and Hampstead Village. The green open spaces of Hampstead Heath and Golders Hill Park are also approximately 900 metres away.

Finchley Road and Frognal Overground is approximately 600 metres away and Finchley Road Underground Station (Jubilee and Metropolitan Lines) is approximately 1.3 km away. West Hampstead Underground Station (Jubilee Line) is approximately 1km distant and West Hampstead Thames link and Overground are approximately 900 metres away. There are also three major and frequent bus routes into Central London on the doorstep with two of them being 24/7.

Description

Situated on the top floor at the back of this red brick building is this newly refurbished apartment which offers fantastic panoramic views overlooking London's skyline.

The apartment features an open plan reception room complete with a fully equipped modern kitchen. The bedroom accommodation comprises a principal bedroom suite, two further bedrooms and a further bathroom. All the bedrooms are fitted with walk-in wardrobes.

The fixtures, materials and finishes are contemporary and luxurious. There is Smart lighting in every room that works from an App. The lighting is provided by Easilite and can be intergraded with Phillips Hue lighting. In the living room there is 5 speaker in-ceiling surround sound. Every TV in the flat links to a hdmi matrix which distributes the audio/video around the property, which is also also app controllable. An additional benefit includes plenty of eaves storage space.

detailedDescription:
Positioned on the upper slopes of one of West Hampstead's ever popular Greek Roads is this outstanding five bedroom Victorian family home, with west facing rear garden.

After many years of family ownership the property retains a wealth of period features including ceiling cornicing and feature fireplaces. This charming home benefits from having two reception rooms, eat-in kitchen, five bedrooms and cellar with potential for further conversion (STPP) and front and rear garden.

The ground floor comprises two reception rooms with high ceilings and feature fire places, recently renovated wet room, eat-in kitchen which can be extended to provide the ideal family living and entertaining space and a private, sunny south facing garden.

The first floor includes three double bedrooms (one currently an unused kitchen) and family bathroom. On the second floor there are a further two bedrooms and ample storage.

This popular location is a short stroll away to the bars, restaurants and shops of West End Lane; The Wet Fish Cafe, Gail’s Bakery, Little Waitrose and Alice House West Hampstead to name but a few.

The amenities of Fortune Green including the family oriented Fortune Green Park with its lovely playground and Fortune Green Children’s play centre are a few minutes away. Fortune Green hosts various annual events ​for local residents including Christmas Lights and Carols (December), Jester Festival (July), 2 open air family film screenings (June & August). Garden maintenance and planting (Love Green Sundays), Birds of Bray (October)

Transport - Agamemnon Road is extremely well connected. It is served by three stations: West Hampstead on the Jubilee line, West Hampstead Overground station and West Hampstead Thameslink station.

Bus links include the 139 (Golders Green to Waterloo via Oxford Street) the 328 (Golders Green to Chelsea via Notting Hill) and the C11 (Brent Cross Shopping Centre to Archway via Hampstead Heath).

Schools – Located in the catchment area for top Primary Schools including Emmanuel CofE and also within easy reach of an abundance of private schools.

Fitness – The Gym London West Hampstead and Virgin Active Swiss Cottage located within the 02 Centre which is a fantastic indoor shopping and entertainment centre.

detailedDescription:
With a beautiful, leafy, garden view enjoyed from every room this 1st floor, 2 bedroom apartment overlooks and has use of the most stunning communal garden in the area, only accessible to residents.

Set on the 1st floor of this elegant Edwardian building the apartment does not overlook the Finchley Road. Its beautiful sash windows give the unique feel of being in the countryside, it is truly serene and quiet with only the sound of birds singing heard. This home has a reception room drenched in natural light, separate kitchen, two bedrooms with built-in wardrobes and a spacious, modern family bathroom. The current owners have renovated the apartment to a high standard.

The extensive park-like communal garden is an absolute ‘wow’ factor and it offers a variety of different spaces, mature trees and plant life and is meticulously maintained.

Location - Ideally located at the epicentre of several beautiful parks including the wonderful Fortune Green with its lovely playground and also the Hampstead Heath extension. It is a short stroll away to the bars, restaurants and shops of West End Lane; The Wet Fish Cafe, Gail’s Bakery, Little Waitrose and Alice House West Hampstead to name but a few. The amenities of Fortune Green including the famous Nautilus for the best Fish and Chips in the area and The Gym London West Hampstead for fitness. Hampstead Village and the beautiful Hampstead Heath and Golders Hill Park are within walking distance; and a short drive to Kenwood House. A short bus journey straight into Oxford Circus.

Transport - There are plenty of transport links to choose from: West Hampstead (Thameslink), Finchley Road (Metropolitan, Jubilee); a short bus ride to the Overground Station and also a bus ride to Golders Green station (Northern Line). There are numerous bus routes leading all over the City.

address: St. Pancras Chambers, Euston Road, London NW1
detailedDescription:
An impressive triplex apartment spanning approx. 900sq. Ft in this magnificent Grade I listed development and forms part of the beautiful restoration of St. Pancras Chambers.

With soaring ceilings, wooden beams and a clever split-level arrangement, this meticulously designed apartment combines a sleek, contemporary finish, with the stunning gothic architecture of Sir Gilbert Scott complimenting the 889 sq. Ft of luxurious living accommodation.

Arranged over the fourth, fifth and sixth floors, the apartment enjoys a wonderful mezzanine design, with a living space that is presided over by vaulted ceilings, creating a vast sense of space. A designer kitchen, complete with integrated appliances, staircases that are cantilevered off the main living space and oak wooden floors evoke the attention to detail that resonates throughout the apartment.

The master bedroom and guest bedroom are situated on the fourth floor along with the main bathroom suite and the master Ensuite, all of which are sumptuously appointed and come with ample storage space. Overlooking the main reception area on the sixth floor/upper mezzanine is a separate home-office space, which would be perfect for a work from home arrangement.
Residing as part of the highly acclaimed St. Pancras Chambers development, this Grade I listed architectural icon benefits from unparalleled transport links via Kings Cross St Pancras to the rest of London and the UK. Underground services are available on the Northern line, Victoria line, Piccadilly line, Metropolitan, Hammersmith and City and Circle lines.

Kings Cross and St. Pancras Stations also provide mainline National Rail services to the rest of the UK, and for a quick trip to Europe, the Euro Star service is also located within the St. Pancras complex, giving direct access to France and beyond.

address: New End, Hampstead Village, London NW3
detailedDescription: Behind the quiet facade of this terraced Victorian house in the heart of Hampstead Village, lies a two/three-bedroom home of dramatic volume and light. Extended and remodelled by M.os architects in 2015, the radiant interior - with its soaring glass atrium and subtle palette of materials - has been transformed into a comfortable and contemporary home. The living spaces on the ground floor are bright and expansive with the kitchen and dining area on a slightly lower level. On the first floor, the floating study is lit by a series of surrounding skylights, while the well-proportioned first-floor bedroom can be opened up to rest of the house by a sliding panel. The principal bedroom on the top floor has wall-to-wall cupboards, a sky-lit vaulted ceiling, and an en-suite bathroom. The elevated terrace to the rear of the property has a gorgeous garden view. Bespoke cabinetry has been incorporated into the architecture of this meticulous design, providing seamless storage on every floor. The custom-made Roundhouse kitchen is equipped with a Fisher & Paykel fridge-freezer and a dual-fuel Wolf range cooker with a Teppan-Yaki grill. There is underfloor heating throughout beneath engineered wooden flooring and Italian ceramic tiles in both bathrooms. A four-minute walk from Hampstead tube station and an easy stroll to Hampstead Heath, this house is ideally situated on a quiet side-street, moments away from the restaurants and boutiques of the High Street and an easy distance from some of London’s best independent schools.

detailedDescription:
Change free Three Bedroom ground floor property is home to three large double rooms and is situated in Maitland Park Road - a quaint area just minutes away from a picturesque Primrose Hill park. The property includes a large living room with a balcony, fully fitted kitchen, a bathroom and separate WC.

Striking perfect balance between city life and the serenity of surrounding greenery and parks, this property is ideal for students and working professionals.

Brimming with culture, art, sound, global cuisine and striking fashion, Camden Lock, the famous Stables Market and the high street are just 10-15 minutes away; a tourist phenomenon no matter the season, the epicentre of all things lively and beautiful is practically at your doorstep. Whether you choose to stroll by the canal or get lost in the colours of the market, you're sure to find something to occupy your evenings and weekends. The best thing about Camden? It's always changing and developing further, so there'll always be something new to admire! If views are what you're after, Primrose Hill is a must - with miles of paths and hilltops that overlook the city, it's like stepping into a postcard, proving to be a lush oasis in the summer and a winter wonderland in the colder months. Being only 10 minutes away from Haverstock Hill, you'll find there are plenty of places to eat and shop, with a diverse, inclusive and strong sense of community at the helm within the area.

Commuting from this property couldn't be easier; with bus routes like the 24 and 168, and Chalk Farm being a stop on the Northern Line, the city is open, ready and waiting for you. All bus stops as well as the station are just a few minutes away, allowing you plenty of time for travel. The excellent transport links make everything that much more convenient, meaning you'll have more time for the things you enjoy. This property is at the centre of it all but still retains a sense of privacy and being out of the way, so whether you're stepping out or retreating into your own space for some downtime, this space is sure to accommodate.

Get in touch for a viewing!

title: 3 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
*property market remains open for viewings & valuations in person or by virtual appointment*

A stunning two double bedroom, two bathroom split level apartment set within an attractive period property moments from South Hampstead station. The property has been superbly maintained and appointed by the current owners, offering bright and spacious accommodation with character appeal, luxury interiors and high quality finish throughout. Features include an expansive open plan reception/quality fitted kitchen, master bedroom with large en-suite and private balcony offering far-reaching rooftop views, further en-suite bedroom, gas central heating, double glazing and beautiful floor coverings.

Accommodation comprises entrance hall with stairs rising to the second floor landing, leading into the impressive, bright and spacious, open plan reception/kitchen with wide bay, ornate cast iron fireplace, and ample space for entertaining, relaxing and dining. The kitchen area comprises a modern range of matching wall and base units with work surfaces and central island, incorporating inset sink unit, gas hob with overhead extractor and electric oven below, and further space for appliances. A well sized double bedroom with dual windows and access to a modern en-suite shower completes the lower level accommodation. The top floor is spanned by a superb master bedroom suite, including bedroom with exposed brickwork, inbuilt wardrobes and double doors leading out onto a wonderful balcony with panoramic views. A luxurious en-suite bathroom offers an elegant free-standing bath suite and large adjoining walk-in wet room - elegantly tiled and fitted to the highest of specifications.

To book a viewing of this beautiful home, just visit our website or download our award-winning App.

Location

The property is very conveniently located within moments of South Hampstead station, and only a short distance from West Hampstead (with Thameslink services), Swiss Cottage and Finchley Road stations. Numerous regular bus routes also provide excellent cross-London links. The area is well served by fashionable shops, bars, cafes and restaurants in this wonderful central location.

Lease Information

We understand the lease on the property is 999 years from 31 December 1984 - 963 years remaining. All prospective purchasers are advised to make their own enquiries and verify this information with a solicitor.

Service Charges

To be confirmed. All prospective purchasers are advised to make their own enquiries and verify this information with a solicitor.

Disclaimer For Virtual Viewings

Some or all information pertaining to this property may have been provided solely by the vendor, and although we always make every effort to verify the information provided to us, we strongly advise you to make further enquiries before continuing.

If you book a viewing or make an offer on a property that has had its valuation conducted virtually, you are doing so under the knowledge that this information may have been provided solely by the vendor, and that we may not have been able to access the premises to confirm the information or test any equipment. We therefore strongly advise you to make further enquiries before completing your purchase of the property to ensure you are happy with all the information provided.

title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
An exceptional opportunity to purchase a beautifully presented detached eight bedroom family home (524.8 sq m/5,649 sq ft) located right in the heart of Hampstead Village. This imposing Victorian house occupies a substantial corner plot and features gated off street parking for two cars and a large south east facing garden.

On the ground floor the property provides a beautifully proportioned drawing and dining room to one side of the house whilst the other features a modern kitchen/ family room that is flooded with natural light from floor to ceiling glass doors looking out on to the beautifully maintained garden. These living spaces are complimented with a large family room and media room on the lower floor, both of which have large bay windows with views out to the grounds of the house.

The bedroom accommodation which is particularly generous includes a substantial principal bedroom suite with large en-suite bathroom and dressing room, a second bedroom suite with en-suite bathroom and six further bedrooms and 4 bathrooms.

The property is located at the end of Church Row in the very heart of Hampstead Village with its abundance of stylish boutiques, top performing schools, independent shops and artisan food stores. Hampstead Underground Station (Northern Line) the various amenities and transport links of Finchley Road (Jubilee & Metropolitan Lines & Overground) and the green open spaces of Hampstead Heath are also within a short walk.
title: 8 bed detached house for sale

address: Parkhill Road, Belsize Park, London NW3
detailedDescription:
Comments from the owner:
What do you love most about your home?
It's a peaceful sanctuary - the building is quiet and I love the large windows that overlook the trees in the garden. Having an ensuite bathroom is a huge benefit and not very common with 2 bedroom flats. The secure parking is a great asset and gives me peace of mind knowing my car is safe.

Why are you moving?
I'm moving out of London for a change in lifestyle.

What do you love about the area?
The location is exceptional, you can get into Oxford Street in 20 minutes, with the Northern Line, Jubilee Line and Overground all within walking distance. And being halfway between Primrose Hill Park and Hampstead Heath means there's plenty of green space nearby. There are so many lovely shops and cafes in the vicinity, from Hampstead High Street, to Belsize Village to Primrose Hill.

Property Details:
Accommodation comprises entrance hall with inbuilt storage, leading into the bright and spacious reception room, flooded with natural light from wide double glazed windows and door out onto the private balcony with garden views. The separate kitchen comprises a sleek range of matching wall and base units with quartz worktop incorporating inset sink unit, gas hob with overhead extractor and electric oven below, and further space for appliances. There are two well sized double bedrooms, each with bespoke inbuilt storage, and with en-suite shower to the master, plus a stylish family bathroom with white three piece suite and elegant tiling.

The property is ideally located just a short walk from Belsize Park station, Chalk Farm, Kentish Town West and Hampstead Heath stations, as well as numerous regular bus routes, all providing excellent cross-London connections. The property is also just a short distance away from fashionable Primrose Hill and Camden with their array of boutique shops, cafes and markets, with the beautiful open spaces of Hampstead Heath and Primrose Hill itself, also within a short walk.

Viewings are highly recommended.

The Onyx Building was completed at the end of 2018 with a 24-hour concierge and extensive bike storage, whilst its residents are pampered with service and amenities. The rooftop terrace and conservatory present stunning views across the London skyline and are accessible to all residents.

King's Cross is one of London's most comprehensive redevelopment locations. Steeped in history with a fantastic location, the future of this dynamic area promises constant stream of new amenities, resources and projects. title: 5 bed terraced house for sale

detailedDescription:
We are delighted to offer For Sale this spacious four bedroom mid-terraced property, spanning 1359 sq ft of family living space over three floors in a quiet residential location in the highly sought-after West Hampstead.

The house has been maintained to a good standard throughout and benefits from original period features such as character fireplaces & ceiling corning. Throughout the owner's tenure, there has been much modernisation work carried out such as solid oak flooring on the Ground Floor, a new fitted kitchen & bathroom units. There is also double glazing throughout most of the house.

The Ground Floor comprises a 23 ft lounge with high ceilings and a feature fireplace, WC, and kitchen/diner. The 20 ft kitchen/diner gives direct access to the low-maintenance 15 ft rear garden. On the First Floor, there are three well-proportioned bedrooms and a bathroom while the Second Floor boasts a large principal bedroom with en-suite facilities.

Ravenshaw Street is a designated family play street due to the road being so quiet and residential. Located just of Mill Lane and is equidistant between both West Hampstead (Thameslink, Overground & Jubilee) and Kilburn (Jubilee) Stations. The property is within the vibrant walking culture of both West End Lane and Mill Lane with its numerous independent shops, gastropubs, and Fortune Green.

The property is offered chain free and viewing is recommended.

Summary
Located on the 1st floor of a grand period building, this stunning 1 bedroom apartment boasts high ceilings, large windows and a tasteful finish and benefits from a private terrace. This is a fantastic opportunity for those after an elegant pied-a-terre in one of London' most iconic districts.

Description
A fashionable part of London for over 250 years; Bloomsbury contains some of London's finest Grand Georgian/ Victorian buildings and mansion blocks as well as large garden squares such as Russell Square, Bedford Square and Bloomsbury Square to name a few.
Well known for numerous Health-Care institutions, including the British Medical Association, Great Ormond Street Hospital, ucl and the National Hospital for Neurology and Neurosurgery, this sought-after residential area is also home to the British Museum, British Library and the University of London's central bodies and departments.
Bus and tube links for access across Central and Outer London are excellent with Russell Square and Euston Square Underground Stations nearby, whilst the National and International transport hubs of Euston, Kings Cross and St Pancras International are just a few minutes' walk away. Located just North of Theatre-Land, with easy access to the superb variety of shopping, restaurants, cafés and varied night-life provided within the City and West End, Bloomsbury is perfect for property investment as it combines the best of modern life for those visiting, studying or living in Central London.

address: Belsize Park Firehouse, 36 Lancaster Grove, London NW3
detailedDescription:
The collection comprises of twenty 1,2 and 4 bedroom apartments, each unique in their presentation whilst embracing the rich heritage that this particular fire station exudes. Residents will benefit from a onsite porter and off street parking (limited to selected plots), ensuring that Belsize Park Firehouse provides the ultimate in contemporary living.

Belsize Park, NW3 is discreet, exclusive and utterly charming area of North West London filled with stucco fronted mansions and leafy roads. The name Belsize Park comes from the French for bel assis meaning 'well - situated'. Belsize Park Firehouse is situated within a short walk from Belsize Park (Northern Line) and Swiss Cottage (Jubilee Line) Underground Stations ensuring the development is well connected i.e. Bond Street Underground Station in under 20 minutes. Residents will benefit from the green spaces that characterise this part of London, in particular Primrose Hill and Hampstead Heath which are within walking distance of Belsize Park Firehouse.

Belsize Park Fire Station was officially opened in 1915 and has been described as 'one of the most distinctive and original of a remarkable series of fire stations built'. The building recieved Grade II* listing by English Heritage over 40 years ago and completed almost 100 years of service before be decommissioned in 2014.

Owing to our commitment to keep both our colleagues and clients safe during this period of recommended isolation, we have many self-serve viewing options available to you. These include video walkthroughs, 360 virtual reality viewings and enhanced comprehensive photography.

Belsize Park is one of London's most well-connected villages. Tube stations with fast journey times to the West End and City are a few minutes walk from Belsize Park Firehouse.

detailedDescription:
** chain free ** ** share of freehold ** **garage & parking**

A beautifully presented and rare one double bedroom second floor purpose built flat, on a quiet side street, with off street private parking space and a large garage, that is offered for sale in immaculate condition throughout.

Measuring approximately 506 sq ft, the property comprises of a storage cupboard in the hallway, a double bedroom with fitted wardrobe, a fully tiled modern shower room and a large open plan lounge/diner with a modern fitted kitchen and a juliet balcony and large private loft space.

Features include double glazing, central heating and a secure entry phone system. Off street private parking space in front of the garage measuring 6.7m in length, just outside congestion zone and within 5 minute walk of Warren Street, Euston Square and Euston Station. The garage and parking offer separate rental potential of £500 a month.

The property has a 93 year lease as well as the added benefit of a share of the freehold. The property is also being sold as chain free, and offers investment potential for HS2 regeneration.

Service charge is £800 per year.

Viewings are highly recommended as this property must be seen to be fully appreciated and will make an ideal purchase for first time buyers, couples and investors alike.

Location

Netley Street is a quiet cul-de-sac located off Hampstead Road in the Borough of Camden, moments from Euston, and just outside of the congestion zone.

This location provides plenty of local amenities and excellent transport links, along with having the vast open green spaces of Regent's Park only a short walk away.

The area is home to a wide range of popular shops, bars, cafes and restaurants. Oxford Street and New Bond Street are also close by for world class shopping.

Warren Street Underground (Northern and Victoria Lines) Station and Euston Square Underground (Metropolitan, Circle and Hammersmith & City Lines) Station are both only 0.3 mile away, whilst London Euston Network Rail (West Coast Mainline) and Euston Underground (Northern and Victoria Lines) Stations are only 0.5 mile away, providing fast and easy access across London and beyond.

The A1, A40 and A406 roads are also easily accessible, providing further connections to the M1, M4, M25 and M40 motorways.

Disclaimer For Virtual Viewings

Some or all information pertaining to this property may have been provided solely by the vendor, and although we always make every effort to verify the information provided to us, we strongly advise you to make further enquiries before continuing.

If you book a viewing or make an offer on a property that has had its valuation conducted virtually, you are doing so under the knowledge that this information may have been provided solely by the vendor, and that we may not have been able to access the premises to confirm the information or test any equipment. We therefore strongly advise you to make further enquiries before completing your purchase of the property to ensure you are happy with all the information provided.

detailedDescription:
***exclusively available for over 60's***

***coming soon***

No.79 Fitzjohn's Avenue is a new development in the heart of Hampstead Village on one of the neighbourhood's grandest avenues, offering a wide range of shops, boutiques, cafes and restaurants. The wide open spaces of Hampstead Heath are just beyond, with winding footpaths and outdoor swimming ponds.

Inspired by the Victorian mansion block style and Hampstead's rich architectural heritage, award-winning architects Sergison Bates each of the one, two- and three-bedroom homes offers high ceilinged and open plan living areas to maximise space and natural light.

Owners at No 79 Fitzjohn's Avenue will love the stunning central courtyard oasis, dressed with climbing plants and flowerbeds, where they can soak up the sun and relax away from the vibrant High Street in the company of fellow owners and friends before popping out to enjoy a bite to eat in one of the many nearby upmarket and delicious eateries.

Such an enviable lifestyle does not end there. The beatnik luxury and culture for which Hampstead is famed surrounds both these communities. Owners can enjoy a stroll around Hampstead Heath or the endless artistic and literary delights of Hampstead Village before returning to relax in the elegant and private owners' lounges or wellness area..

Designed exclusively for the over 60's.

*All images shown are indicative and for illustrative purposes only.

detailedDescription:
A beautifully presented apartment situated in Abbey Lodge which is on the outer Circle of Regents Park.

Location

Abbey Lodge is a highly regarded period mansion block which forms part of the Crown Estate. Set behind a private carriage driveway the building is wonderfully positioned on the outer circle of Regents Park. The property is in close proximity to Baker Street Station (approx. 0.5 miles away) and the amenities of St Johns Wood High Street are approx. 0.4 miles away and St Johns Wood Underground Station (Jubilee Line) is approx. 0.7 miles away.

Description

This recently refurbished two bedroom apartment is set within this sought after period building which is positioned on the outer circle of Regents Park. Accommodation comprises a spacious reception room, a separate kitchen, two double bedrooms and two bathrooms.

The property is in immaculate condition throughout and benefits from 24 hour porterage, a communal garden and residents parking on a first come first serve basis.

address: Chapter House, Parker Street, Covent Garden WC2B
detailedDescription:
Set on the second floor, this 913 sq ft apartment features stunning feature windows that characterise the Victorian heritage of the building, an open plan living space with excellent ceiling height, one bedroom and one bathroom.

The open plan living area is beautifully designed, featuring bespoke joinery, and impressive full height doors, with carefully considered rich finishes, including hardwood smoked oak flooring that runs throughout the space.

The Italian Dada kitchens feature stone worktops with full splash backs, Hansgrohe mixer taps, concealed LED lighting and top of the range integrated Miele and Siemens appliances.

The bedrooms comprise a colour palette of soft warm tones to create a calming atmosphere and feature cove lighting, matt lacquer finished wardrobes with interior lighting and plenty of storage.

Boasting large format porcelain floor and wall tiles, the sophisticated bathroom features built-in wall-hung vanity units, together with polished gun metal-finished fittings from iconic Italian brand Zucchetti and sleek frameless glass screened walk-in showers.

Additionally, the apartment also features underfloor heating, as well as a sophisticated air cooling system to principal rooms, keeping the apartments at a comfortable temperature all year round.

Chapter House by esteemed Central London developer Londonewcastle, comprises an intimate collection of 40 contemporary residential apartments housed in a dramatic Victorian building at the heart of Covent Garden, London’s most celebrated cultural neighbourhood.

All apartments benefit from a bespoke concierge service and intimate gym and training studio
with specially selected walnut accessories.

Chapter House depicts an outstanding opportunity to live amongst the character, heritage and culture that Covent Garden has to offer. Tucked away down a quiet side street in the Seven Dials Conservation Area, this impressive development is home to a collection of unique apartments designed with the sophisticated and discerning in mind. Together with its secluded location, within an historic, eclectic and vibrant community at the heart of London’s West End, the reimagined Chapter House is a truly unique find.

Chapter House has some of London’s best restaurants, bars, coffee shops, boutiques, galleries and museums, as well as world-class theatre, opera and ballet, all within walking distance . Perfectly in a primary location, with underground stations within close proximity, Perfectly in a primary location, with underground stations within close proximity, Holborn Station (0.2 miles – Central line, Piccadilly Line, ) Tottenham Court Road Station (0.6 miles – Northern Line, Central Line, Elizabeth Line - estimated opening 2022)

*Photos depict the show apartment

address: Chappell Lofts, 10 Belmont Street, Camden NW1
detailedDescription:
Property Description

Chappell Lofts is the conversion of the famous Victorian era Chappell Piano factory accommodating spacious two and three bedroom luxury apartments

Property Details

Built in 1866-67, the Chappell Piano Factory is a Victorian industrial building, benefitting from retained period features, voluminous interiors, high ceilings and sash windows.
Located across the upper floors, the loft apartment features include industrial windows, 12 ft high ceilings, outside balconies or terraces, exposed feature brickwork and wood panelled walls. Finishing touches include oak parquet flooring throughout, air conditioned bedrooms, cast iron feature radiators and columns, exposed beams, bespoke doors and custom made wardrobes, shelving and joinery.

The loft apartments have double reception rooms, family kitchen and luxurious bedroom suites. The high specification includes custom designed Italian Scavolini kitchens with Bora and Miele integrated appliances, Duravit Philippe Starck bathroom suites with walk-in showers, Waterworks Taps, Devon & Devon freestanding bathtubs and underfloor heating.

The Club Lounge provides residents with a unique entertaining and leisure facility which they can use as an extension of their home and enjoy a range of lifestyle amenities.
Located on the lower ground floor, benefiting from 14 ft high ceiling and direct lift access, the comprehensively equipped Club Lounge is a 2,000 sq ft VIP entertainment venue for the exclusive use of residents. The layout and access has been carefully designed so that residents can host events within the Club Lounge without disturbing their neighbours.
The lounge includes swimming pool, bespoke cocktail bar/dj and a state-of-the-art media, sound and lighting system perfect for private relaxation, a party for over 100 guests or a dinner for up to 50 people.
Property reference 3917960

detailedDescription:
A beautiful Nash residence and adjoining mews house providing approximately 5,340 sq ft (496 sq m) of family accommodation enviably located adjacent to the beautiful open spaces of Regent's Park, Marylebone High Street and the exclusive resident-only gardens of Park Square East and West.

This magnificent five bedroom property retains many of its original period features including high ceilings and cornicing. The accommodation comprises a drawing room, two sitting rooms, a main bedroom with an en-suite bathroom, a second bedroom with an en-suite bathroom and dressing area, a third bedroom with an en-suite bathroom, two further bedrooms, a bathroom, a spacious kitchen/breakfast room, a utility room, study and a gym with a sauna and steam room. Further benefits include a wine cellar, a double garage and storage vaults.

Brunswick Place is conveniently positioned within 150 yards of Regent's Park and allows easy access to Marylebone Village, the West End and St John's Wood. The closest underground stations are at Regent's Park (Bakerloo Line) and Baker Street (Bakerloo, Jubilee, Metropolitan, Circle and Hammersmith & City lines).

detailedDescription:
Very well-presented contemporary 2nd floor 2-bedroom 2-bathroom apartment located just north of Fitzroy Square and a short walk away from Regent's Park. The apartment provides easy access to the West End, local world-renowned universities and the City.

Comprising an open-plan living area with engineered oak flooring, a kitchen with Corian worktops & integrated appliances including a wine fridge, a principle bedroom with fitted wardrobes, an en suite shower room, a second double bedroom (currently a wfh area), a bathroom and a utility cupboard.

The building has lift access.

Local transport links include Warren Street underground, Euston station and Great Portland Street underground.

Close proximity to the restaurants, cafes, bars, theatres and shopping of the West End.

Local universities include - ucl, soas, Central Saint Martins, rada, Westminster, lse and uclh.

Leasehold expires: 01/01/2124.

Wharton Street is an attractive Georgian Street in what was originally Finsbury, sandwiched between Clerkenwell, Angel and Kings Cross. Located 0.5 miles from Kings Cross St Pancras Station, 0.5 miles from Angel Underground Station and 0.7 miles from Farringdon Station.

detailedDescription:
A sleek, bright and modern one double bedroom apartment for sale on the 3rd floor of this sought after red brick 1930's building on Lloyd Baker Street, minutes from Exmouth market, WC1X.

Handsomely remodelled by the current owner, this delightful home is well-proportioned and bathed in plenty of light via no less than eight sash windows. The dual aspect living space overlooks Granville Square and an attractive row of period properties along Lloyd Baker Street below, whilst a useful breakfast bar connects the rear of the room to a sizeable, open-plan kitchen offering plenty of scope for adaptation. The master bedroom itself, is a generous double and the tiled bathroom is finished to an equally high standard, offering shower above bath. The overall sense of this home is clean, tasteful and zen. Further benefits include double glazing, wood flooring and entry phone for controlled access. The property's spacious entrance hallway also contains three sizeable storage cupboards.

Riceyman House itself is one of several listed buildings that make up the Lloyd Baker Estate. It is situated just minutes from Exmouth Market, under ten minutes to Russell Square station and central Bloomsbury, whilst under 15 minutes in either direction to St Pancras International, Angel Islington and/or Farringdon Central.

With a long remaining lease and reasonable service charge this is an absolutely superb prospect for homebuyers and investors alike. Early viewings highly recommended.

address: Hampstead Manor, Kidderpore Avenue, Hampstead, London NW3
detailedDescription:
Few places in the world can boast such richness in architecture and history as the prized north London enclave of Hampstead.

Located on a leafy road only moments from the centre of Hampstead Village, the outstanding new development Hampstead Manor embraces all of the qualities that have long made NW3 one of the most desired postcodes to live in.

Hampstead Manor is only a 6 minute drive to Hampstead Underground Station (Northern Line) in our chauffeured town car. Residents will be able to reach King’s Cross in 10 minutes and Victoria, Oxford Circus and Bank in 17 minutes. Hampstead combines the best of both worlds - tranquillity of village life within easy reach of central London.

This collection of ten homes is the last opportunity to purchase at Hampstead Manor, offering a range of homes from newly refurbished grade II listed 1 and 2 bedroom apartments, 2 to 3 bed duplex apartments and
4 bed, 4 storey townhouses. All homes have been restored with minute attention to detail, making
Hampstead Manor a prime example of British imagination,
tradition and artistry.

On the doorstep of 790 acres of open green space at Hampstead Heath, Hampstead Manor offers a welcome reprieve from London living. Set within 4 acres of landscaped gardens, this oasis is abound with spots to stroll, read a book and enjoy the serenity and
fresh air.

Residents benefit from exclusive access to the state-of-the-art gym and spa, swimming pool, 24- hour concierge service, secure underground car parking, residents’
town car service and beautifully landscaped gardens.

address: Phoenix Street, Covent Garden, London WC2H
detailedDescription:
We are proud to bring to the market this modern third floor lateral apartment, located within a purpose-built block on phoenix street. This spacious and well-presented apartment comprises two bedrooms, two bathrooms, an open-plan reception/kitchen area, a South-West facing balcony and a share of freehold tenure.
The property has recently been finished and fitted with all the latest appliances; boasting bathrooms with Philippe Starck accessories, a top-end custom buit kitchen with a full range of Seimens and LG appliances. Further benefitting from an impressive specification, this apartment includes limestone flooring, programmable underfloor heating, air conditioning, black American walnut joinery, electric blinds and floor to ceiling windows. Matrix audio visual and sonos is integrated throughout the apartment along with a surround sound system in the living room area.
The master bedroom offers an en-suite shower room and a built-in wardrobe whilst the second bedroom leads on to the south-west facing balcony.
Located in the heart of the west end, this apartment sits in the quiet area of St Giles Triangle between Charing Cross Road and Shaftesbury Avenue. Phoenix Street is extremely well located for access to all the retail, dining and entertainment attractions of Covent Garden, Oxford Street towards the end by Soho, and the whole of the West End. The ucl, lse and King's University are also within close proximity.
The nearest Underground stations are Tottenham Court Road, Leicester Square and Covent Garden; with all the major tube lines, along with the main cross rail terminal at Tottenham Court Road with easy, direct access to the City of London and Heathrow Airport.

Vendors Comments:
"We've loved living here on Phoenix Street. After being in the West Village of New York for years, we wanted a place that was walking distance to everything but on a quiet, leafy street. We rented the apartment for 4 years before our landlord finally relented and agreed to sell to us... We're only selling now because we're moving to Brazil!
The location is really special - right in the centre between Soho and Covent Garden. Such a luxury to take an impromptu stroll on a warm summer's evening down through St Martin's Lane and Trafalgar Square to the river, around St James Park and and back through Mayfair or Soho for dinner. I can't count the number of times we decided to get theatre or cinema tickets 10 minutes before curtains up, waking out our door and straight into a production. So cool. I also really enjoy my 15 minute morning's walking commute to the office over on Berkeley Square - there's a really peaceful, neighbourhood vibe to Soho before the city comes alive. In terms of nature, there are beautiful old sycamore and maple trees right outside the flat and a stone's throw from the front door is the stunning oasis of Phoenix Gardens. You can't quite believe this place exists - full of the most beautiful plants and natural, flowing landscaping, it's the perfect place to meditate, read a book or have a picnic. I use the lawn there every morning in the summer as my own personal yoga space (it's very zen!). In terms of groceries, Whole Foods, Marks and Spencers, Waitrose, Tesco's and Sainsburies are all easy walking distance, with a large Boots Pharmacy just up the road.
The building itself is modern, incredibly well built and really friendly with just 9 other apartments. The cut of the flat feels perfect with just the right amount of space apportioned to each room, and the third floor location provides for light and a nice view. We created a discreet home cinema in the sitting room (which we probably used too much, ordering delivery from the endless restaurants in the neighbourhood) and the kitchen/dining room area is the perfect space to entertain in, especially with the flat's new integrated sound system. We've loved having central air conditioning in the summer and a terrace with a view of the gardens - we have lots of happy memories of evenings with friends with the barbeque going and a glass of wine. In the winter the heated limestone floors and walnut detailing always made the place feel natural and warm. Oh and it's very nice to have a large elevator for when you don't want to take the stairs!
Finally the fact that we own shares in the building as well as having the leasehold always provided a level of comfort and security in the longevity of our ownership - a rarity in Central London. My one caution for potential purchasers would be that you might find yourself suddenly very popular with friends and family that want to come stay!"

Notice
Please note we have not tested any apparatus, fixtures, fittings, or services. Interested parties must undertake their own investigation into the working order of these items. All measurements are approximate and photographs provided for guidance only.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
A truly exceptional and unique loft-style penthouse apartment forming the top floor of a boutique development within a landmark Victorian industrial building, offering uninterrupted 270 degree views of the London skyline.

Constructed in 2012, the exclusive Brinsmead development was designed by Heber-Percy and Parker Architects to deliver an unprecedented level of quality and design to Kentish Town. Created from a former piano factory and set behind security gates in a residential side turning in the heart of Kentish Town, the Brinsmead building is within easy reach of a wide range of nightlife, cultural and culinary attractions. Multiple transport links to the City, West End and beyond are within a very short walking distance.

The apartment for sale is the finest in the development. Upon entry, your view is directed through the exceptionally wide and bright hallway, with its light-oak wide plank flooring, through the wide glazed door, to the truly stunning open-plan reception. Situated on the western end of the building, this unparalleled room is fully surrounded by floor-to-ceiling glass to the south, west and north aspects, providing a seamless view through 270 degrees. All the low-profile glazing to the reception can be opened in a variety of configurations to provide full access to a fabulous terrace, with glass and stainless steel balustrade, that surrounds the apartment on all sides without impediment to the view.

The kitchen, open plan to the reception and enjoying the same outlook, features Italian scic units, with a marble-topped island, and a comprehensive range of Miele appliances. A further good-size thoughtfully-designed utility room is discreetly tucked away.

On the south side, with panoramic views to the City, a stately master bedroom suite opens on to the dressing room with a fully fitted range of storage and a magnificent bathroom with stand-alone bath, separate shower, twin sinks and enclosed WC. All the bathrooms feature Philippe Starck-designed bathroom fittings and under floor heating.

To the north side are two further good size double bedrooms, both with extensive fitted storage and one with en-suite amenities.

The extensive terrace wraps around three sides of the building, widening at the south-west and north-west corners, providing an excellent entertaining and leisure space.

The communal areas and passenger lift are of a very high quality and maintained to an exacting standard.

In addition to the fabulous accommodation, there is the added benefit of two private dedicated parking spaces.

address: Chappell Lofts, 10 Belmont Street, Camden NW1
detailedDescription:
Property Description

Chappell Lofts is the conversion of the famous Victorian era Chappell Piano factory accommodating spacious two and three bedroom luxury apartments

Property Details

Built in 1866-67, the Chappell Piano Factory is a magnificent Victorian industrial building, benefitting from retained period features, voluminous interiors, high ceilings and large sash windows.
Located across the upper floors, the loft apartment features include large industrial windows, 12 ft high ceilings, outside balconies or terraces, exposed feature brickwork and wood panelled walls. Finishing touches include oak parquet flooring throughout, air conditioned bedrooms, cast iron feature radiators and columns, exposed beams, bespoke doors and custom made wardrobes, shelving and joinery.

The loft apartments have double reception rooms, large family kitchen and luxurious bedroom suites. The high specification includes custom designed Italian Scavolini kitchens with Bora and Miele integrated appliances, Duravit Philippe Starck bathroom suites with walk-in showers, Waterworks Taps, Devon & Devon freestanding bathtubs and underfloor heating.

The Club Lounge provides residents with a unique entertaining and leisure facility which they can use as an extension of their home and enjoy a range of lifestyle amenities.
Located on the lower ground floor, benefiting from 14 ft high ceiling and direct lift access, the comprehensively equipped Club Lounge is a 2,000 sq ft VIP entertainment venue for the exclusive use of residents. The layout and access has been carefully designed so that residents can host events within the Club Lounge without disturbing their neighbours.
The lounge includes swimming pool, bespoke cocktail bar/dj and a state-of-the-art media, sound and lighting system perfect for private relaxation, a party for over 100 guests or a dinner for up to 50 people.
Video Viewings:
If proceeding without a physical viewing please note that you must make all necessary additional investigations to satisfy yourself that all requirements you have of the property will be met. Video content and other marketing materials shown are believed to fairly represent the property at the time they were created.

address: West Hampstead Mews, West Hampstead NW6
detailedDescription:
For sale for the first time in 60 years, this exclusive residence in the heart of Hampstead boasts a workshop and two-bedroom flat as well as exceptional transport links

Discreetly positioned within a beautiful and quiet cobbled mews, only moments from West End Lane, West Hampstead Mews presents an exceptional building comprising of a flat with a workshop below. The property has been owned by the same family for over 60 years.

Offering approximately 733 sq ft of living space and a 729 sq ft workshop, this exclusive residence is an ideal opportunity for a purchaser to create a well-proportioned home by combing the flat and workshop, subject to planning.

Originally built as a coach house in the 19th century for the large period houses at the rear of the property, the building would be used to stable horses’ downstairs and house staff upstairs. Currently, the flat includes two spacious bedrooms, a reception with dining area, kitchen, family bathroom and boasts an ample south-facing rooftop terrace. Superbly located within a short walking distance from the many local amenities of West End Lane and Broadhurst Gardens, the surrounding area of West Hampstead Mews offers an array of cosmopolitan and trendy boutiques, cafes and luxurious restaurants.

West Hampstead Mews boasts exceptional transport links all within a 5-minute walking distance. West Hampstead Underground Station (Jubilee Line) offers direct access to Wembley, Canary Wharf, Oxford Street and Stratford, West Hampstead Overground offers direct access to Richmond and Stratford, and West Hampstead Thameslink provides direct links to Luton, St Pancras and Gatwick. Residents also benefit from a comprehensive bus network also within walking distance.

Key features:
Workshop with Flat above
South Facing Rooftop Terrace
Ideally Located

address: Woodsome Road, Dartmouth Park, London NW5
detailedDescription:
Architecturally designed apartment with a Japanese twist.

Location

The development sits on the corner of Highgate Road/Woodsome Road.

Woodsome Road is a quiet residential street located in the heart of Dartmouth Park and is one of the area's premier roads. In close proximity to the rolling acres of Hampstead Heath and within easy reach of both Tufnell Park (0.6m) and Gospel Oak (0.5m) stations. The property is also in a good school catchment area with a wealth of primary, secondary and public schools nearby.

Description

The exciting new development sees 2x new eco-friendly duplex homes built on land that formerly belonged to the historic pub: The Bull and Last.

The style of the architecture is a mixture of the classic English Coach/Mews house (Common in Hampstead/Highgate) mixed with the famous Japanese courtyard houses one finds in Tokyo, Japan.

One enters from the street through a large private external gate into an open-air courtyard which gives the property a strong sense of security.

There you enter the front door of the property and go up to the first floor where you find a large family bathroom beautifully tiled with pentagram tiles and Lusso Stone fixtures/fittings. All bathrooms have underfloor heating.

Both double bedrooms are found on this first floor. The Master bedroom boasts and En-Suite and a giant frameless glass window that allows light to flood into the room. This large window creates a double height space within the bedroom.

The second bedroom at the rear of the property has Juliet French doors to allow fresh air into the room with privacy screening to stop overlooking in. The Bedroom also has a large floor to ceiling frameless glass window to fill the room with natural light.

A wow factor comes when one makes their way up to the top floor through an incredible winding natural wood staircase that winds up though a triple aspect glass corner with up and over frameless glass detailing and exposed steelwork.

A beautifully detailed natural oak staircase delivers you into what feels like an artist studio or gallery space that is designed to be a domestic kitchen/living area. This space has 4 oversized skylights and two of them have an automatic opening feature at the flick of a switch – These skylights where fabricated by iQ Glass, the UKs leading specialist in high-end residential glazing.

The Kitchen finished in white DuPont Corian compliments the white privacy screens at the rear of the property and leads the user to open 3 large glass tilt and turn windows that can open up letting fresh air into the space.

To keep the rear of the house private, delicate privacy screens on the rear facade were encouraged by the planning department to gain planning permission for the new dwellings.

This is to ensure the house feels hidden away and at the same time does not overlook neighbouring properties. These screens give the feeling of expensive jewellery adorning the façade and protecting occupants from neighbouring properties at the rear.

Camden's Chief Conservation Officer had a lot of input into the design and likened the house to an ancient Chinese jewellery box in its design concept.

Both properties have access to the benefits of solar panels that are situated on the green roof planted with sedum.

Square Footage: 719 sq ft

An excellent selection of shops and travel connections are nearby at both Kentish Town and Tufnell Park and Hampstead Heath is just a short walk away.

title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
This beautiful, part tile hung, semi-detached family home is situated on what some consider to be the most coveted address in Hampstead. This house was built by E J May, a Norman Shaw pupil in 1883 who did much work at Bedford Park and is one of a pair that were said to be the first modern houses ever built with hot air heating and featured alongside the adjoining house in the 1970’s film The Railway Children.

The deceptively spacious accommodation is arranged over four floors and boasts a welcoming ground floor entrance hall with flagstone flooring which leads through into a wonderful family kitchen/breakfast/family area with an extended conservatory style dining room overlooking the private terraced garden, a guest suite/study, office snug, utility and guest cloakroom all on one floor.

The first floor is accessed via a wide, easy rising staircase with a feature stained glass window and a fantastic double volume landing with central glazed skylight lantern, the high ceilinged 22’ x 18’10 formal drawing room and 24’ x 19’8 reception room both have feature fireplaces overlook the private and communal garden and with the master bedroom suite, five further bedrooms, two family bathrooms and two separate WC’s are arranged over the top two floors.

Private resident’s parking is permitted on the road and the house also has its own private gated off street parking space.

The house was originally built around the pleasure garden of Hampstead’s first Spa which, was popular with fashionable Londoners who visited to take the chalybeate waters and socialise there having balls and concerts throughout the season. Internal Inspections are highly advised by the owners Sole Agents.

address: Chetwynd Road, Dartmouth Park, London NW5
detailedDescription: Located within the Dartmouth Park Conservation Area and moments form Hampstead Heath is this beautifully presented Victorian family home enjoying light open plan accommodation and benefitting planning permission to reconfigure the ground floor creating a spacious and light contemporary kitchen/dining room which leads on to a pretty south facing garden. The house has been recently upgraded and features a large reception room which leads to a characterful dining area/kitchen and to the rear of the property a large garden room with pitched glazed ceiling looks out on to the secluded rear garden. The upper floors comprise four double bedrooms with bathroom and shower room at each level. An excellent selection of local shops are nearby and convenient transport links are available at Kentish Town and Tufnell Park.

detailedDescription:
An extraordinary 5 bedroom family home (3802 sqft /353 sqm) occupying part raised ground and garden levels of an impressive double fronted red brick residence with direct access to an outstanding 84 ft landscaped rear garden. This beautifully appointed maisonette has been meticulously redesigned to create a sophisticated and contemporary home with excellent entertaining space overlooking the stunning garden featuring a 28ft double reception room opening in to a family room and kitchen/breakfast room. This magnificent property features numerous bespoke design features with TV room, study, gym room, utility/laundry room and guest cloakroom/WC. The bedrooms are flexible - on the raised ground floor there is the principal bedroom with large ensuite bathroom, two further bedrooms (one ensuite bathroom and facility for a second ensuite); on the lower ground floor is a further double bedroom, additional bathroom and further self-contained studio/bedroom 5 with kitchen and bathroom together with a separate entrance. The rear garden is exceptional with two distinct areas: Large patio ideal for dining and a further 69ft landscaped and lawned area.

This distinguished superbly located in a desirable residential tree lined street which offers easy access to the outstanding local schools and the many boutiques, cafes and restaurants of Hampstead Village (Northern Line), Belsize Village together with the transport links and amenities located at Swiss Cottage and Finchley Road (Jubilee/Metropolitan/Overground Lines).

detailedDescription:
An immaculate one bedroom apartment in one of the areas best locations.

Location

Warner Street is a side turning tucked between Farringdon Road and Roseberry Avenue. Widely recognised as one of the most desirable pockets of Clerkenwell, home to a few iconic loft conversions as well as some notable office spaces.

Farringdon Tube Station is approximately 590 yards and Chancery Lane Tube Station is approximately 610 yards (source: ).

The property is also ideally located for access to both Clerkenwell with its shops bars and restaurants and Bloomsbury which is similarly within easy reach.

Description

An immaculate one bedroom, third floor apartment in a desirable turning in Clerkenwell.

Part of a small, boutique development, the apartment has a peaceful aspect to the rear of the building. The lounge has generous natural light thanks to the floor to ceiling glass, and there is a private rear balcony which extends to the bedroom.

Internally the finishes are of a high standard and include neat touches such at an integrated Sonos system and pre-wiring for a TV. Further features include under mounted lighting, engineered wood floors, Siemens appliances and fitted wardrobes. There is a lift in the block and the property is offered with no chain.

Square Footage: 474 sq ft

Leasehold with approximately 117 years remaining

detailedDescription:
This raised ground floor apartment is situated within an attractive building on a highly regarded road in Hampstead Village. The exceptional apartment has been refurbished throughout to a very high standard and benefits from high ceilings and period features. Comprising, a principal bedroom with en-suite bathroom and separate dressing area, second bedroom with galleried area and en-suite bathroom, guest w.c, grand living / dining room, contemporary Pogenpohl kitchen / dining room with doors leading to private patio garden. The property further benefits from underfloor heating in the bathrooms and kitchen and Vola taps in the bathrooms.

Hampstead is a highly sought after area known for its intellectual, artistic, musical and literary associations. The area has retained its village atmosphere and charm and offers its occupants excellent cultural attractions such as The Freud Museum, Keats House and the picturesque Kenwood House home to many major open-air concerts, also featured in the film Notting Hill. Hampstead Heath is a main attraction for people looking to move to Hampstead. The parkland includes three open-air public swimming pools and wonderful family activities. The village also has a great selection of restaurants and pubs such as the famous La Creperie de Hampstead, Freemasons Arms, Dim T, Wagamamas, Carluccios, Pizza Express and The Holly Bush. With easy access into central London via bus, tube (Northern Line Zone 2 from Hampstead Station), or just a short drive by car, the location is perfect for those commuting into the city.

detailedDescription:
A unique home built on a near triangular infill in the heart of Primrose Hill arranged over five floors offering versatile and modern living.

Benefiting from a corner plot, this freehold house floods with light on every level through its 25 windows with views to Chalcot Square.

“I bought 10 years ago, gutted it, and moved in with just floors and bathrooms in place. Pretty much everything needed to be done and I did it all over the years as a labour of love” says the owner.

The layout works wonders to give sectioned living, offering something different on each floor as you flow through the house.

“i've always loved Primrose Hill as it’s central, whilst very much a village and still a bit of a secret in a way... Wonderful parks, shops and restaurants within walking distance and the village has a laidback, easy energy. You can walk five mins and feel like you’re in the countryside, yet also be in Selfridges/Bond Street in 20 minutes too, ” the owner continues.

It is rare to see a home with a garage in this area, one of a number of unique features this home has to offer along with a double heighted ceiling to the living room and large windows in the main living space.

The ground floor offers versatile space comprising of cloak room, entrance hall and fitted out garage that is perfect for storing a classic car. It houses utilities and is also used as an extra bedroom on occasion and regular yoga studio. The seller has also ensured the space can easily be used as a kitchen diner with planning granted to install large windows should a future owner wish. An electric roller garage door opens up to the mews.

The first floor hosts a double bedroom, currently used as a reception room, with a shower room to the rear. The second floor comprises of master bedroom and well-designed bathroom with Philippe Starck fittings. Both floors have bespoke built-in wardrobes, exposed brick work and oak flooring throughout with Fired Earth slate (and Metro) tiles in both bathrooms.

The third floor offers double heighted ceilings with large windows in an open plan living/dining room that is dual aspect offering views of Chalcot Square. A well fitted kitchen with bespoke quartz worktops, Neff and Siemens appliances and Philippe Starck tap flows nicely into the living space.

A unique and bespoke spiral staircase brings you to the top floor which has been carefully designed to offer further versatile space. Currently used as an office, lounge and yoga space, it benefits from a w/c and beautiful Crittall double doors leading out onto the split level roof terrace, making the perfect floor for breakfasting, reading the papers or entertaining guests in the summer and watching the London fireworks during the winter with views over rooftop chimneys and the landmark BT Tower
