address: Cornwall Terrace, Regent's Park, London NW1
detailedDescription:
A magnificent Grade 1 listed Regency property,
and one of London’s finest residences.

Location

Cornwall Terrace is situated on the south west corner of Regent's Park, overlooking the lake, on the outer circle approximately half a mile north of The Marylebone Road (A40) with easy access to both The City and the West End. The A40 provides direct access to the M40, and in turn, the M25 is the main motorway link to Heathrow Airport. To the east is St. Pancras International Station for Eurostar trains to Paris, Brussels and the whole of Europe.

The nearby bustling community of Marylebone offers a wide choice of bars, restaurants, hotels, independent shops and boutiques. Marylebone High Street leads towards Oxford Street and Regent Street; two of the most famous shopping streets in the world, containing iconic stores such as Selfridges, Liberty and Hamley’s. Running adjacent are Saville Row, world famous for its bespoke tailoring, and Bond Street, home to exclusive luxury brands such as Louis Vuitton, Burberry,
Dolce and Gabbana, Chanel and Armani.

Description

The elegant façade of Cornwall Terrace is one of the finest examples of London's historic architectural heritage. The Grade I listed terrace epitomises the refined and classic aesthetic of
the Regency period, with its regal architectural features. During its history, residents of Cornwall Terrace have included members of the nobility, admirals and generals, as well as public figures and other persons of distinction.

The property itself benefits from sweeping views over the sculpted greenery of the expansive Regent's Park, and is ideally located just moments from the front door of the famous Boating Lake, which is perfect for relaxing. The residence is also ideally situated for the bustling West End and London's Luxury Quarter, whilst offering security and seclusion in the heart of London.

Comprised of approximately 9,213 square feet, this Cornwall Terrace residency exudes luxury from every angle; from stunning Italian Portoro marble to soft silk carpets, from large scale chandeliers with exquisite cut crystal to hand carved staircases. Every detail is bespoke, with joinery by the world's finest craftspeople, and the expertly curated blend of classical and contemporary furnishings, plus carefully selected antique pieces.

Square Footage: 9213 sq ft

Leasehold with approximately 144 years remaining

detailedDescription:
Please note that we are unaware of any lenders providing mortgages on this estate at the present time.

Forming part of the Maiden Lane Estate, this well-proportioned studio apartment with large south west-facing private balcony is positioned on the third floor of Broadfield Lane. The first phase of the estate was designed by renowned architects Benson and Forsyth in 1979. Broadfield Lane forms part of Phase II, which lies to the east of the original blocks and was built to modifications of Benson and Forsyth’s scheme by Usiskin, McCain and Champion between 1979 and 1983.

The Tour

Located in arguably the best position at the end of the block, the apartment is accessed via a gallery walkway. The front door opens onto a small entrance area where stairs ascend to the living accommodation. The main living room has space for a bed, desk and small dining table, and has a glazed door that opens to a sunny terrace overlooking the communal areas.

Beyond the main living room is a good-sized kitchen, bathroom and plenty of built-in storage space. Freeholder consent has previosuly been granted by the council to reconfigure the space as a one-bedroom apartment with a separate living room.

The original development has recently undergone major refurbishment works alongside an impressive initiative by Camden Council to grow the existing Maiden Lane Estate, the design of which belongs to award-winning architects Hawkins\Brown.

The Area

The apartment is excellently located at the heart of Camden’s £400 million regeneration of the area around King’s Cross station. Nearby Granary Square is at the centre of this exciting redevelopment and is home to Central Saint Martin’s campus and Google’s London office, amongst many other exciting design and tech companies. There is an outstanding selection of restaurants, a Waitrose supermarket and a new Everyman cinema.

King’s Cross St Pancras Underground station is served by the Northern, Victoria, Circle, Metropolitan, Piccadilly and Hammersmith and City Lines, whilst St Pancras International has the Eurostar for connections to Paris and Brussels.

Tenure: Leasehold
Lease Length: Approx. 103 years remaining (125 years from 2002)
Service Charge: Approx. £1,477 per annum (includes building insurance, heating and water)
Ground Rent: Approx. £10 per annum

detailedDescription:
Summary
A beautifully presented two bedroom first floor apartment. The property is light and bright and benefits from a good size reception room, fully fitted kitchen, modern bathroom suite and East facing Juliet balcony. Ideally located overlooking Seven Dials in the heart of Covent Garden.

Description
Set within Seven Dials in Covent Garden, at the heart of London's West End and is a world renowned and unique destination for visitors and Londoners who enjoy shopping, theatre, restaurants, bars, history and culture as well as a broad range of businesses.

Geographically, Covent Garden is located in Central London, bordered by the City of London and Leicester Square. It is within walking distance of Soho, the river Thames, a wide range of parks and garden squares and Trafalgar Square. There are several smaller areas within Covent Garden that are worth exploring such as the traffic-free Covent Garden market piazza, The Opera Quarter, St Martin's Courtyard, Seven Dials, Neal's Yard, and Floral Street.

Behind the wonderfully vibrant streets, Covent Garden is a unique residential area with a huge array of property styles from character and historic period buildings, through a wide variety of affordable, ex-local authority home, to top of the market, state-of-the-art modern luxury apartment blocks.

Transport links are exceptional being served by Piccadilly and Northern Underground Lines at Covent Garden, Leicester Square and Tottenham Court Road Underground Stations as well as a tremendous range of buses.

A striking contemporary three bedroom town house located in the heart of Primrose Hill, set in a gated development of just 4 houses and with underground parking. The house (approx. 2,278 sq ft / 211 sq m) is arranged over four floors with a stunning glazed atrium hallway and floor to ceiling windows on each floor giving an amazing feel of light and space. The ground floor comprises a large reception room and a guest WC, whilst downstairs there is a spacious study area that leads onto both the downstairs patio and the large open plan kitchen/dining area that is perfect for entertaining. There is also a utility room on this floor.
There are two double bedroom suites on the first floor and a third bedroom suite on the top floor with access to a small terrace. Close by transport links include Chalk Farm Underground Station (Northern Line) as well as being a short walk to the open spaces of Primrose Hill Park and Regents Park. Photographs are as previously furnished.

detailedDescription:
An exceptional maisonette on the ground floor of a beautifully refurbished characterful building, quietly located between Covent Garden and Holborn, within the Seven Dials conservation area. This unique apartment has bags of charm and will appeal to anyone looking for something different yet practical in a wonderful central location.

Stukeley Street is a quiet one way street perfectly placed for access to Covent Garden and the West End. Moments from Holborn Underground station and the nearby Tottenham Court Road Station, which is a designated Crossrail hub.

Covent Garden's bustling Piazza is within easy reach (as well as its tube station) and along with it the many dining and retail attractions of the West End. Holborn tube is only moments away, and the major Crossrail interchange at Tottenham Court Road due to open shortly, allowing the rest of the capital to be within easy reach.

In 1967 this building formed part of The Arts Lab on Drury Lane, a modern art hub housing a gallery, theater, and cinema. It has a rich history. Andy Warhol's 'Chelsea Girls' premiered here. David Bowie rehearsed and performed at this venue in the early stages of his career, and John and Yoko's 'Build Around'' was exhibited at the Arts Lab in 1968.

Video available on request.

detailedDescription:
*property market remains open for viewings & valuations in person or by virtual appointment*

Superbly located in a Grade II listed building in the heart of King's Cross, this bright and spacious three bedroom apartment, offered to the market with no onward chain and boasting impressive London skyline views. The property has been well maintained and modernised by the current owner, providing light and spacious, well planned accommodation including a generous reception room, stylish dual aspect kitchen, and modern bathroom. Features include gas central heating, quality floor coverings and ample inbuilt storage.

Accommodation comprises entrance hall with inbuilt storage, leading into the bright and spacious reception room with ample space for relaxing and dining, and door through to the separate kitchen. The kitchen, flooded with natural light from dual aspect windows, comprises a modern range of matching wall and base units with work surfaces incorporating inset sink unit, gas hob with overhead extractor and electric oven below, and further space for appliances. There are three well sized bedrooms, plus a stylish family bathroom with white three piece suite.

The property is enviably located within just a few minutes' walk of Kings Cross St Pancras offering unrivalled cross-London, national and international rail links, as well as Angel station with further underground connections. This vibrant location provides a multitude of shops and amenities, with the Regent's Canal also close-by, and nearby Granary Square offering a further array of fashionable bars, restaurants and cafes.

detailedDescription:
A superb opportunity to purchase this beautifully presented, two double bedroom maisonette with private garden, arranged across the ground and lower ground floors of this attractive period townhouse, in the heart of Bloomsbury, WC1H.

Offered in immaculate condition, this stunning home comprises a separate reception occupying the front half of the property, with an attractive, fully-fitted kitchen/diner at the back, overlooking a private patio garden. Stairs lead you down from the kitchen towards two well-proportioned double bedrooms and a separate tiled bathroom with power shower cubicle. The patio garden is leafy and south facing, whilst the property further benefits from tasteful decor and a very high standard of refurbishment throughout. The ground floor boasts impressive ceiling height and original sash windows offered in excellent condition, whilst the lower ground is also surprisingly light and airy. There are handsome wooden floors running throughout the property with carpets in the bedroom.

Burton Street itself is an attractive cul-de-sac of period properties and therefore a quiet, and much sought after location. Kings Cross International, Russell Square and Euston Stations are all within easy reach, as is the Grade II listed Brunswick Centre and wider amenities of the West End.

The service charge is competitive (sub £500 p/a) whilst 93 years remain on the current lease. The freeholder meanwhile, is Camden Council.

Early viewings of this fantastic home come highly recommended to avoid disappointment.

Available to purchase for the first time in over 30 years, Knight Frank are delighted to offer The Tower House, Park Village West.

The Grade II listed detached original Nash villa offers lateral living space with high ceilings and period features. The property also benefits from secure garage parking and a 110ft south easterly facing garden.

The property consists of 4/5 bedrooms with approved planning granted for an extension of c.1500sqft.

The Villas of the Park Villages were Nash's final contribution to Regents Park and his idea of houses of various styles set in a winding 'country' road was adopted by many Victorians suburban builders.

This property comprises a modern open plan living room/kitchen, two generous double bedrooms, family bathroom, and a balcony/terrace. The living room area has wooden floors with access to the balcony which has been fitted with a tasteful double glazed wooden surround allow natural light to bellow through the room. The kitchen has a Granite stone worktop and return separating the kitchen area from the living room with the flooring matching the worktops, and has all mod cons fitted with floor and wall units. The property further benefits from having the supply of unlimited Gas included in the service charge powering the Combi Boiler and hob, a Gas Central Heating System (gchs) and Double glazed throughout. address: Cambridge Gate, Regent's Park, London NW1
detailedDescription:
A beautiful second floor lateral apartment set within a handsome Victorian terrace

Location

Cambridge Gate can be found on the Eastern side of Regent's Park's outer circle, between Park Square East and Cambridge Terrace.

Regent's Park itself offers a wide range of recreational facilities, including the Zoological Gardens, the open air theatre, Queen Mary's Gardens, the boating lake and tennis courts.

The nearest Underground stations are Great Portland Street (Circle and Metropolitan Lines), which is approximately 300 meters walk, and Regent’s Park (Bakerloo Line) which is also within approximately 300 meters walk.

The City of London is approximately 3.2 miles drive to the East and the West End approximately 2.2 miles to the South. Mayfair hosts some of the world’s finest shops along Bond Street (approx. 1.1 miles), Regent Street (approx. 1.2 miles) and Oxford Street (approx. 1 mile).

The American School of London is conveniently located only approximately 1.1 miles away.

Description

A beautiful second floor apartment set within this handsome Victorian terrace, built circa 1875. The apartment retains excellent proportions with wonderful and open westerly views over the trees and gardens of Regent's Park. The property has a fantastic drawing room and dining room facing the park. To the rear of the property there is a sumptuous principal bedroom suite and two further guest suites. Further benefits include 24 hour porterage, CCTV and two attractive balconies.

Square Footage: 3236 sq ft

Leasehold with approximately 132 years remaining

title: 3 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
8 Stukeley Street is an exciting new development of two luxury apartments within this beautifully converted period warehouse located on a quiet pedestrianised street within the Seven Dials Conservation area between Covent Garden & Holborn. The building has a rich and culturally significant history, having once formed part of Drury Lane's Arts Lab in the 1960's.

Each apartment has been developed with fantastic attention to detail using the highest quality fixtures & finishes, including Miele kitchen appliances, engineered wood flooring and underfloor heating throughout.

Apartment B is arranged primarily over first & second floors, with a private lobby entrance on the ground floor, all connected by a bespoke sweeping spiral staircase. On the first floor, the main reception space has good ceiling heights providing a sense of volume and is flooded with natural light from the large windows front & rear. An enclosed modern kitchen is separated from the dining area, with both rooms having direct access onto a private terrace through full height glazed patio doors.

The upper floor comprises a principal bedroom with en-suite bathroom and a second bedroom with separate guest bathroom.

Particularly associated with the modern art scene of the times, The Arts Lab on Drury Lane was a creative hub housing a gallery, theatre and cinema, where Andy Warhol's 'Chelsea Girls' premiered prior to becoming the film which crossed from art-house to the mainstream with incredible success. Yoko Ono & John Lennon's first joint artwork "Build Around" exhibited at the space in 1968 with David Bowie also rehearsing and performed here in the early days of his career.

Stukeley Street is located off Drury Lane, away from the hustle & bustle of London's West End but perfectly positioned for easy access to the wonderful Seven Dials Village with its cobbled streets, independent shops and the fantastic Seven Dials Market. Nearby, Covent Garden's famed Piazza and surrounding streets offer some of the Capital's finest shopping, dining and entertainment.

Not only is this part of London a world class entertainment and retail district, but also a globally recognised centre for learning. The University of London has several member institutions with local campuses including The London School of Economics & Political Science (lse), Kings College London, University College London, Birkbeck, London School of Hygiene & Tropical Medicine and soas.

Transport links abound with Covent Garden, Holborn & Tottenham Court Road tube stations all nearby, The City also within easy reach by Tube, foot or bicycle.

detailedDescription: An opportunity to combine two exquisitely designed 3 bedroom vantage premium apartments on a high floor into a single and expansive 4266 square feet full floor plate at the new iconic Centre Point residence. Perfectly positioned for the best of London on the cusp of Soho, Covent Garden and Fitzrovia with an abundance of restaurants cafes and retail therapy, in an area that is benefiting greatly from a huge regeneration programme.. This high-end luxury development offers elegant living with exceptional bespoke and designer interiors, beautifully crafted and innovative architecture, 360 degree floor to ceiling windows, refined and classical finishes and picturesque views towards the Parks and the City. Luxury amenities include a state-of-the-art wellness suite featuring a steam room, sauna, treatment room, gym and an expansive swimming pool; as well as a private cinema room, 24-hour concierge, private dining area and a stylish residents lounge where residents can enjoy relaxation moments with friends and family. Conveniently connected next to Tottenham Court Road underground with connection to the awaited high speed Elizabeth line with Heathrow in 23 minutes. Completed and ready for occupation.

detailedDescription:
*property market remains open for viewings & valuations in person or by virtual appointment*

Enviably located within a short distance of West Hampstead station, this stylishly presented three bedroom apartment with private balcony and secure underground parking, set within a prestigious award-winning architect designed development. The property has been superbly maintained and appointed, offering bright and spacious accommodation spanning in excess of 83m2, with modern interiors and high quality finish throughout. Features include a stunning open plan reception/kitchen, modern family bathroom, district heating, double glazing, quality floor coverings, ample inbuilt storage, and long lease. The development itself boasts 24 hour on-site security and well maintained communal areas.

Accommodation comprises entrance hall with inbuilt storage/utility cupboard, leading into the bright and spacious, open plan reception/kitchen with direct access onto the delightful enclosed private balcony and ample space for both relaxing and dining. The kitchen area comprises a modern range of matching white fronted wall and base units with work surfaces incorporating inset sink unit, induction hob with overhead extractor and electric oven below, and further space for appliances. There are three well sized bedrooms, plus a stylish family bathroom with white bath suite and separate WC.

To book a viewing instantly just visit our website or download our award-winning App.

Location

The property is very conveniently located within easy access of West Hampstead (with Thameslink, Jubilee line and overground services), as well as numerous regular bus routes providing excellent cross-London links. The area is also well served by fashionable shops, bars, cafes and restaurants in nearby West End Lane, with Hampstead Heath and Golders Hill Park also close-by for wonderful open recreational space. West Hampstead is also well served by a choice of excellent local schools including two primary schools within a short walk of this development.

Lease Information

We understand the lease on the property is 125 years from 18 December 2009 - 114 years remaining. All prospective purchasers are advised to make their own enquiries and verify this information with a solicitor.

Disclaimer For Virtual Viewings

Some or all information pertaining to this property may have been provided solely by the vendor, and although we always make every effort to verify the information provided to us, we strongly advise you to make further enquiries before continuing.

If you book a viewing or make an offer on a property that has had its valuation conducted virtually, you are doing so under the knowledge that this information may have been provided solely by the vendor, and that we may not have been able to access the premises to confirm the information or test any equipment. We therefore strongly advise you to make further enquiries before completing your purchase of the property to ensure you are happy with all the information provided.

detailedDescription:
Ideally located on a tree lined residential street within the Hillmarton Conservation Area, is this beautifully presented and newly refurbished two double bedroom apartment with private section of a large shared garden.

Occupying the entire ground floor of an imposing semi-detached Victorian conversion, the owners have redesigned and renovated the apartment throughout using a clever blend of both period and contemporary decoration whilst providing modern living. This naturally bright apartment comprises of newly fitted kitchen with integrated appliances and ample preparation space, large reception room to front aspect which is filled with light from two oversized windows, two rear facing double bedrooms complete with built in wardrobes, spacious hall and newly fitted fully tiled bathroom suite.

The property further benefits from double glazing throughout, gas heating with modern combination boiler, wood flooring and substantial private section of communal rear garden.

Hillmarton Road is just a short walk from a number of amenities on Caledonian Road and Holloway Road including Cafés, supermarkets and well known eateries.

Transport links moments from the property include Caledonian Road Underground Station (Piccadilly Line, which is just 5 minutes’ walk (Google). There is also a number of Bus routes close by including 17,91 and 259 (some 24hr services) providing quick and direct access to the West End, City and Kings Cross/St Pancras International.<br /><br />

detailedDescription:
Camden Mews offers a rare opportunity to purchase a contemporary three bedroom townhouse (152 sq m/1,634 sq ft) that occupies an enviable position in this sought after cobbled street in the heart of London’s Camden Town.

The Mews houses have been architecturally designed and built from old coach houses that make each property unique and full of character. The houses have been created to the highest specification, benefiting from design that maximises light, volume and storage. Some of these town houses further benefit from a patio garden and internal light wells.

These homes are not only unique in their aesthetic but also in their design process. The local community were consulted on many aspects of the design so as to create a space tailored to and perfected for its residents.

Camden Mews is conveniently situated within ten minutes walking distance of Camden Road Overground, within minutes of the various amenities of Camden Road and walking distance of the open spaces of Caledonian Park and other surrounding green spaces.

detailedDescription:
For sale by conditional online auction.
On behalf of Chestertons - Camden and Primrose Hill

One Bedroom Apartment

A light and bright one bedroom apartment in a convenient and well connected location in the heart of Kentish Town. The apartment has large windows and high ceilings and benefits from direct access to a flat roof (non demised). The apartment is in fair order but could benefit from some cosmetic refurbishment. Accommodation is generous with well proportioned rooms and had a practical layout with good storage options.

The apartment is located in the vibrant Kentish Town and in easy reach of world famous Camden Town. Local amenities and facilities around as well as shops, supermarkets and some of Londons best pubs, bars and eateries. Transport is superb with Kentish Town (Northern Line/Mainline) and Kentish Town West (Overground) nearby as well as numerous bus routes. Both Hampstead Heath and Primrose Hill are within easy reach and there are direct links to the City, West End as well as the new developments of Kings Cross

Tenure
Leasehold

Auction Method
The auction for this property be conducted online through our online-bidding platform. This is a "Timed Auction", so there are will no other lots being sold alongside this property.
The timeslot for the auction is displayed on sdl Auctions' website. To view this, search for the property via their website, then click onto the property to view the property details. The time remaining to bid, and end date of the auction, is displayed on the page.
You are required to undertake identity checks before you can be authorised to bid. You must also provide your payment details. If you do not provide this information, your registration will not be processed.
When you place your bid, you are deemed to have agreed to sdl Auctions' Buyers Terms (England & Wales) which are available to read on sdl Auctions' website.

Auction type - Conditional with Reservation Fee
If you are the highest bidder when the auction for the property comes to an end, you will enter into a reservation agreement with the seller. You must then pay the applicable reservation fee. You will then have 40 business days within which to exchange contracts and complete the sale, unless the Special Conditions of Sale contained within the Legal Pack specify a different time limit. If you fail to do so, you may lose your reservation fee. During the 40-business day reservation period, the seller is not able to accept other offers.

Auction Fees
The following non-refundable fees apply:
• Reservation Fee- payable immediately when the auction ends. This is calculated as a percentage of the actual purchase price of the property. Either:
(a) 4.8% (including VAT) of the purchase price, for properties up to and including £250,000
(b) 3.6% (including VAT) of the purchase price for properties sold for over £250,000
The Reservation Fee is subject always to a minimum of £6,000 (including VAT). The Reservation Fee does not contribute to the purchase price.
There may be additional fees listed in the Special Conditions of Sale, which will be available to view within the Legal Pack. You must read the Special Conditions carefully before bidding. Any additional fees are included at the seller's discretion, not on the instruction of sdl Auctions, and will be in addition to any fees payable to us. Sdl Auctions has limited control over the content of the Special Conditions of Sale.

Deposit
Deposit
This property is listed under the Conditional with Reservation Fee sale method, therefore the deposit will be payable on exchange of contracts and executed via the solicitors. The amount to be paid will be listed in the Special Conditions of Sale.

Payment Method
When you register to bid, you will be prompted to provide your payment details to sdl Auctions. In the event that you are the winning bidder, your card will automatically be charged a proportion of the Reservation Fee. The payment will be calculated based on the guide price of the property, in line with the fee scale described above. Where the actual purchase price is higher than the guide price, you will be required to pay the difference immediately after the end of the auction, which can be paid by debit card or bank transfer. Payment by cash or cheque will not be accepted.
Example: You win the bid on a property with a guide price of £150,000, but the actual purchase price is £170,000. At this point your bid is successful you will be charged as follows:
• Reservation fee of £7,200 – calculated as 4.8% of guide price - this will be charged immediately after the auction if you are the winning bidder.
As the actual purchase price amounted to £170,000, after the auction, you will be required to pay the following additional amounts on top of the initial payment:
• £960 for Reservation Fee shortfall (£8160 due as 4.8% of actual purchase price)

Legal Pack
Before bidding, you must view the legal pack for the property. This is the collection of legal documents that apply to the sale. The documents will include but are not limited to: Special Conditions of Sale, title documents from the Land Registry and Energy Performance Certificate.
To view the legal pack, first search for the property on sdl Auctions' website, and click onto the property to view the property details. There will be a sub-heading "Legal Documents". Underneath this, you will be prompted to "Log in to view the legal documents". Follow this link, you will then be directed to create an account with Auction Passport to view the documents.
The legal pack can change at any time up until the auction starts so you must check for the most recent version of the legal pack. At the point of placing your bid, you are deemed to have read the legal pack in its entirety, including any changes. Failure to check for changes to the legal pack will not be a valid reason for withdrawing from the sale.
It is strongly recommended that you instruct a qualified professional to review the legal pack and raise any necessary enquiries before bidding.

Special Conditions of Sale
The property is sold subject to any Special Conditions of Sale. These are contractual conditions that are included by the seller of the property - they are not part of sdl Auctions' terms and conditions. The Special Conditions of Sale are legally binding. You are taken to have read and accepted these at the point of bidding, even if you have not done so. The Special Conditions of Sale are available to read in the legal pack.

Registration Process
To register to bid on the property, search for the lot on sdl Auctions' website. Click onto the property, follow the link to "Log in/register to bid", and you will then be directed to create an account with the online-bidding platform provider, eig.

detailedDescription:
Sole Agent:
Set on the entire second floor of this impressive semi-detached period residence, an immaculately presented three bedroom, two bathroom 1540 sq ft/ 143 sq m, lateral apartment, offering an abundance of natural light and well proportioned, flexible living accommodation.
The apartment features a superb 27ft south facing reception/dining room, a large kitchen/breakfast room, a generous principal bedroom with en-suite bathroom, a shower room, high ceilings throughout and the rare advantage of a spectacular double height staircase with a large picture window which in turn fills the property with an abundance of natural light.

address: The Old Dairy, 7 Wakefield Street WC1N
detailedDescription:
This incredible first-floor apartment is set in Bloomsbury’s most exciting development's, the Old Dairy.

With 1141 sqft of lateral space and unique pitched ceiling design, this beautiful home benefits from wonderful views into the tranquil green spaces of St Georges Gardens.

The open plan living and dining area has been carefully considered, with the extra ceiling height adding to the lofty feel, and the combination of both the rooflights and full length windows offering an abundance of natural light. The custom designed kitchen features fully integrated appliances, a stone splashback and countertop and beautiful Blanco brassware. Engineered timber flooring runs throughout.

Both double bedrooms boast soft palettes with luxurious carpeting which provides the perfect calming atmosphere. Bespoke fitted wardrobes offer ample storage space in both. In the master en-suite, twin basins are accompanied by a large walk-in shower. A luxury bathtub is provided in the family bathroom with both bathrooms finished in contemporary tiles.

A separate study provides additional flexible living space.

As a final crowning feature, this apartment benefits from a superb 2nd floor roof terrace accesses by a frameless glass sliding box rooflight

Designed by an award-winning team, The Old Dairy boasts architecture by Stanhope Gate and S333 with interiors by 1508 London.

The Old Dairy is perfectly situated in the heart of Bloomsbury which is at the epicentre of London’s urban vibe, steeped in history but brimming with energy. Ideally located for transport, King’s Cross & St Pancras International, Russell Square and Goodge Street stations are all within a 7-minute walk providing easy access to all corners of London.

title: 3 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
A once in a generation opportunity to acquire the main penthouse at St. Pancras Chambers, an icon of London architecture and perhaps the most revered gothic building in the world, designed by George Gilbert Scott and completed in 1873.

This near 6000 sqft triplex apartment offers some of the most dramatic living space that we have ever seen, with quite an extraordinary scale throughout all of the bedrooms and in particular the main reception of mind-blowing character and proportions.

Currently offered with the completely bespoke fit-out of its distinguished owner, this property offers so much scope for the incoming purchaser to add their own identity to what can only be described as a unique canvas, be it for a grand pied-a-terre, a corporate showpiece in London or bespoke home in a world-class location.

Entered on the 6th floor via a private lift into the huge entrance hall, one’s eye is immediately drawn to the dazzling chandelier that hangs suspended throughout each floor of its domineering influence over the apartment. The ceiling height is reminiscent of a country house and this is shown off to dramatic effect in the sumptuous master bedroom residence, with its two bathroom suites, private study and stunning rooftop views across the city of London. This floor also comprises of two further very large bedroom suites and guest bathroom.

The seventh floor is the beating heart of the property, housing two kitchens, utility room, powder room, the plant room and a separate guest or staff annex.

Emerging from the staircase into the 8th-floor reception room must surely provide one of the most dramatic and unique private entertaining spaces in London. What was once the water tower for the original hotel, this is a room that is both steeped in history but modern in its proposal. The prominent and visually stunning exposed Victorian beams provide an intimacy to this vast space and allow for separate areas for music, games, dining, TV and most prominent of all, a large bar area for entertaining on a grand scale. It is a simply stunning room and one of the great surprises of the London property scene.

St. Pancras Chambers is a London icon; a building that needs no introduction. The building now houses a selection of beautiful apartments, a world-class hotel, a private members club, gym and spa and of course access to one of the world’s most beautiful train stations, with access straight to the heart of Paris on your doorstep. The apartment also benefits from 24-hour security and two parking spaces.
title: 3 bed penthouse for sale

address: Albert Dock, New Wharf Road, London N1
detailedDescription:
This remarkable two-bedroom apartment, with private demised parking, is set within a converted Victorian warehouse in Kings Cross, overlooking the Regents Canal and Battlebridge Basin. It extends to over 2,200 sq ft and has been renovated by the current owners to create a contemporary and light-filled home.

Albert Dock is accessed via a secure gate. The apartment is situated on the second floor via a private front door. A wide hallway lined with floor-to-ceiling bookshelves, leads past bedrooms and bathrooms to an expansive, triple-aspect, open-plan living room, kitchen and dining area.

The current owners have thoughtfully preserved many of the building’s original features, such as exposed-brick walls, structural-steel girders and original Crittall warehouse windows. These are paired with modern interventions such wide Dinesen Douglas fir floorboards, column radiators and a contemporary kitchen with Corian worktops. Tucked behind the kitchen is a useful pantry with additional storage space.

On two sides of the apartment aluminium-framed windows have been added, as have glazed French doors that open onto a Juliette balcony, with westerly views over the canal. The immediate area is wonderfully quiet for central London, allowing for the windows to be thrown open in the warmer months, blurring the division between inside and out.

Large double-doors open from the living area to the master bedroom, where a large with exposed-concrete lintel frames views of the canal. Beyond the bedroom, is a hallway which passes a walk-in wardrobe and a separate dressing room, en-route to a generous bathroom, with double sinks, a freestanding roll-top bath and a separate walk-in shower. Here exposed-brick walls are set against a blue rubber floor.

On the other side of the main hallway is the second bedroom with an en-suite bathroom and a separate utility room, complete with guest WC.

A private and secure covered parking space is potentially available through separate negotiation, with entry to the building through electric gates from New Wharf Road.

Battlebridge Basin is just south of the Regents Canal and across the water from Granary Square, the University of The Arts; Central Saint Martins, and Coal Drops Yard. Kings Cross has become London’s regeneration success story, welcoming the likes of Google, Louis Vuitton, Universal Music and Havas, alongside existing outposts of Caravan, Waitrose, Dishoom, and audiophile bar Spiritland. The Thomas Heatherwick-designed Coal Drops Yard brings Margaret Howell, Tom Dixon and Aesop stores to the canal, along with a fine selection of bars, restaurants and cafes.

The Regent’s canal runs through Islington into Hackney where it connects to the River Lea. There are many excellent pubs and cafes along the towpath, including stops at the Victoria Miro Gallery and Broadway Market.

Kings Cross station is a ten-minute walk away, providing national connections and Hammersmith and City, Circle, Victoria, Northern, Piccadilly and Metropolitan tube lines. St Pancras International station provides Eurostar connections to Paris and Brussels.

Tenure: Share of Freehold
Underlying Lease Length: Approx. 125 years
Service Charge: Approx. £8,600 per annum

detailedDescription:
A beautifully presented and well maintained four bedrooms, three bathrooms end of terrace house with two terraces and a private garden, offered for sale in excellent condition throughout.

Measuring approximately 2,461 sq ft, the property offers a wealth of period and contemporary features which includes:

- Solid and engineered oak flooring
- Double glazed sash windows
- High ceilings
- Original cornicing
- Custom stain glass from master craftsmen Lead and Light
- Crabtree brushed stainless steel power and lighting controls.

There is a beautiful open plan bespoke kitchen/dining room with Neff integrated appliances, concrete worktop and splash back, fitted pantry with storage, horizontal thermal triple glazed roof, Sun Paradise cross over patio doors leading directly onto the Saloni tiled rear patio and an immaculate well tendered south-westerly facing garden.

There are four double bedrooms (one with a private south-westerly facing terrace), a walk-in wardrobe, two shower rooms and one master bathroom with roll top bath and all consisting of underfloor heating, Duravit washbasins, Crosswater taps, Geberit Philippe Stark WC and chrome flush plates, Bette shower trays and Saloni ceramics.

There are two reception rooms on the raised ground floor with a reproduction period fireplace, artisan custom built bookcases and cupboards, floor to ceiling sash windows, original cornicing, shutters and French doors leading out to a south-westerly facing terrace.

Furthermore, the property features York Stone paving, ornate iron railings and gate, state of the art alarm system with door intercom video, dedicated bin, recycle and parcel storage and utility cupboard.

Viewings are highly recommended as this property must be seen to be fully appreciated.

Location

Rochester Terrace is a quiet residential street located between Rochester Road and Wilmot Place in Camden, overlooking Rochester Terrace Gardens.

It is in the catchment area of Camden School for girls and in close proximity to College Francais Bilingual de Londres.

Fantastic transport links are only a short stroll away with Camden and Kentish Town underground for the Northern line, Overground for Stratford and Thameslink for Luton and Gatwick Airport.

A multitude of local amenities can also be found nearby, with Camden Town and Kentish Town both within walking distance.

We therefore strongly advise you to make further enquiries before completing your purchase of the property to ensure you are happy with all the information provided.

Centre Point is the revival of an icon: An architectural classic that embodies the spirit of swinging London and stands as a focal point at the creative and cultural heart of this ever-changing city.

When Centre Point arrive in London in 1966, its bold geometric design and delicate honeycomb facade captured the confidence and optimism and creative flair of the decade.

In a city famous for reinvention, the building is now set for a new life as an exclusive residence in an exceptional location. Set serenely above the bustle of the West End, these 82 apartments are contemporary classics, crafted by renowned British designers Conran & Partners.

detailedDescription:
*property market remains open for viewings & valuations in person or by virtual appointment*

Beautifully presented two bedroom split level maisonette with delightful private roof terrace, arranged over the upper floors of a period property.

The property, superbly located in the heart of Kentish Town offers bright and spacious accommodation with stylish interiors finished to a high standard throughout, including a generous open plan reception/ultra-modern kitchen, two well sized bedrooms and a modern upper level bathroom. Within walking distance to Regents Park, Primrose Hill and Hampstead Heath and well connected to the City, West End and East London.

Accommodation comprises own entrance with stairs rising up into the bright and spacious open plan reception room with two front aspect windows and plenty of space for both relaxing and dining. A door provides access out to the wonderful decked roof terrace with skyline views, and an additional access up to the master bedroom. Further features include gas central heating, double glazing, beautiful hardwood flooring, excellent natural light, extension potential (subject to planning), and long lease. The kitchen area comprises a modern range of white fronted wall and base units with work surfaces incorporating inset stainless steel sink unit, gas hob with contemporary style stainless steel overhead extractor and electric oven below, and ample space for further appliances. To the upper level, there is a family bathroom with white three piece suite, and two well proportioned bedrooms - one with access to the external stairway leading down to the roof terrace.

Viewings of this wonderful property are highly recommended. To book a viewing instantly just visit our website or download our award-winning App.

Location

The property is enviably located in the heart of Kentish Town, just a short walk from both Kentish Town & Camden Town underground and Kentish Town West & Camden Road overground stations, providing exceptional links into the City, West End & East London. There are also a plethora of fashionable shops, bars, restaurants and amenities just a stone's throw away, with Camden's vibrant markets and nightlife within a short walk.

Lease Information

We understand the lease on the property is 125 years from 20 January 2006 - 110 years remaining. All prospective purchasers are advised to make their own enquiries via a solicitor.

Service Charges

To be confirmed. All prospective purchasers are advised to make their own enquiries via a solicitor.

Disclaimer For Virtual Viewings

Some or all information pertaining to this property may have been provided solely by the vendor, and although we always make every effort to verify the information provided to us, we strongly advise you to make further enquiries before continuing.

If you book a viewing or make an offer on a property that has had its valuation conducted virtually, you are doing so under the knowledge that this information may have been provided solely by the vendor, and that we may not have been able to access the premises to confirm the information or test any equipment. We therefore strongly advise you to make further enquiries before completing your purchase of the property to ensure you are happy with all the information provided.

address: Hexagon Apartments, Parker Street, London WC2B
detailedDescription:
A beautiful and well configured 2-bedroom apartment in a luxury brand new development at the heart of Covent Garden, within the Seven Dials Conservation Area.

This would make an ideal and convenient pied-à-terre, and has a versatile layout ideal for a tranquil 'working from home' arrangement.

It is located a stone’s throw from Covent Garden Piazza and the world-class amenities of London’s West End.

Photos are for indicative purposes only.

Hexagon Apartments’ central London location ensures residents can get in and out of the city with ease and efficiency.
A short walk to Covent Garden Station and the Piccadilly Line means Heathrow airport is just
forty minutes away. Twenty minutes by tube, Kings Cross St Pancras International can
whisk you to Paris in three hours when the continent beckons.

Walk five minutes in the other direction to Holborn Station to catch the (soon to be 24 hours
at weekends) Central Line with connections east to Bank and St Paul’s at the heart of the city and west to the markets of Notting Hill. A ten minute walk to Tottenham Court Road Station gives you
access to the Northern Line and the soon to be opened Crossrail.

address: Novel House, 29 New End, London NW3
detailedDescription:
This apartment situated on the upper floors of Novel House, showcases the best form of lateral living spaces.

Location

The charm of Novel House starts with its superlative location in the heart of Hampstead. The merits are hard to ignore. It has the nature of a quintessential English village with the cultured style and social scene of the city. It is so close to the centre of London yet worlds away from its inimitable rhythm.

Full of character and rich heritage, Hampstead boasts a remarkable variety of architecture.

Description

The building harmonises with its neighbours and maximises space, light, and views thanks to the sensitive expertise of KSR Architects.

Internally, lateral living is made both relaxed and beautiful in the hands of interior designer Gemma Gordon-Duff. She calls on a decade of experience masterminding luxurious residences, to set Novel House apart.

Materials are refined and gratifying. Natural stone for essentiality, cast bronze for luxury, old oak for warmth, and the cool tonality of marble for timeless elegance. An emphasis
on British craft is placed on the bespoke joinery, fixtures, and fittings, in honour of Hampstead's heritage and innate quality.

Square Footage: 1758 sq ft

Minutes from the tube at Baker Street, this location provides easy access to Hammersmith and City, Bakerloo, Metropolitan and Jubilee lines, as well as Marylebone train station. The open green spaces of Regents Park are just a short walk away.

description
With Marylebone Road to the north and Oxford Street to the south, Fitzrovia is a sought-after area of London located between Portland Place and Tottenham Court Road. The name Fitzrovia was only officially added to maps in the 1990's although the name seems to have been in use since the 1920's. The streets reflect the history of the area's construction by minor developers, resulting in a prominence of small, irregular and interesting streets which provide a broad spectrum of buildings with mixed use including residential, businesses, retail, educational and medical establishments blended across the area.
From the time of its construction until 1980, the iconic BT Tower, located in the heart of the area, was the highest building in the UK, whilst beneath its gaze are the chic shops, cafés and restaurants of Charlotte Street and the surrounding streets.
Superb shopping can be found in Oxford Street and Tottenham Court Road with Soho and Covent Garden are within a short walk. Ucl, University of Westminster, Southbank International School and University of London all have buildings in the area, whilst the wide-open spaces of Regents Park are also nearby.
Bus and tube links for access across Central and Outer London are excellent with Goodge Street and Warren Street nearby, whilst the National and International transport hubs of Euston, Kings Cross and St Pancras International are just a few minutes' walk away and provide access to the rest of the UK and Europe.

detailedDescription:
Available to view 7 days A week

A bright and spacious two double bedroom share of freehold pub conversion apartment located on a quiet side-street minutes from Euston, Euston Square and Kings Cross St Pancras International stations.

Doric Way is well placed for access to Bloomsbury's many institutions, i., e. The British Library, the new Crick Institute, ucl, soas and Kings Cross Central St Martins (University of the Arts). Regents Park. The Regent's Canal and the nightlife hub of Camden Town with its many restaurants, famous market and live music venues are all in close proximity too.

The apartment offers a total area approaching 600 sqft and comprises: Open plan reception area with a new fully fitted kitchen boasting integrated appliances and with composite worktops, soft-close cabinetry and doors leading to a private balcony, a tiled tiled bathroom with shower over bath, and lastly two well-sized double bedrooms. Further benefits include high-quality laminate wood flooring, gas central heating, and double glazing. Benefiting from several windows and flooded with natural light, this bright spacious apartment offers luxury living coupled with a premium NW1 location.

Offered to market chain free and sold with vacant possession this is an exceptionally versatile apartment and could make for an ideal first purchase, city pied-a-terre or buy-to-let investment.

detailedDescription:
A superb one bedroom first floor apartment set within a sought after portered mansion block located on the borders of Belsize Park & Primrose Hill. Upon entry into Eton place you are welcomed with a delightful and refurbished art deco inspired entrance hall which really does show off the grand nature of the block.
The flat itself is well laid out with the double bedrooms at opposite ends of the flat to a bright and well-proportioned reception. The smart kitchen features integrated appliances and there is also a modern bathroom.
Residents of Eton Hall are provided with off street parking on a first come first serve basis, lift and communal heating & hot water, communal gardens and a day porter.
Eton College Road is a quiet residential street, a short walk away to the plethora of boutique bars, shops and restaurants of Belsize Park and Chalk Farm as well as the vast green open spaces of Primrose Hill with its relaxing pavement cafes. Excellent transport links are close by with Chalk Farm's Northern Line underground station and Swiss Cottage's being in close proximity.
Long Lease of 217 years remaining *** Offered Chain Free***

address: Belsize Park Firehouse, 36 Lancaster Grove, Belsize Park NW3
detailedDescription:
50% now sold or reserved

Flat 9 - A sensational two bedroom apartment (1359 sqft/ 126 sqm) forming part of the newly launched Belsize Park Firehouse. Belsize Park Firehouse is a distinctive collection of exclusive new homes crafted from an outstanding Grade II* Listed former fire station at the heart of sought-after Belsize Park. This unique range of just 20 one, two and four bedroom luxury apartments extends the rich heritage of this fine building with its Arts and Crafts period architecture, preserved with meticulous attention to detail throughout to create thoughtful and luxuriously contemporary designed homes.

Each of the apartments at Belsize Park Firehouse has been designed to the highest specification to deliver the ultimate in contemporary living, safe, secure and highly energy efficient. Attention to detail, using lasting materials throughout has preserved the essence of the building’s remarkable heritage. For buyers looking for a unique home
with a significant history and excellent location, they need look no further than Belsize Park Firehouse.

Belsize Park Firehouse is within a short walk of two of the capital’s most outstanding green spaces, Hampstead Heath to the north and Primrose Hill to the south. Set in a prominent location on the corner of arguably two of Belsize Park’s most sought after roads, the development is situated between Belsize Park (Northern Line) and Swiss Cottage (Jubilee Line) underground stations, together with an outstanding range of schools.

Allocated parking will be available to some apartments at additional cost.

Prices from £600,000 (Leasehold, 250 years) - ready for immediate occupation.
History


Belsize Fire Station was officially opened in 1915. Designed by Charles Canning Windmill an architect of the London County Council Architects Department, it was awarded its Grade II* listing by English Heritage over 40 years ago, being described as “one of the most distinctive and original of a remarkable series of fire stations built”. Seen as a clever interpretation of an Arts and Craft-style house, Belsize Park Fire Station is set on a generous plot and was sensitively designed to blend in to its residential location, noted for the many spacious Victorian and Edwardian homes lining the surrounding leafy avenues. The elevation to Eton Avenue resembles a row of terraced cottages with its tiled roof and tall chimneys while the view from Lancaster Grove is of the stone clad appliance bay frontage with its huge glazed doors, steeply pitched roof and tall hipped dormer windows. Belsize Fire Station completed almost 100 years of service before being decommissioned in 2014. Fire crews from the station worked tirelessly during the two world wars, keeping the service running throughout the London Blitz from 1940 to 1941. Crews from the fire station also attended the 1987 King’s Cross fire and the 7/7 bombings in 2005.

address: Phoenix Place - A6.08.03, Postmark, London EC1A
detailedDescription:
A beautiful 1,390 sq ft apartment with three bedrooms, two bathrooms and a large balcony.

With a stunning collection of one, two and three bed apartments, designed by interior architects Conran + Partners in the first phase, Postmark is an address like no other. Residents will enjoy a gym, 24-hour concierge service, private lounge, rooftop terrace and a beautifully landscaped courtyard.

Postmark is a unique central London development where the energetic, eclectic East meets the traditional, prestigious West. Delivering an inspiring new neighbourhood to the heart of London and built on the foundations of a global British icon, Postmark will bring new life to the historic flagship site of the Royal Mail postal service.

Sitting across two postcodes, WC1 and EC1, and surrounded by Farringdon, Clerkenwell, King's Cross and Chancery Lane, Postmark is at the epicentre of the leading creative, technology and knowledge industries and will be a symbol of connectivity. Additionally, Postmark will also deliver an exciting mix of cafés, restaurants, retailers and public spaces that can be enjoyed by the residents and public alike.

*Please note that any CGIs used are for indicative purposes only

Owing to our commitment to keeping both our colleagues and clients safe during this period of recommended isolation, we also have many virtual viewing options available to you. These include video walkthroughs, 360 virtual viewings and enhanced comprehensive photography.

Located in Zone 1, residents will benefit from Crossrail opening at Farringdon. This will enable travel times of 4 minutes to Bond Street, 5 minutes to Liverpool Street and 8 minutes to Canary Wharf.

Walk times: 10 minutes to Farringdon - 10 minutes to Chancery Lane - 12 minutes to Russell Square

address: Novel House, 29 New End, Hampstead, London NW3
detailedDescription:
On a quiet, elevated street, this boutique development will be the first of its kind in this prime central London location. Set in the heart of Hampstead village, these generous apartments enjoy an enviable proximity to the heath and the charm of the village.

The charm of Novel House starts with its superlative location in the heart of Hampstead. It has the nature of a quintessential English Village with the cultured style and social scene of the city. It is so close to the centre of London yet worlds away from its inimitable rhythm. Hampstead's greenery and scenery have inspired the architecture, materiality, landscaping and layouts. What follows is space and light.

The apartments incorporate high ceilings, picture windows with panoramic views and large lateral configurations as well as beautifully designed duplex apartments. Each shares the highest level of internal private specification, private landscaped gardens and luxurious gym, secure underground parking and concierge services.

Estimated completion Q1 2020

CGIs are for indicative purposes only

Less than 20 minutes from Oxford Street, Hampstead Village has formed in the way that the best neighbourhoods do - with care, creativity and style. Hampstead Village is a magical microcosm; a small locale with a big heart.

detailedDescription: An exceptional and substantial five bedroom semi-detached family home, offering approximately 4413 sq ft of intelligently designed and versatile accommodation, with a West facing garden and off street parking for two cars. This stunning home benefits from high ceilings and ideal family orientated accommodation as well as fabulous entertainment spaces including a huge double reception room spanning 36ft, comprehensively equipped kitchen, large master bedroom suite incorporating a dressing room, contemporary bathroom and an adjoining study/baby's bedroom, four further double bedrooms, four further bathroom/shower rooms, cinema room, games room and extensive storage throughout. An added benefit includes a separate entrance to the lower ground floor which in these times could be suitable for use as a self-contained work/office space or flat. This family home provides the space and flexibility for a family having to work and/or study from home, giving a prospective buyer a live/work balance without having to compromise one for the other. Clorane Gardens is a quiet tree-lined residential street located in Hampstead, less than 10 minutes walk to Hampstead Heath. Excellent transport links can be found nearby, with three Underground Stations located a mile away. Golders Green (Northern Line), Hampstead (Northern Line) and Finchley Road (Jubilee and Metropolitan Lines) all provide fast and easy access into Central London and surrounding. Plenty of local amenities can be found along Finchley Road, including Waitrose and Sainsbury's Supermarket, restaurants, bars, cafes, coffee shops and a cinema.

address: Alma Street, Kentish Town, London NW5
detailedDescription:
A two bedroom split-level conversion with a private garden and additional outdoor spaces. There is a galleried area with an extra 12.8 square meters (137.9 square feet) of accommodation. Forming part of a Victorian terraced house situated in the sought-after Inkerman Conservation Area, close to the shops and transport links of Kentish Town. No upper chain.

The Owners Love
"We feel lucky to have three forms of outside space which is rare in London - 30ft garden, a breakfast terrace and unofficial roof terrace, perfect for catching the sun all day with spectacular views of across the city skyline (ideal to observe the New Year's Eve fireworks)"
"Our large statement open plan living room kitchen area with beautiful exposed brickwork, a real wow moment when you walk up the stairs."
"The street. Best street in Kentish Town. Safe, quiet and community-led, Alma Street is a real gem. Can't wait for the street fair to return!"
"The area - within walking distance for the best parks in London - Hampstead Heath, Primrose Hill and Regents Park. Plus, amazing independent shops, cafés, restaurants & bars"
• "How central we are for the rest of London. The tube, Overground and National Rail stations are all within five minutes"

We've Noticed
The Inkerman Conservation Area is located in the heart of Kentish Town, close to the high street and less than 0.5 miles from Kentish Town underground, Thameslink and Overground stations.
The College Francais Bilingue de Londres Primary and Secondary School is also very close by.

title: 3 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
A striking three bedroom, three bathroom apartment on the sixth floor of this highly popular and prestigious development in the heart of Fitzrovia.

Designed by acclaimed interior architects, Johnson Naylor, this exemplary apartment comprises of a spacious fully fitted modern kitchen open plan and to a large reception room with floor to ceiling windows allowing an abundance of natural light to flood in.

There is a felxible 3rd room / dining room with double doors that can be opened to create an exceptional entertaining space; both the reception room and the dining room have direct access onto a large private balcony with views across London.

The two principal bedrooms are of a good size and have bespoke built in wardrobes with fully fitted modern ensuite bathrooms.

There is a separate shower room and you have the option of using the dining room as a third bedroom. The apartment also benefits from lift access, efficient, smart home technology, the highest level of security and complete environmental control via underfloor heating and comfort cooling.

As a Fitzroy Place resident at Fitzroy Place you will be exceptionally well looked after by the first class team who are at your service 24 hours a day. The Fitzroy Residents Club is open to residents and their invited guests held in Residents lounge. Business needs are also catered for at your request with an executive lounge with Wi-Fi and a conference room will be available to hire for private meetings. This apartment offers a wide range of facilities and a dedicated building management team to ensure that Fitzroy Place is kept to exacting standards. You will also benefit from a private cinema room; there will be a state of the art gym with a massage room also.

Fitzroy Place is within easy walking distance of Regent Street, Oxford Street, Bond Street and Marylebone High Street. There are multiple London Underground stations nearby including Goodge Street (Northern line - 0.2 miles) and Oxford Circus (Central and Victoria lines - 0.4 miles), as well as mainline railway stations at Euston (0.9 miles), King’s Cross (1.4 miles), and St. Pancras (1.4 miles). St. Pancras is also home to London’s Eurostar terminal, from where you can speed to Paris in around two hours. The new Crossrail service is due to open at the end of 2017, which will offer a direct service to London Heathrow Airport. There will be six Crossrail stations in central London and yours will be a short stroll at Tottenham Court Road.

Three bedrooms, three bathrooms, sixth floor, new development, lift access, high ceilings, underfloor heating, comfort cooling, 24hr concierge, cinema, gymnasium.

Approximately 114 sq m (1,231 sq ft).

address: Woodsome Road, Dartmouth Park, London NW5
detailedDescription:
Architecturally designed apartment with a Japanese twist.

Location

The development sits on the corner of Highgate Road/Woodsome Road.

Woodsome Road is a quiet residential street located in the heart of Dartmouth Park and is one of the area's premier roads. In close proximity to the rolling acres of Hampstead Heath and within easy reach of both Tufnell Park (0.6m) and Gospel Oak (0.5m) stations. The property is also located in a good school catchment area with a wealth of primary, secondary and public schools nearby.

Description

The exciting new development sees 2x new eco-friendly duplex homes built on land that formerly belonged to the historic pub: The Bull and Last.

The style of the architecture is a mixture of the classic English Coach/Mews house (Common in Hampstead/Highgate) mixed with the famous Japanese courtyard houses one finds in Tokyo, Japan.

At the front of the property there is a defensible space which is made from high quality materials. Granite stone sets in the floor and a large planter for some plants/greenery.

One enters from the street through a large private external gate into an open-air courtyard which gives the property a strong sense of security. There you enter the front door of the Ground and Lower ground floor unit which boasts a large open plan kitchen living area and opens out to an external Japanese courtyard garden.

A polished concrete floor with underfloor heating continues out into the external private space at the rear so that in the warmer months the inside/outside living is blurred. This space is a wow factor when all the courtyard doors are open.

Huge frameless glass windows allow natural light into this living space with Swiss designed 20mm slim line glass sliding doors that slide away to create more space.

A beautiful bespoke timber kitchen turns in to joinery/storage/cloak room as you enter the property.

To keep the front of the house private, a delicate privacy screen on the front façade was encouraged by the planning department to gain planning permission for the new dwellings, this is to ensure the house feels hidden away and at the same time does not overlook neighbouring properties.

These screens give the feeling of expensive jewelry adorning the façade and protecting occupants from the street.
Camden's Chief Conservation Officer had a lot of input into the design and likened the house to an ancient Chinese jewelry box in its design concept.

A Frameless glass balustrade in the dining area leads one down to the 3x large double bedrooms and family bath on the lower ground floor.

The principal bedroom has its own en suite with underfloor heating and all bedrooms have access to external amenity space. Continuing the architectural language of the Japanese courtyard gardens. These external spaces bring more light and fresh air into the property.

Both properties have access to the benefits of solar panels that are situated on the green roof planted with sedum.

Square Footage: 877 sq ft

Occupying part of the raised ground and the entire garden floor of a substantial double fronted detached period home, this spacious duplex apartment which extends to approximately 3,802 sq. Ft. (353 sq. M.) and provides exceptional volume and space over primarily two floors and benefits from a beautifully landscaped 69ft rear garden and 37’ patio.

This beautiful home has been designed by the existing owners and is flooded with natural light. Additional features include an impressive 28ft sitting/dining room that opens onto the stunning gardens, and a spacious kitchen family room that also opens on to the rear garden.

On the raised ground floor there are three bedrooms, two with en-suite bathrooms (facility for a third en-suite). On the lower ground floor at garden level there is a TV room, Gym, utility room, study, family bathroom, an additional bedroom and self-contained studio with kitchen and bathroom and a separate entrance.
Accomodation & amenities


Entrance hall, lobby, sitting/dining room, kitchen/family room, guest.W.C, gym, TV room, study, four bedrooms, three en suite bathrooms, family bathroom, self contained studio with kitchen and bathroom, residents parking (ca-h), eer-c.

address: Star Wharf, 40 St. Pancras Way, Camden Town, London NW1
detailedDescription:
A large (in excess of 1,000 sq ft), modern two bedroom apartment with private balcony overlooking Regent's canal. Positioned on the second floor of this well maintained and popular purpose built block. The accommodation consists of two good sized bedrooms and two modern bathrooms, one of which is en-suite. The reception/dining room has floor to ceiling windows backing on to the canal and leads into a well fitted kitchen. Off the dining area is a delightful private balcony with views along Regents canal toward the fabulous new Kings Cross development. The property also benefits from secure underground parking.

Located between Camden Town and the new Kings Cross development, both of which can be reached by foot along the Regent's canal. Camden Town underground and overground are in close proximity as is Kings Cross with the International Eurostar terminal at St Pancras.

The building is conveniently placed for access to the City or travelling west to Heathrow Airport.

2 Bedrooms, Reception/Dining Room, Kitchen Bathroom, Guest WC (formerly a Shower Room)

title: 4 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
*property market remains open for viewings & valuations in person or by virtual appointment*

A generously proportioned four bedroom flat with private balcony, set on the third floor of a popular purpose built development close to excellent transport links and amenities. The property would benefit from some updating, but offers bright and spacious accommodation with excellent further potential for customisation to own taste. Features include a large reception room, separate well equipped eat-in kitchen, gas central heating, double glazing, and ample inbuilt storage. Ideal for families or as an investment purchase, the property provides versatile living space in a fantastic central location.

Accommodation comprises entrance hall with inbuilt storage, leading into the bright and spacious reception room with wood effect flooring and door out onto the private balcony. The separate kitchen comprises a range of matching wall and base units with work surfaces incorporating inset sink unit and further space for appliances. There are four well sized bedrooms, plus a family bathroom with white suite and separate adjacent WC.

The property is conveniently located within easy access of Kilburn and Brondesbury stations, as well as nearby West Hampstead for underground and Thameslink connections. There are a variety of shops, bars, restaurants and amenities within just a short walk, as well as numerous regular bus routes for excellent cross-London links.

detailedDescription:
A rare opportunity to acquire a charming detached three bedroom coach house, situated in this highly desirable road within “The Croft’s” area of Hampstead.

The house has been comprehensively updated by the current owners to provide a well balanced home and the accommodation is suitably arranged on just two floors. The ground floor provides a 22'11 reception room, conservatory/dining room, a custom built Poggenpohl kitchen leading to a breakfast area/study and a double bedroom with en suite bathroom.

The first floor comprises a comfortable size 22' master bedroom with en suite bathroom and a third bedroom.

This well presented home is also enhanced by a delightful patio garden and boasts a private secure parking space for one car behind gates.

This beautiful home is excellently located for access to Hampstead Heath and the local schools. The extensive facilities of Hampstead Village (Northern Line) and Finchley Road (Jubilee & Metropolitan Lines) are within half a mile radius.

Discover first-class London living at Postmark

Unfolding in four distinct phases on a 6-acre site in Farringdon, Postmark London will be home to 681 new homes, over 20,000 sq. Ft of commercial space and a host of new public spaces.

The first two phases of this landmark development, West Central 1 and Signature Place, are available now and offer stylish apartments and a collection of premium residents' amenities.

    About Postmark London

    Discover first-class London living at Postmark

    Unfolding in four distinct phases on a 6-acre site in Farringdon, Postmark London will be home to 681 new homes, over 20,000 sq. Ft of commercial space and a host of new public spaces. The first two phases of this landmark development, West Central 1 and Signature Place, are available now and offer stylish apartments and a collection of premium residents' amenities.

    West Central 1 - Move in 2020

    The first phase to launch at Postmark, West Central 1 is a spectacular 13-storey building set around a landscaped courtyard, offering 151 stylish homes, designed by Conran + Partners.

    Signature Place - Completing in 2022

    Set in two striking new buildings around a stunning residents' courtyard, Signature Place is the exciting second phase at Postmark London. Introducing a further 109 elegant and contemporary apartments and a state-of-the-art wellness centre and spa.

detailedDescription:
Located on the raised ground floor of this popular mansion block we are pleased to offer as sole agents this three bedroom, one bathroom apartment in good condition throughout. The property comes with an external storage cupboard suitable to keep bicycles in.

Clarence Gate Gardens is a fine example of the Edwardian mansion blocks built in London at the beginning of the twentieth century. The seven storey, red brick apartments with stone dressings show a number of Arts and Crafts and Art Nouveau influences. Large and elaborate Dutch gables contain two additional roof storeys, with paired bay windows rising the full height of the buildings, joined by sinuous Art Nouveau railings. The blocks have segmental porch hoods supported on pairs of ionic columns. The inner doors have fine Art Nouveau handles. On the Glentworth Street elevations, they feature wrought iron Art Nouveau balconies.

Close to Baker Street and Marylebone Stations and the w...

detailedDescription: An outstanding three bedroom second floor apartment (1468 sqft / 136.43 sqm) with private balcony forming part of a luxurious new development on Belsize Lane. Belsize Lane is an exclusive development of just ten, two and three-bedroom apartments in the heart of thriving Belsize Village. With sensational interiors by multi award winning cid Interieur and bespoke kitchen design by Poggenpohl the apartments exude style, using high quality finishes, detailing and contemporary lighting effects to provide an opulent yet comfortable living environment. The high specification includes Legrand home automation, Sonos sound systems and comfort cooling whilst full height windows throughout create naturally bright living spaces. Belsize Lane is in the heart of Belsize Park with an eclectic mix of restaurants and cafes and a host of independent retailers creating a thriving Village community. Transport links in to Central London are available at Swiss Cottage/Finchley Road (Jubilee/Metropolitan/Overground Lines) and Belsize Park (Northern Line).

address: Upper Park Road, Belsize Park, London NW3
detailedDescription:
An impressive five bedroom maisonette arranged over three floors.

Location

Upper Park Road was laid out for building during the 1850's as part of the grand building work of William Lund. Lund developed around eight acres of land around his own home, Haverstock Lodge (on the site of today's Downside Crescent) that eventually became Haverstock Hill, Parkhill Road, Fleet Road, Lawn Road and Upper Park Road.

This road has been the home of many eminent residents including the author of Cold Comfort Farm, Stella Gibbons, poet wh Auden, actor Robin Hunter, artist Sir William Coldstream and painter, Gustave Girardot. Barbara Hepworth and Ben Nicholson had studios in the Mall studios off Tasker Road before moving down to St Ives.

This property is located approximately 0.3 miles from Belsize Park Underground (Northern Line) as well as the cafes and restaurants of Belsize Park. Hampstead Heath Overground is approximately 0.4 miles in distance offering services to South West London and Stratford.

Description

This delightful family home has been finished to an exceptional standard.

The first floor features a bright open-plan kitchen with a dining area and reception room. There is also a guest cloakroom on this floor. The doors in the kitchen open on to the stairs leading down to the beautiful private garden which is perfect for entertaining guests.

On the second floor, is the large principal bedroom with an adjoining dressing/shower room and a further double bedroom.

The third floor comprises another principal bedroom suite, two double bedrooms and a shower room.

The stunning accommodation is flooded with natural light and offers a generous amount of storage space throughout.

Viewings are highly recommended.

Square Footage: 1944 sq ft

address: Dorset House, Gloucester Place, London NW1
detailedDescription:
Light pours in through the long elegant windows onto the oak floor leading to the oak parquet flooring in the large hallway. This beautifully presented large one-bedroom apartment is situated within an elegant 1930’s Art Deco mansion block with 24-hour concierge and security. Located in the Marylebone area of Westminster, this fabulous 5th floor apartment has bright interiors, generous proportions and is in pristine condition with warm finishes.

One-bedroom apartments are rarely for sale in Dorset House because the location is so sought-after; close to a number of excellent celebrated restaurants, cafes and bars, whilst Oxford Street, Harley Street, Euston and Marylebone train stations, the Princess Grace and St. Mary’s hospitals, the University of Westminster, and the London Business School are also nearby. This is a high-quality finished apartment in a well-maintained mansion block which would equally serve as an investment, pied-à-terre or stylish home.

Key Features:

- Set within a striking 1930’s Art Deco building with past links to the film industry.

- Foyer and reception refurbished in 2020 sympathetic to original design.

- 24-hour concierge and security.

- Services include heating and hot water.

- Practically-designed kitchen offers good cupboard space and integrated appliances.

- Well-presented modern bathroom.

- Generous bay-fronted reception room

- Bay-fronted double bedroom with John Lewis built-in storage.

Local Area:

Regent’s Park and Hyde Park are close by with award-winning rose gardens and flower beds, boating lakes, bandstands and cafes. Just around the corner is the Sherlock Holmes museum at 221B Baker Street and a little further is Madame Tussauds, Lord’s Cricket Ground and Marble Arch. A shopper’s paradise is found at Oxford Street and the West End and there’s numerous museums, art galleries and places of interest.

Ground Rent: £100 per annum (2020)
